Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: LakeEmily03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost on a quick trip to Key West for a night away from the kids. Booked the room last minute and got a fantastic deal for one night. The room was amazing - beautiful contemporary furnishings with a huge bed and bathroom. The room had a balcony, but it overlooked the main entrance and parking lot, so we didn't really use it. One of the most comfortable hotel room beds I have ever slept in. We were very please and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sylvia6517
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the photos on their website or on their brochures. All of the rooms are not that nice. When we checked in our room was tiny, old, dirty, dull, drab, and gross! When we asked about upgrading to a better room, we were told we would have to change rooms every night of our three night stay. This was not even during busy season, this was a Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday in March. They were not at all accomodating. I'd never stay there again, and would advise others not to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out well for us.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine3
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because, frankly, it was affordable here at peak time. We were disappointed with the basic motel type room and no view. I wished that I had splurged on a balcony with a view of the pool. However, there was lots of storage, the beds were comfortable, and the room was cool and dark for good sleeping after a long hot day. The location was not bad - quite a walk up to north Duval and the harbor, so hesitated to do it more than once a day. Tended to stay close to the hotel for either the first half or second half of the day rather make the trek multiple times. Loved the three pools to which we had access and made use of the close proximity to South Beach for a beach half day. The onsite cafe was handy and pleasant with a great setting on the beach. Given the friendly staff and the amenities, I think it was a pretty good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferlauren284
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the southermost hotel for a few days and had a wonderful experience. It's one of the best deals you can get for your $ in Key West. I looked into a lot of resorts to stay in and they were either too far away from Duval Street or had hidden fees. This hotel is directly on Duval street which made it super convenient that we could walk everywhere for dinner, the bars, or events such as jet skiing that we did. Also no fee for parking, wi fi, or any resort daily fee...most all the other resorts had these fees. We paid $260 a night for a balcony king size bed room and it was a beautiful room. It was very clean...the hotel does a fabulous job with keeping it updated and worked on. My favorite part of this hotel was actually the bar by the pool...the Shores Pineapple Bar...for a few different reasons. One being that the bartenders there are excellent. They are so friendly and make you feel right at home. They make fabulous drinks and the chairs are comfortable. I liked this bar alot too because it's nice and quiet. We were there every day and there were only a few people there at a time. If the beach is more your style do not fear! Their other hotel is right across the street called the southernmost on the beach and you can use everything there too..the beach and the beach cafe. I personally preferred hanging out at the pineapple bar at the southernmost hotel because the beach and cafe at the southermost on the beach was always alot more crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Gift Shop”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Gift Shop on the property of the Southernmost Hotel was delightful. The gifts were unique and reasonably priced. I especially appreciated the selection of T-Shirts which were not the run of the mill you found in all of the other Key West shops. Don't miss the opportunity for a pleasant shopping experience with a very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “southernmost hotel key west”
Reviews.Author: marybeth259
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, a saturday and sunday night. the room was rather small but was clean, the bed was comfortable. the grounds and pools were very well kept up. It was very nice to be right on Duval street. we were on the 2nd floor, nice little balcony facing parking lot. we had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room, loved all of that! we had access to the beach and pool of southern most hotel on the beach, that was nice. all in all, nice place, a little pricey, but it's Key West, like we were warned!

Reviews.Title: “Key west Paradise”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful! Stroll down Duval Street right out your door. We enjoyed renting bikes right there at the hotel. The Southernmost Beach and open air Restaurant are just across the street. We went to breakfast (very good and resonably priced) and walked not three feet to lounge chairs in the sand which were complimentary with hotel key. Staff very friendly and helpful. This is a definite return visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in KW”
Reviews.Author: DustinTimmons
Reviews.Content: Stayed in oceanside king room and although spendy it exceeded our expectations. We have traveled frequently to KW and enjoy the highlights of Duval but appreciate the quiet seclusion equally as well. we had front and side views of the ocean we were right on top of and could hear the waves and rustling of the palms. The pool however does not offer the same ocean view as the southermost house and overall the grounds are large and not as intimate. Overall, nicest room we have ever stayed in and we consider ourselves seasoned travelers, especially to KW, who occasionally indulge in extravagant rooms. Convenient access to the beach as well with free chairs if staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: SherriePuffer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Southernmost Hotel last month. We had a first floor room across from the adults only pool which was lovely and quiet. Though no ocean views on this side, the beach and pier was just across the street. Loved the convenient but much quieter end of Duval. We're walkers so absolutely no need for a car-wonderful restaurants etc. all within walking distance. We'll definitely be back -room was very comfortable, amenities and service. We had no meals there-too many great restaurants in the area. I

Reviews.Title: “Absolute paradise/future wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: Mary Kate W
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent a wonderful long weekend over President's Day at the Southernmost Hotel. We were down scouting wedding locations and were so impressed with the Southernmost Collection, we've booked my wedding for Jan. 2013 at the Southernmost on the Beach! Our room was gorgeous and the patio overlooking the pool was the perfect spot to sit and enjoy the view. We always had great service at the Pineapple Bar as well as the Southernmost Cafe across the street. Normally when we stay in Key West we rent a small vacation home but we loved the amenities at the Southernmost Collection as well as the location. I've always stayed closer to Mallory Square but I enjoyed the pace at this end of Duval Street and was still within an easy walk or cab ride of the action at Mallory Square. I can't wait to share this wonderful resort with my family and friends for my wedding next year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girls getaway spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: Madt0wnGirl
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to spend 3 wonderful days and 2 nights at this location! It was the perfect place for a girls getaway. The location was wonderful for walking to pretty much anywhere we wanted to go - Mallory Square, shopping on Duval street, dining out, etc. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. Loved having the option of 3 pools and access to multiple properties. It was nice having planned activities available - water aerobics, wine/beer tasting and live music around the pools! Will definitely stay here on my next trip and would recommend to anyone considering a trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynda D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Southernmost Hotel for 8 nights and were extremely pleased. The location is awesome and everything the Hotel offers is exceptional. All staff is wonderful whether it be front desk ,property caretakers or maids. All have a smile on their face and hello how are. The pools and beach are wonderful too. If a person just wants to relax and read a book they have a tranquilty pool to chill. I prefer the pool with the pinapple bar where they had wonderful live music Thursday thru Saturday for a few hours. Their Coconut drink is the best!! I am making my reservation next year and cant wait to get back to Southermost Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sal m
Reviews.Content: room, pool, service, location all great. would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Low key relaxing fun”
Reviews.Author: Lois S
Reviews.Content: My three adult daughters and I spent some lovely days enjoying well-appointed rooms in a beautifully landscaped complex, starting with morning coffee on our small patios. Mostly we spent time by or in any of the three different pools - one very large and family-oriented, a medium size one for play and relaxing, and the "Tranquility" pool for a morning water aerobics class (it's intended thereafter for peaceful reading, meditating, napping etc.) The level of activities offered every hour or two is designed to be low-key, multi-generational, with everyone made welcome. The entire staff makes you feel part of an extended family from the first hour you arrive and goes above and beyond what you'd expect in a busy place - and they always seem relaxed!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dewey S
Reviews.Content: Third year in a row staying here and again the stay was perfect. Every member of the staff is genuinely friendly and service oriented. The Pineapple bar bartender remembered my name without hesitation despite it being a year. (This is a tribute to Tim, not a statement on how much time spent at the bar. :-)) Rooms are nice clean and comfortable, many with a private balcony. They let us check in early and even though check out was 11 AM they without hesitation kept our baggage, gave us a restroom key and welcomed us to all the property facilities as well as arranged for a cab for our 7 PM flight. Location is a nice walk to the "action" on Duval but far enough to enjoy a quiet night's sleep. It is a quick walk across Simonton St to the beach restaurant and beach access. You can take advantage of the beach access even if not staying at the beach front hotel. We highly recommend the Southernmost properties and am looking forward to getting back down there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneB6013
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff was friendly and accomodating and the room was great. There is a bar right at the pool. There is ample parking which is important here. It is also within walking distance to everything. If I ever go back this is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rljw
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in the Keys and this hotel turned out to be in a great location. We were able to walk any place we wanted to see, yet, it is away from any noise. It is not a short walk from the hotel to Mallory Square, but everything else is on the way. The pools were great. We had such a short stay (2 nights) that we missed going to the cafe on the beach. The staff was excellent. They were friendly and very efficient. When we return, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and various properties make it great fun.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location allows for a quiet getaway yet close to actions. No need to rent a car. Bikes give access to great island adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Raymond K
Reviews.Content: Best location on Key West - close enough to walk or bike to all sights. 2 great pools and poolbars to use, share all ammenities with Southermost on the beach. Room had overwhelming scent of too much carpet deoderizer, or would have given excellent rating. Staff very pleasant and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: pshoe0528
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Southernmost Hotel last week. Our room 296 had recently been renovated and was fabulous. The color palette was navy, white, blues, and browns so it incorporated the blues of the sea without being overly "beachy". Storage was great, plenty of hanging space as well as drawer space. There are even drawers in the bathroom and plenty of counter space. Nice toiletries and a real hair dryer - not one of those crappy wall-mounted things. The bed was a little soft for our taste but the linens were nice. There is also a mini fridge and coffee maker as well as free coffee in the lobby. The balcony has two chairs and a small table. I can't say enough about how well planned this room was, I appreciated the attention to details. You have access to the pool and beach area of Southernmost on the Beach also. We spent one afternoon at their pool where they had chair side beverage and food service. The Pineapple Bar at the Southernmost Hotel pool was good but you had to go to the bar for service. There is also a pier with chairs. We went there one evening to view the sunset. Unfortunately, cell towers and satellite dishes installed on the point beyond the southern most point in the US marker really spoils the view but we thought it was better than the circus at Mallory Square. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 12:30 but the front desk gave us coupons for cocktails and offered to store the luggage which wasn't necessary since we had a car. That was another reason I chose this hotel - free parking and WiFi and beach chairs with no resort fee. We went to the Pineapple Bar to enjoy our free cocktails then walked down to the cafe for lunch. The food and service at the cafe were both fine, but nothing exceptional. Best part of eating there is the convenient location and the view. Alan the concierge was great with restaurant recommendations and booking a sunset sail on the America 2.0. We had originally booked 3 days. On our last day we had a change of plans and requested an additional day. The desk clerk said they were fully booked but to check back in the morning. When we did they were able to accommodate our request and we stayed in our same room. We did not book any spa services so I can't comment on that. All of the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the location since you have access to the beach and you can still walk to everything on Duvall, however it is quite a hike all the way to Mallory Square. We also rented bikes and enjoyed riding around town during the day. Parking a car around town is not always easy. We would definitely retun to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dlpryor
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West so we were not sure what to expect. The Southernmost was located on a very small beach but after touring the island we came to appreciate the location greatly as there was very little beach to come by anywhere. The room was cramped but sufficient for the 2 of us. The property had a definite quaint island feel to it, not glamorous but comfortable. I would have to say that they could stand to pay a little more attention to detail, for example our bathroom lightbulb was burnt out for our entire stay. It was annoying and it made me wonder what other things they let go. But again, the location was prime because we were at the quiet end of Duvall St. yet still in walking or riding distance to most everything. (Word to the wise, take a comfortable pair of shoes and rent a bike.) We rented bikes for the week and rode everywhere. Our favorite breakfast spot was Camille's. It was a very short walk from the hotel. Our favorite lunch spot, La Ti Da's, was also a short walk. We had 2 favorite dinner spots, Michael's and Sweet Tea's. You will want to make reservations for Michael's in advance. Sweet Tea's isn't too far but Michael's is a bit further down Duvall. There is a restaurant located on the beach next to the hotel and it was just okay. We ate there once for dinner and once for breakfast, neither experience was good enough to keep us coming back even though it would have been most convenient. The famed sunset at the peir can be viewed just as well without all the crowds right from the Southernmost point next the hotel property. There are plenty of cheesy tours and such to participate in, which we did, and they passed the time but nothing too exciting. It was nice to get a feel for the history of the island and see the architecture though. We aren't big drinkers and that seemed to be what people really came for. I will say that I love to eat and there is no shortage of good food in Key West. One thing that was fun and different was the kayak sunset tour. The guide was extremely knowledgeable and it was a very cool experience. I had not ever kayaked before so it took me a little bit to get the hang of it but I ended up loving it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Donna-Iain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in early February 2012 and had a lovely stay. The hotel and staff were perfect - all very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious, clean and the king size bed was very comfortable. The cable TV was also an added bonus for the time we were in the room. We ate breakfast a couple of times at the Southernmost Beach Cafe and the food was reasonably priced, staff courteous and had a great view of the ocean. The hotel was in an ideal location - only 10-15 minutes walk away from the busy part of Duval Street which meant that it was quiet at night. Overall we had a great holiday and Key West is perfect if you want a fun-filled party holiday or chilled-out relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KathyDohaQatar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of all the sites in Key West yet on the quiet end of Duval St. It is a lovely spot with beautiful rooms and an excellent staff that went out of their way to make our visit a great one. You have the convenience of using the pool and bar at the hotel or using the facilities at the sister hotel across the street. The restaurant, Southernmost Cafe, was excellent and had the best prices on the Key. I would recommend this spot to anyone and will be returning for another great visit hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel at the beginning of December 2011. It was a ladies only trip and the hotel was perfect. I've stayed in cottage rental properties before and they were nice, but the hospitality, amenities and staff at Southernmost were nothing short of fantastic. It was nice to be able to use the pools at Southernmost Hotel and Southernmost on the Beach. The Pineapple Bar was a blast and had great drinks and fun bartenders. The pool at the Shores Bar was beautiful as it overlooked the beach. The food at the cafe was tasty as well. The blackened fish of the day sandwich is so good. The hotel is in a great location at the end of Duval. Of course, everything in Key West is a walk or bike ride away so you're close to it all. If you've never stayed in a hotel in Key West, you really should give this one a try. I will most certainly be back! My only complaint was that there was a wedding party staying at the hotel and for some reason they congregated in front of our door at 7:00 each morning and talked very loudly. I'm sure if we would have complained the situation would have been rectified, but it didn't bother us enough for that. You can't hear your neighbors through the walls, just when they're being boisterous in front of your door.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Southernmost and both times were a great experience. This is a great location is very clean and the staff are all very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissM13
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great hotel, a little quieter than their sister hotel, Southernmost on the Beach. The two hotels share pools and other amenities. The beach is a block away, the Butterfly Conservatory (a must-see) just across the street, and the hotel itself is located at the quieter end of the famous, or infamous, Duval Street, with many galleries, shops, and restaurants in easy walking distance. The staff was top-notch, each had a wonderful smile and a cheerful word and all went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Very nice, I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “southernmost hotel very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Amos B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights week of january 30. Room on first floor very nice and clean. Grounds are beautiful. staff very helpful and friendly. Had a breakfast, lunch and dinner in the beach cafe and the meals were outstanding and would recommend eating there. The pool in parking lot is very quiet and a great place to relax. Even though it is surrounded by cars you don't even notice or hear them. The foligue is beautiful. The only problem were the room key cards that didn't seem to work all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, great pools”
Reviews.Author: apprendrelemonde
Reviews.Content: Spacious hotel rooms with a modern and up-to-date decoration. Nice location on the beach but within a walking distance from all the main attraction of the island. Hotel has 3 good size pools (and pool bars). A big complex - will be perhaps too crowded place during high-season, perfect place to stay during low- and middle seasons...

Reviews.Title: “I love the Pineapple Bar!!!”
Reviews.Author: brigitte08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southern Most hotel from 1/30 -2/2. We were on a pre-cruise vacation in FL. This was our first trip to Key West and I think we picked the perfect hotel for the money. We loved this hotel. We stayed in room 177. It was on the ground floor, as I had requested. We really didnâ€™t have a view, as we were right off the parking lot. However, the Pineapple bar was only a few feet from our front door and we spent many hours there. It was delightful!!! I told my husband, with all the money we spent at the Pineapple bar, we should have just booked a balcony room and drank on our balcony. LOL! Now I know for next time. Yes, there WILL be a next time. Speaking of the Pineapple Bar, be careful walking around after youâ€™ve been in the pool. The pavers are like ice with wet feet. I landed right on my a$$, and that was before I started drinking! I also saw another guy slip that day. As for the room, it was kind of tiny and the bathroom door precariously opens into the room and got in the way! The door should open into the bathroom or install a pocket door. Also, the shower curtain was hung too far into the tub and stuck to you while trying to shower. YUCK! They need one of those curved shower curtain rods to give you more space in the shower. The bathroom was a nice size! These are just very minor details; it did not affect our stay! We got a $20 voucher for breakfast at the Beach CafÃ©. The cafÃ© was very good; we ate there a few times. The first night we walked all the way up to Mallory Square to watch the sunset activities. It was a nice stroll. We ate at DJâ€™s Clam shack on the way back. Get one of their Lobster Rolls!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE AND PLEASANT STAY but”
Reviews.Author: MRJILLY
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost is a very nice facility with an extremely friendly staff.The Beach cafe was extremely convenient and was right on the well kept and staffed beach..The bartenders were outstanding and the entire atmosphere was friendly and the property very wel maintained. The only problem wa that we were not advised of the size of the room ot which we were assigned and although well maintained a shoe horn would have been of assistance when moving about our room

Reviews.Title: “Beauitful grounds, Nice beach, Great location”
Reviews.Author: terryf22
Reviews.Content: Many things to do right at the hotel. The hotel complex (including "on the beach" location) has three pools and the beach. Always a drink special and great staff. The location is great. On the quiet side of Duval but the action is close. I recommend renting a bike (available at hotel) as the best way to get around. My wife and I went to get away from winter for a couple a days and could not be happier with Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Key West”
Reviews.Author: Fred34984
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I stayed at it 37 years ago (yes true) and it was very good then and even better now. The room was great, location great and the staff was excellent in every way. The restaurant at the beach was very good and the pools were equally as nice. A great value in the heart of old town within walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “2 days in KW”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: Good value for your KW$. On the quiet end of Duval but close enough to walk anyplace in Ol'Town. Staff is professional. Pool areas and beach are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing negative to say...”
Reviews.Author: irisSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 1/2 weeks at the Southernmost Hotel and can highly recommend it! Very well run Hotel, extremely pleasant Staff at both Hotels. Food and atmosphere at beach CafÃ© excellent. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “An old friend keeps getting better !”
Reviews.Author: Neil P
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Southermost for over 10 years and it keeps getting better. Prefer the Tower bldg, overlooking the pool. Rooms have been redone and add to the charm. Very friendly staff, terrific loaction. Nice to have both pools and beach a few steps away from the room. Location is ideal, on the quiet end of Key West and yet near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bgob
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at this hotel. Would not hesitate in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room”
Reviews.Author: T12345678901
Reviews.Content: Room smelled like urine, took 2 days to get a new room. Next room in a newer building and no rug so no smell of dog urine. 2nd room very nice. Had to insist on a new room. Staff wanted to shampoo rug from last person that stayed in room. Nice location. Nice hotel. Key west is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Colleen V
Reviews.Content: You should do your research before booking.We booked a 3rd floor king balcony with a pool view and it was fabulous.Decor was newly remodeled,very well maintained and clean as a whistle. Staff extraordinarilly gracious.Location was great.Quiet at night.Good walk to the lively end of Duval but a cab would only cost $10 to the end if you wanted.Pool at the hotel was fabulous. Bar at the pool great,just wished they carried more varieties of red wine but I understand it is hard to keep fresh in the warm climate without refrigerating it so a limited selection is available in single bottle servings.We stayed 6 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Cafe at the beach nice but noisy and needed reservations for dinner. Lots of local places "Camila's" definately worth a try,close by and the filet with the mushroom sauce is out of this world.Rent an electric car or scooters and see the rest of the island.Well worth it, start off with the conch train tour to get the feel of where you want to go.It was a great visit and when I go back it will be at this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zathros
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel one short block to the ocean nice pool beautiful room only paid $10 extra a night to upgrade to balcony room

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: spinner24
Reviews.Content: We met another couple for 4 days in Key West and both of us stayed at the Southernmost Hotel. Room was great and had a balcony overlooking the pool. Easy access to 3 pools and the beach, beach bars and bike rentals. They set us up renting a power boat as well. Easy walk into town and at the quieter end. Clean and friendly service. Bed was super comfy! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jjcruzin
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel was a great place to stay. We had a King Deluxe room; it was very clean, plenty big enough, nice big bathroom and had a refrigerator and microwave. This property has everything you need; 3 pools (2 with pool bars), a beach cafe with a great happy hour and the food was excellent and very moderately priced! We ate breakfast at the beach cafe both days we were there; thanks to a $20.00 coupon we found on trip advisor, we ate breakfast free the first day! We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Collection”
Reviews.Author: Johnsn
Reviews.Content: Southernmost Hotel is a great hotel/wonderful location and you can use the facilities at any of the Southernmost Collection. Now added the Beach Cafe you enjoy cocktails and looking out at the water! Hotel is clean-many rooms recently remodeled, pools recently improved too-new chairs/cushions. Staff comes around regularly for offer of beverages, etc. We vacation in Key West at least once a year for the past 12 years--once we found Southernmost Hotel we will stay no other place!!! Check it out-reasonably priced for Old Town Key West and can walk to all the hot spots!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but over priced like everything is in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: tgprince
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights most hotels were booked and we managed to get the bottom rate room for $187. The room was nice and clean with no balcony and faced the parking lot. The beds were comfy but the ac was not the best. We were right by the sister properties the Southern Dewey House and Southernmost on the Beach and had access to the beach. We ate at the Southernmost Beach Cafe was good. The island is 2 by 4 miles and u would think that would be easy to walk we I suggest getting a scooter, electric car or bike bc the hotel is at the end of Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Boatman1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Janaury 2012 and had a very enjoyable time. The hotel is very clean and well maintained and staff friendly and easy to work with. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The property has two pool areas (one open and one for adults only). The Southern Most Beach Resort is right next door and owned by the same company so you can enjoy that property features including the sandy beach. The Happy Hour daily at the beach bar is very popular. The location on the quiet end of Duval Street is ideal with many pubs and resturants near by. For more action, walk, rent a scooter or take a bike taxi to the other end of Duval for some drinks at Sloppy Joes, Captain Tony's, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West... quiet, clean, friendly and on Duval Street!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDoo72
Reviews.Content: I have now been staying at the Southernmost Hotel for six years and it just get's better. If you want a place that is clean, comfortable, friendly, near beaches, quiet and walking distance to the best parts of Key West... this is the place. It is located on the quiet end of Duval Street, just a ten minute walk to all the action. I don't even bother with a car when I come to Key West, as staying here makes it easy. Visit Tim at the bar, enjoy the pool, walk Duval Street to the night life and entertainment. Here, you have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: wdcspurs
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Key West, staying at this hotel both times! I believe this go around, the room we stayed in had just been remodeled. Ok size for the room. Location is good because it is on Duval street. The pool was relaxing as well as the poolside bar! The concierge was helpful in booking excursions.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeber
Reviews.Content: Loved our room with a balcony overlooking the pool and the Pineapple Bar. Each year our stay gets better and better. We feel very much at home there as everyone is so friendly and welcomes us back as if we were "family". Looking forward to returning next year. Lee & Dennis Berry (Bridgewater, MA)

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle R
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms for three nights at this hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews. I enjoyed the pools and location of this hotel. The Beach Cafe was great for dinner. The downfall was that rooms 162 and 163 smelled horrible. This smell was likely from mold because the the carpet and bedding was so damp. There was not any fan ventilation in the bathroom which added to the moisture in the air. The air conditioning was very loud and did not have the dehumidifying benefits that it should have. Both rooms where out dated, worn and dirty. We found hair on the floor in the bathroom and a hair ball in between the top comforter and sheets of the bed. The decor is retro in a bad way. It seems to be a large problem because I just read a review from a guest who stayed in room 164 with similar problems. These rooms are unacceptable to rent out.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but bad experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Moreno C
Reviews.Content: We were guests in December, certaninly for my bad english there was a misunderstanding handled very very badly by the staff. I confirmed the room for one night instead of 2. The next day I was at the beach with my family until mid-afternoon, when I returned to the hotel for to confirm the third night, the key would not open the door of the room. When I went to ask for explanations at the reception, I doscovered that staff had completely emptied the room ( althougt there were many ather free rooms) including the safe in which were kept the money, credit cards, my watch, car key, passport and airline reservations for the return at home......but where they thought we could go?!!!!!!!!!!! The most serius problem is that in the reception I have returned all, without making sure of My true identity!!! I could be anyone!!! The director has refuse to talk to me personally to give me an axplanation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: brooker
Reviews.Content: The room was OK. Our balcony was over the parking lot and our room door was directly in front of a maintenance shed (It hink). Carpet was very stained. Did not like the shower - the shower curtain would not stay and the water pressure was not very good. Bed was very comfortable. Because of the location of the room, it was very noisy outside of our room too early in the morning. The room could have used more storage space. Staff was very friendly. Main pool was very nice. Tranquility pool did not offer much but a pool and some chairs. Did not use either of the other property pools. The beach was nice but very crowded. The cafe was OK, staff were not friendly and service was very slow. I would probably give the place another try if it were in a better location, and if the room was better located.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever Nr.164!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia J
Reviews.Content: Hi, me and my husband were on the motorbike trip around Florida this January. Our last stop was Key West. And because we were in the southest part of USA, we wanted to stay in southest hotel. Unfortunately we choose this hotel... We arrived at night, receptionist guy was polite. (he gave us this room and wished a pleasnt stay. Actualy now I think he made a fun from us, gave us that room because we were on motorbikes (?) and some people doesnt like motrbikers....I just couldnt understand WHY he gave us the worst room for 197dolllars, cos this hotel has much nicer rooms!!!!!!!) First thing that made us surprised was stink after opening room door. It smelled like mould! And it was mould! Later I discover, that carpet close to bathroom was full of water. That room was completly wet! You can imagine: soap wrapp was crumble away when you touch it, all towels were wet, even the bed lining was wet. After we arrived to Miami and open our lagguage we realised that all our clothes were wet and mould stinky from that room!!!! Disgusting!!! And the worst thing was the carpet itself. After five minute walking barefoot on it your feet went black...(I walked all the in shoes, just before shower I walked without and I realised...) I washed my feet and try it again, if Im not dreaming!!!!! And it was the same: disgusting! Anyway, hotel has good location. On the end of the street is the Southernmost point of USA and you can make a nice picture there. Beach was nice, beach guys very polite and helpfull!!! They give you frozen facetowel and stravberries :))) Food in beach restaurant perfect :) I believe all the hotel is not so bad as our room was, but BIG advice for hotel management: dont offer room like this, if you have so good rating here in Tripadvisor!!! Change the price for this room and tell your guest true about the condition of the room or close it forever.... And please go there barefood to see how much this room need completly cleaning! Im traveling a lot around the world, but I had never so bad experience.... Thank you. Lucia

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: ndfan46
Reviews.Content: We had just finished an eight day Christmas Caribbean cruise and headed down to Key West for 5 days to bring in 2012. We were worried that the Southernmost complex would be too "stuffy" for our children ages 7 and 8. Boy were we wrong! They had more fun the first two hours at Southernmost than they did the entire cruise. It was so relaxing yet full of entertainment. Everyone was helpful. The complex was spotless. My husband had a ball at beer school. There were a ton of activities for the kids. The Beach cafe had a great happy hour. Sunset was incredible especially with the live music on the lawn. We had a great room poolside which was so convenient for the whole family. Loved the whole property! Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: vejohn
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 night here over the holidays. Check in was easy and the place was lovely. The room was clean and updated. Having the end room was nice. We were right next to the pool and across the street was the sister hotel Southern Most on the Beach. We found the breakfast at the cafe on the beach very reasonably priced. This chain of hotels offers 3 pools. The one we chose was the adult only quiet pool. We have nothing against children but ours weren't with us. At the quiet pool you have to be at least 21 and there is no music being played. Staff come around every half hour to see if there is anything they can get for you. The other two pools have a bar. This hotel is an easy walk to Duval Street for when you want to be in the center of the action and far enough away when you want it quiet. Love it and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive over the holidays”
Reviews.Author: deanna_simonds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year's holiday for a wedding. The hotel was nice and you have access to Southernmost on the Beach, which is a nicer (but much more expensive) property. The rooms are clean and the service is good. My husband and I had a balcony room, but it faced the parking lot. Convenient location on Duval St, yet on the quiet end for easy rest.

Reviews.Title: “Pat & Marise Costello UK”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Southernmost Hotel for a week before Christmas 2011.This was our 8th stay since we first visited in 2007,giving an idea of how much we like the place.The rooms are comfortable and well kept as are the rest of the facilities.There are plenty of amenities to suit all with the 3 pools and 2 bars,also the Beach Cafe with great food.The location is ideal as it is at the quiet end of Duval Street so you can walk up and enjoy the busy bars etc on Duval and return to the peace and quiet.The staff are all very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them.There are too many to mention all of them but a special thanks to Tim, Johnny B & Rhonda for looking after us at the Pineapple Bar and to Elizabeth for making us so welcome.We would recommend this hotel to anyone without doubt and when we come to Key West we would not consider staying anywhere else.Thanks for a wonderful time ,see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: norwooda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel for 3 days while traveling in the keys. It was less than $200 a night and well worth it. You have access to the facilities at the more expensive Southernmost on the Beach as well. I liked the pool there better with a view of the ocean. It is also right next to the only beach in Key West. The rooms are not large, but how much time are you spending in the room really? The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. There was only one window and since we were on the ground floor there is no balcony whereas the second floor rooms had balconies. I would just recommend asking for them. The pools are large and have bars attached to them where you can also order food except for the tranquility pool which is adult only and quiet. I enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again if ever in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay for me”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time over New Year's Eve. We've been to Key West a number of times and usually stay at a small hotel on Duval but we decided to change because that hotel had a bar which has live music nightly and became too loud for us. The room was clean. When we first arrived, the bathroom floor was still wet from being cleaned and there was some dirt on the side of the bathtub. Because the floor was wet, we tracked in dirt also. Called down to the front desk and they said they would take care of it which they did. They also gave us a bunch of free drink coupons to use at the pool bars. The room is spacious and there was enough room to put our clothes away and store our luggage. Its not very bright though. The window in the room has only one curtain so I didn't feel like I could leave it open while we were in the room because everyone that walked by could see right in. I thought I noticed that some other rooms had a sheer curtain as well as the heavier one but ours didn't. That would have been nice to have and be able to let some natural light in. The bathroom is on the small side and there isn't a ton of counter space. Our water pressure was good and there was plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable. There is free wi-fi. There is also a coffee maker in the room. You have access to the three pools on the Southernmost property. We did spend NYE at the pool at SMOB and it was packed with kids. Bar service there was attentive. My biggest issue is that the walls are paper thin. We could literally hear the conversation of the people next door. I'm sure that they weren't being super loud, its just that the walls are that thin or not sound proof, whatever. This is what I was looking to get away from. Not sure if we'll return or not - I'll most likely look for a comparative value for next year. Either that or upgrade to SMOB.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, small hotel charm with big hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: gtzb4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and the hotel came recommended to us by friends who had stayed there just a few months earlier for a wedding. The hotel was lovely. It looks like a plantation/bed & breakfast - not a high-rise hotel tower or cookie-cutter type chain hotel. The decor was a modern mix of tropical paradise and contemporary styling. Very clean. There was a furnished balcony with a beautiful view overlooking one of the quiet pools (adults only) and the ocean - literally across the street. The pools were very clean as well. The hotel bar had daily drink specials (the Key Lime-lada was quite tasty). There is a sister Southernmost Hotel on the Beach right across the street and you have access to it, all its amenities including the private beach and pier (a great place to watch the sunrise!). The hotel Cafe, also on the beach, had tasty appetizers and free water (which is a must if you're spending any time on the beach in Key West!). The hotel staff on the beach were also very attentive with lounge chairs, umbrellas, and frozen towel logs (little washcloth sized towels rolled up and frozen to help you beat the Key West heat). The hotel is on Duval St. but its at the opposite end of most of the "action" - which is good b/c you'll miss out on the late night bar crowds, but it is a bit of a walk to all of the other bars, cafes and restaurants. Parking is limited so giving up your spot to drive around the island is a risk. There are no elevators. We had a 3rd floor jr suite/apt and had to carry our suitcases up 3 flights of stairs, some very steep. The hotel staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable of local attractions and events. The hotel is a very easy walk to the Southernmost Point - highly recommend the photo op! Overall the only bad thing I could say about our experience was that it ended too quickly! I would definitely recommend it and hope to go back to Key West in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ilmwpkmd
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West, and we were absolutely thrilled with the Southernmost Hotel. This is a very clean hotel. 3 pools and right on the ocean with a public beach where you could watch the sun rise and set from the pier. Their cafe has fantastic food and reasonable prices. It is right off of Duval Street, but at the opposite end from the port so there is a sense of peacefulness but also an opportunity to partake in all the Duval Street excitement. The only thing I missed was having a balcony...next time I will request that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to come back!!”
Reviews.Author: G0Places
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West and we chose this hotel based on reviews from TripAdvisor! We Loved our entire stay and had no real issues to speak of. Staff was very nice and we were completely comfortable! We wanted a room w/a balcony by the pool, but were too late in booking...so we ended up with our balcony facing the parking lot and street! We actually think we enjoyed this view much better because there was always something to capture our attention! We spent every morning and evening on the balcony! The room was a little small but very nice. We really enjoyed beer school....but were a little disappointed bc the wallhooky tournament we had been looking forward to never materialized. WE found the location easily accessible to everything we wanted to do and see as long as you don't mind walking a mile or two a day. We rented bikes from the Hotel one day and also rented scooters from across the street on another day!! All in all, a great Place to stay while vacationing in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Trip”
Reviews.Author: Pollok1
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel after being on a business trip to Miami. Excellent location very friendly staff. Just chilled out after working excellent place to relax & unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Great find--we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: OutWanderin
Reviews.Content: What a find! We booked with trepidation. Thought the address would be too loud and the price seemed too good to be true. It was wonderful. The facilities were clean, the staff pleasant, bar and pool under-utilized. It made for a nice quiet trip with just enough distraction. Walking distance to the beach and pier gave us sunrises and sunsets for our January vacation. Plenty to do and many restaurants were walk-able.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with the prefect location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkiegirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! We had exceptional friendly service at the front desk by Cindy and Lewis and Derk in maintenance was very nice. The bars, cafe, pool, and beach staff were great. We loved the West Lawn sunset event with the live music. They also had great live music at the pools during the day. Location was great right off Duval and next to the beach, but not noisy. We were impressed how reasonable the cafe was and happy there were specials at the all bars. Happy Hour at the cafe was great plus dinner at the cafe was very good!!! One concern was the quality of the bathroom in our room. The bathroom had signs of mold between the door and bathtub. The bathtub need calking and bathtub tile needed to be regrouted. I reported this to the hotel. We did have the economy double, while I didn't expect luxury, the bathroom needed some upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, use the pool and beach next door”
Reviews.Author: joshdouglas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. We stayed here and walked across the street to the beach and pool at the Southernmost on the Beach. The staff was very attentive. If you are staying for more than 3 nights, ask for free coupons to the Hemmingway House--this saved us $25! Great find!

Reviews.Title: “Achieving a Key West State of Mind @ the SMHC”
Reviews.Author: anitavoltz
Reviews.Content: When my daughter got back from a rough semester of Engineering @ VT (and I finished up a difficult project at work) I decided to celebrate her 20th birthday and the holidays with a quick trip to Key West to decompress. I hadn't been there in over 10 years - so I thought she and I could explore the 2 by 4 mile island together! I specifically chose the Southernmost based on location (proximity to Duval street and being so peaceful compared to the other end of Duval). Whatever part of the Southernmost you stay in (and there are several properties) you have access to any of the pools (I counted 3), a fitness room (bigger and better appointed than expected), a stretch of well-maintained and staffed beach, an open air beach cafe with great food/service RIGHT ON THE BEACH that was open 7am to 11pm (we ate almost every meal there), parking right outside our hotel door, punctual and thorough housekeeping service, bike rental on property, concierge support in the lobby, LIVE acoustic music EVERY DAY starting around noon (Gerd Rude was incredible - - even my daughter turned off her iPod and listened), a great salon for pedicure/manicures around the corner on Simonton (Isle Style - ask for Daymi), Old Town Trolley stop right outside for our multiple trips to watch the sunset @ Mallory Square, and the friendliest folks are running the place (see Boomer). I can't say enough about this vacation - and hope to get back there in 2012 with my husband and other 3 kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: CLT152
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. Overall, is quiet and nice. The lower-level, pool-facing rooms are the best, as you have privacy on your patio, but can walk right around a little wall into the pool area. The pool area also has a small bar. Great location at the end of the main drag: Duval Street. I would certainly stay again if I visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & outstanding entertainer 'Gerd Rube' at the Pineapple Tiki Bar”
Reviews.Author: IslandmanKW
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at this wonderful hotel this monday and tuesday and one of our highlights was when we got entertained by Key West's finest singer Gerd Rube. We did not expect such a talent would be playing for a rather small audience at a pool bar. We requested several songs that he performed right away and his versions were incredible. Too bad we had to leave Key West on Wednesday, but lucky enough we bought all four of his CDs and they will always bring back great memories of our stay at the Southermost. Staff and the service was simply wonderful too. All thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel surprise us!”
Reviews.Author: Travelohoolic
Reviews.Content: After a perfect stay at the palms hotel & spa,Miami beach we stayed one night @ Southernmost Hotel,Key west.We never expect 2 wonderful stay at a row,We booked a regular room but when we entered the room we are amazed with the size & ambiance of the room,little box of chocolate, orchid and a welcome card.Then we realize Elizabeth,Front desk manger upgrade our room for our anniversary.Thank U Elizabeth for you touch of love. This is the sport where you start your Key west trip,after check in enjoy the sunset from the beach (own by the same management) jump into Duval St for party back for quite night sleep,wake up have a wonderful breakfast at the beach. you can't beat that,most of all experience last (Southernmost) hotel in america 90 miles from Cuba. Little old but well maintained property.they already renovate most of the room.comfortable bed,huge shower,clean, deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Datadude76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week. Overall it was a very nice stay, the hotel was clean and the location was excellent. Everything is pretty much within waling distance. I would stay here again. Pros- Location Restaurant was good Happy hour was great rooms and grounds very well kept. Cons- No elevators beach was not very good. Bar service was just so so.... Bartenders had to be flagged down for drinks. water pressure not good no airport shuttle beach chair Nazi got old. It would have been nice if we had been informed that beach chairs were free with hotel stay. As soon as we set down he was there with his hand out for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Love It”
Reviews.Author: Elander
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Southernmost Hotel. The fronk desk staff is attentive and helpful irregardless of who is staffing at the time. The hotel is a little older but is kept updated and in great condition. Our room was on the ground floor, right next to Duval St., but we were pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was at night. The location's hard to beat. Key West doesn't have a lot of good beach but Southernmost Beach Resort has some of the best, just across the street from SMH. If you prefer some quiet time SMH has 2 nice secluded pools that were under used during our stay. The hotel is at the south end of Duval St., making it far enough away to escape the cruise ship passengers, yet close enough to walk to the entertainment / dining hotspots. Try the Southernmost Beach Cafe for lunch or dinner. It is very good and has great ocean views. SMH and Key West in general is not for the budget conscious but you get a lot for your money.On a prior visit we stayed at the Casa Marina and we consider SMH a better value. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The place we call home when we are in Key West”
Reviews.Author: mgambler
Reviews.Content: The water is warm and Crystal clear in the pools. All of them! My wife just loves the new furniture at the small pool. The food and the view at the Beach cafe make breakfast so delightful. My wife really enjoyed her massage at the SPA on the beach. So relaxing she said! After returning this year for the seventh time to this property we have to say they never stop making improvements. The Shores bar & Pineapple bar are perfect for a swim and a cocktail. But most of all the staff will go above and beyond all you need to do is ask! Ask for special packages and you will get the most bang for your buck. What we most love is that we can get a real good rate on a small Gingerbread room or we can spend a little more and go to the property on the beach and get a suite with a view of the ocean or beach all most any price range and you are able to use all of the facilities offered by the resort. Our only wish is that Southernmost might start a shuttle service for guests coming from the Airport or the Ferry terminal this would be so great for guests not driving.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little touches”
Reviews.Author: tjay2
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost hotel isnt really that cheap so I was expecting quite a bit for my money. Well I got quite a bit and some more. We had a deluxe room and Im sure it was recently refurbished - there was a faint smell of paint. It was a great size room with a huge bed large 32inch tv - masses of storage space etc. It had a lovely little balcony with views towards the main entrance and fountain (I think a pool view would be nicer) There were some great touches in the room like the ipod dock and alarm clock and the BeeKind toiletries. There was plenty of lighting from lamps to main lights and a large air con unit along with mini sofa and coffee table. The bed was super comfy and super large! Whilst there was a queue at check in upon arrival they were expecting me and I spent less than 5 minutes at the desk before going to my room. The resort was clearly explained and those little touches again like the use of all the swimming pools and free sunbeds on the beach were excellent. The hotel is at the quieter end of Duval St but its nice to walk at night - if you don't feel like walking you could get those pedicabs/rickshaw things but for me they were very expensive! Southermost Point is literally a stones thorough away as is the beach. I was impressed by the pools and the staff around the pool but what impressed me even more was that they had a live acoustic act each day by the pool. this is a fantastic idea for any hotel. It beats playing cheesy music from the bar. normally I listen to my ipod all day whilst sunbathing but not at the Southernmost they had two different guys whilst I was there and both played excellent relaxing chill out music. A great service and again a fantastic little touch. Overall I was really happy with my stay and whilst it is probably the most expensive hotel Ive stayed in in the USA I would thoroughly recommend 3-4 nights relaxing here

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Directly Above The Center Of The Earth
Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyDog
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel is part of a group of properties at the (of course) Southernmost end of Duval St. in Key West. Guests at any of the properties can use all of the facilities at all locations. The location is spectacular, there's nothing like watching the sun rise above the water from the pier. One block from the Southernmost buoy, a Key West Landmark. I'm told that at this point you're closer to Cuba than to WalMart, which 126 miles up the road. It's at the quiet end ot Duval, but the action is just a short walk (or a shorter scooter ride) away. The staff is very friendly and helpful, there are many activities as well. I truly wanted to experience Beer School with Boomer, but got my days mixed up and missed it. Looks like the vacation worked - I lost track of the days - can't ask for more than that! Oh, yes - try the Rum Runner cocktail at the Pineapple Bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great area for a great wedding”
Reviews.Author: KLGF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (early 30's) recently stayed at The Southernmost Hotel for a friends wedding and loved every minute of Key West! This property is located on one end of Duval Street while most of the restaurants/bars are on the other- about a 20-25 minute walk. Far enought from the crowds and noise but close enough to walk/bike. We stayed in a King Balcony room in the hotel section and were pleased with the accommodations. The balcony was overlooking the parking lot but it was nice enough to sit outside and relax. The room wasn't extravagant but decorated nicely with plenty of storage and room. Only complaint was that it took housekeeping a while to get to our room...a few days it was later afternoon and they hadn't come to make the bed yet. The pool was on the smaller side but wonderful! There were plenty of lounge chairs available and no need to get there bright and early to reserve one. The bartenders were friendly and made great drinks with a different special every day. They even offered beer school on Tuesday afternoons with free beer! The wedding was held on the beach and was amazing- couldn't have asked for a better setting! The servers were always available with fresh trays of food and the bartenders were happy to serve! The main course for the wedding was wonderful- certainly not expected for a wedding meal at a hotel! Everyone was raving about how good the food was! Overall we had a fabulous time, have and will continue to recommend this hotel to our friends and family and will defintely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and town”
Reviews.Author: collins30
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 6th trip to Key West, again staying at the Southernmost Hotel. The property is as beautiful as ever and the staff are so friendly and helpful, especially Elizabeth Isaac, Luis at the Front Desk, Rhonda the pool bartender and Gene, Head of Landscaping had the grounds looking beautiful, especially the Christmas decorations. Will plan on returning again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic first time!”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldcg
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with everything Southernmost had to offer. Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms are nice. Grounds are well kept and the pools are clean. The beach is small but nice. We ate lunch at the beach cafe and it was pretty good. Only one recommendation from this traveller.....the outside hallways to the rooms could be kept up a little better. I would recommend this hotel. 1 week wasn't enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Shas1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! It is at the end of Duval street, the quiet end. Short walk to all of the shops, restaurants, bars etc. The pools are nice. The bar is overpriced, but that's expected for a hotel bar. Housekeeping was just OK. The housekeepers were not friendly and were constantly on their cell phones which does not look professional. We saw one of them actually laying on a bed in a room talking on the phone. The front desk staff was friendly, but sometimes seemed clueless when asked a question. All in all this is a great hotel, great location, and we will definitley be back.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel -- fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: kerry a
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay, and will stay with them anytime we visit the keys! Employee's are friendly, and helpful. Rooms very nice. We had a family wedding with some 30 family members-all had nothing but good to say about this establishment. The cafe has excellent food, fast, friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: seabrite
Reviews.Content: This is our 10th consecutive year staying at the Southernmost Hotel. We traveled with a group of 25 people and everyone was happy with their accomadations, friendliness of staff, and overall quality of service. We have already booked for next year and hope to add more travelers to our group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, great staff, comfy room - what else?”
Reviews.Author: Wolkenjaeger
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say. We had everything we wanted for a great price/value ratio!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: happyvacati0ners
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms were updated and clean, access to 3 beautiful pools, cafe on the beach, the beach!, music in the afternoon....just doesn't get any better! Although the walk to the other side of Duval St got old after a while, we took cab rides on several occasions and it was only about $3 pp each way. We would also recommend Blue Heaven and Louie's Backyard restaurants. For more casual eating, we went to Pepe's for oysters almost daily (they were that good!) and couldn't resist the happy hour specials at The Half Shell Raw Bar. What a great vacation! Would definitely go back to Key West and would definitely stay at The Southernmost Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost - best value on the Island”
Reviews.Author: JerseyDogs
Reviews.Content: The only place better than Southernmost Hotel is Southernmost on the Beach. The Southernmost Hotel is 1 block from the ocean and is a great way to save money without giving up any services of the On the Beach property since they are on the same location. This beautiful property has 3 immaculate pools, 3 wonderful bars, incredible ocean views, a cafe with quality, tasty food that is offered at fair prices. Rooms have refridge and microwave. The staff is exceptional. The activities director, Boomer was more like an old friend. The music at poolside was great. We came with 85 yes 85 friends and stayed for a week. We will be back next year, sooner if we can arrange it.

Reviews.Title: “Already booking next year!”
Reviews.Author: TheMangoMen
Reviews.Content: We bring 80 people every November and they would all hate me if I ever picked another hotel. The Southernmost has the best of Key West from the decor, ambiance, energy and personalities to everything else. I love how everyone who works there truly acts like they have been touched by paradise and nothing gets under their skin. They will strive to make your stay in Key West the best ever no matter what it takes. That ranges from customer service, to noticing every detail to make the place beautiful and clean. We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwrgodden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel lots of times over the last 10 years and it gets better every time. They have really spent some time and money on it over the last 3 years and yet it's still reasonably priced for what you get at the quiet end of Duval. 3 pools to choose from and the restaurant on the beach is great. You also get a free lounger and parasol on the nearby public beach if you're staying at the Southernmost. Wireless internet is free and pretty robust. My room was small (255 in the Gingerbread Wing) but everything included...queen-sized bed, very nice shower room, fridge, microwave, safe, etc and a flat screen TV with usual channels. There's free parking, which is a real bonus in Key West! You can rent bikes from the concierge and book all manner of trips, including a trolley ride around the town and trips to the Dry Tortugas (highly recommended). The new Pineapple bar is very nice and lively where you can buy bar snacks or relax in the adult-only Tranquility Pool by the Gingerbread Wing. Very friendly staff and I even received a gift this time as a returning guest...nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: 49022Cosmo02
Reviews.Content: Staff goes out of their way to make your stay great. The food at their cafe was great and reasonable priced. Excellent location for everything .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: Whilst I've visited Key West before I've never stayed overnight. I wanted somewhere central so we could go out on foot at night but where we wouldn't be disturbed by the night-life and this hotel met my expectations. It is right at the end of Duval Street by the beach but was quiet at night.The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and cool (important in the heat!). We didn't use many of the amenities as there is so much to see and do in Key West but I would stay here again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Ellen T
Reviews.Content: We would like to express our gratitude and a very BIG thank you to CINDY of Southernmost, we told her it was our anniversary and I was coming off of a big sickness, finished treatment for breast cancer and Cindy made our stay the best it has ever been. This was our 6th stay at the Southernmost and thanks to CINDY at the front desk, she helped make it the best ever! Hope to see you next year Cindy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & A Beach!”
Reviews.Author: deniseg12345
Reviews.Content: Not only was the Southernmost Hotel a great location for walking to Duval, but you are only a hop, skip and a jump from a very nice (Key West standards) beach. The Southernmost Beach Cafe that is right on the beach has great lunch food (never had dinner their - so many other choices) and the Shores Bar was yummy as well. From the beach you can access these two places, plus a very nice pool. The rooms were a quite nice with up to date decorating and styling. VERY clean too, which of course is always nice! We loved staying here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was back there!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie L
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a very good hotel. Easy to walk where you want to go. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The only issue was that we had a running toilet but it was not a problem. We would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite spot for 8 years!”
Reviews.Author: kdrags
Reviews.Content: The staff makes the place awesome! Rich, Heather, Tim, Boomer, Rhonda, Sam, Julia, Samantha, Johnny B, Kathy, and John are the BEST group anywhere! Everyone is friendly and helpful and this is hands down our favorite vacation spot in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I were there”
Reviews.Author: vbasic
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor doesn't provide a way to submit an old review. The last time I was at this location was 2003. However, I feel confident that nothing has changed since my last visit except to improve. I first encountered this motel in 1992 before they had "taken over" the southermost real estate property in America. They now have properties all around the original motel. It was love at first sight. In 91-92, I lived on my boat in the Keys but not in Key West, and needed a place to stay in Key West for a weekend away from my boat. What struck me was walking into their lobby with all the tropical foliage outside and the double doors which where wide open, with a ceiling fan above making lazy circles. I expected Bogey and Bacall to be sitting outside the lobby by the pool having a drink. I lived/loved the 50's and I thought I had stepped through a time warp and this is how it must have been. They have done extensive updates to their rooms since those wonderful "old days". I have been back several times, the last time was in 2003. I highly recommend this property and although I've never stayed in any of their other locations, I'm sure they are just as well run. I would never stay in them because I love the original location. The Keys are a trip away from America as most of us know it. They have (maybe) 2 Walmarts (probably more now) and very few chain fast food. If you have never been to the Keys, I suppose Key West is the place to go. I loved it there and hope to return someday. However, depending on your wants/needs, there are many other places with an entirely different atmosphere (such as Islamarado and Big Pine Key). Islamarodo for avid fishermen and Big Pine Key for people looking for remote isolation. The Keys and the Southermost motel are a perfect match.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation at Key West”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: Overall, I found this to be a very good hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights in August. Being at the southern end of Duvall St, it is close to everything and easy to walk everywhere. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is quite large. The only problem we had was with the air conditioner. After we checked in, we noticed the floor was wet underneath the air conditioner unit. We called the front desk and a service person was sent up immediately. They found that the air conditioner was froze up and needed to be "defrosted". We had to leave it off for the day. This did the trick and they also gave us a discount on the rooms for the trouble. There are 2 pools. One with a bar which was more crowded. The second pool was quieter and one night we were the only ones in that pool. Pros: Friendly staff, spacious rooms with a large bathroom, access to the other Southernmost properties, good location Cons: The beach nearby is quite small. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dee W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was under renovation when we checked in with 2 pools closed as well as the restaurant. I was a little upset at first but I can not say enough great things about the staff. They went out of their way every chance they got. I am in sales in the hotel industry. It takes a lot to impress me and these people really did. Also, the place was absolutely beautiful... even under renovation. Highly recommend the Southernmost. Wonder stay and memories. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mkathy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Southernmost in late September 2011. It was the best trip ever. The hotel was great, as were the staff. We can't say enough about Corey the bellboy. The room was everything we had hoped for. The hotel was located on Duval and made it an easy walk into city center. The pool and bar were great. The activities planned by the hotel were fantastic. We loved the whole Key West experience and can't wait to get back there soon, and when we do we won't stay anywhere but the Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DarkLotus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, and very nice. The staff was friendly and accomodating. I liked the feel of the rooms, very quaint, updated, and had a great classy beach/tropical vibe to it. Beware, this hotel can get very expensive during their season for making money ! I wouldnt pay more than we did per night 75.00/night sun-th... fri sat 96.00/niight . This is a really nice place, and the reason why i say i wouldnt pay more than that is, our room was really small. if all the rooms are the same size, paying more than we did wouldnt be worth it . I reccomend this place, its what you would hope for in a hotel. great service desks down stairs. There is a guy who helps you plan day trips and rents out vespas and scooters. He was very helpful with out being pushy. being at the end of Duval made it nice because it was at the quiet end, yet everything was still at your finger tips ! enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: robinjf
Reviews.Content: I make at least one trip a year to Key West and I always stay at the Southernmost Hotel. I have never been disappointed. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and I love the cafe on the beach. The pools and the pool bars are clean and always a great time. The beach is the best one I've been on in Key West. The rooms are very reasonably priced. I can't come up with one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Found time to relax on a work trip.”
Reviews.Author: TheMangoMen
Reviews.Content: My boss and I went down to wrap up last minute details for our tour in November. Our schedule was packed tight from the minute we got there until the minute we left, or so it seemed. Boomer, the activities director over at the pool made it possible for us to find a few minutes to relax. We had 30 minutes and with the live music by the pool and the Newlywed game, we laughed and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves like we were on vacation. The next day we had another 30 minutes of free time and Boomer took us to the pier with snorkel equipment in hand. We couldn't play for long, but once again Boomer took care of us. Right under the pier we saw huge angel fish, a sting ray, nurse shark, and right off the pier we saw tons of really colorful fish in the grasses. I must mention that we love all of the newly finished renovations. The rooms are beautiful and new and so are most of the parking lots redone with beautiful pavers. The Pineapple Bar over at the Hotel has been redone and is beautiful. I once again felt like I was welcomed home by family when I checked in. Each time I visit The Southernmost Resort, I feel like they tuck me under their wing for the duration of my stay. Thank you again. I love all of you! Xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Stealing the most on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8200
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel an hour before check in and the room was not ready until 2 hours later. We noticed a note in the key card holder that read "For your security each guest room is equipped with an electronic safe" This should have been the first indication of what would happen next. Excited to be on our honeymoon, we unpacked and I threw my I.D and credit card into my husbands wallet. I set my wallet on the night stand(covered by my sweater) and went out the door. Days later I went to get some cash to pay for the taxi we were about to take and my money was gone. It was our last night in the hotel and on our honeymoon so it ruined the whole night. The front desk management was no help, as they told us to file a police report. Basically, Southern most on the beach hires criminals. Do Not Stay Here Unless You Want Your Belongings Stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Coquiman
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel for Labor Day Weekend; my wife and I have stayed in Key West before, however this hotel was by far the best price and a great location - close to everything. Our room was very clean and appeared to have been recently updated. The staff was very courteous and helpful with our questions. The pools, bars, and ground keeping were in excellent condition; and the food at the cafe was very good, (had breakfast and happy hour). We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Smoofoo500
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The pools, bars, restaurant and location! I stayed here with my boyfriend and his family and we were able to use all the facilities at the resort on the beach. Just steps away from Key West most famous landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Aghouston8
Reviews.Content: Visited Key West for the first time and stayed at Southernmost Hotel. Staff is excellent and the rooms, pools, bars, beach were immaculate. Not only the friendliness of the staff or cleanliness of the rooms, but all of the amminities....different pools, bars...we didn't know what to do first!!! We will definitely return to Southernmost...its affordable, perfect location and again the staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great couple of days!”
Reviews.Author: issaquah_Paul
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. We frequented the pool and pool bar and the room was very nice. The grounds were nice and we would definitely stay there again. The staff was friendly and acommodating and let us stay on premises and use the pool and facilities long after we checked out before our transporation home.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: born2travel1956
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time ....and a special thanks to Boomer Mcfall for all his special activities and entertainment while our stay... So much fun ....We will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: 225winegirl
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a place. I enjoy nice accomodations, but don't want it to be stuffy or too uptight and this was perfect. The concierge was fantastic and we were able to book snorkeling, a sunset cruise, and rent bicycles from the front desk.
