They also give coupons to many restaurants, so just ask them prior to going out to dinner. This hotel has multiple pools and a small beach that has a bar with food and drinks right there. The pool at this hotel has a bar with very friendly staff and plenty of chairs. There is also a private pool that's tucked away and is frequently empty. There are several restaurants close to the hotel. We rode bikes and walked to CVS which is maybe 5 blocks away. This hotel is about a 10 minute walk to bars and nightlife and about 20-30 minutes to marinas/fishing/snorkeling, etc. We didn't mind the walk and it was kind of nice to be close enough to walk, yet far enough removed from all the commotion. Bikes are only around 10 dollars and there are tons of places to tie the bike up, so this is a great option if you don't want to walk. All in all, we loved this place. Would stay again. This could be considered pricey, however when you compare to other places, I think you get a pretty good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the website lets on”
Reviews.Author: Cara S
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for a last minute trip and stayed at the Southernmost. They upgraded our room to one with a balcony overlooking the pool. The concierge set us up with a great scuba diving trip---they also rent out bikes right from the hotel and it is very affordable. I have never written a tripadvisory review before but our stay here was so above and beyond what I expected I promised myself I would. The pool is great----bar right by--very quiet---and sunnier and bigger than the website lets on. Our room was cleaned very thoroughly each day. Could not have asked for more. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our trip for next year!”
Reviews.Author: Erin K
Reviews.Content: We loved Key West from the moment we arrived! It is a beautiful place and the perfect place to go if you just want to have fun and relax! The hotel room was recently upgraded, it was spotelss and very comfortable! We loved the pool with the Pineapple Bar, there was live music, flat screens and the drinks were amazing! Bartender Tim was such a cool guy, we set and talked to him for about an hour one night. All of the staff at the hotel was more than accomodating and you could tell that they truely loved and took pride in their jobs. This was our first time coming to Key West so we weren't sure at all where to stay. Being by the beach was a top priority and it seemed unrreal that we'd be able to use all of the amentities at Southernmost on the beach even though we weren't staying there. It was great that beach towels were provided and that the lounge chairs for the beach were complimentary to guests (at $5 dollars a day per chair this saved us $60) . Not to mention that everyday the beach staff brought us a frozen strawberry (which went perfect with a frozen concoction) and a frozen "towel-sicle" to cool off. The Southernmost Beach Cafe had amazing food (I would highly reccomend the Prime Rib and Coconut Shrimp Appetizer). One evening we relaxed on the hammocks in the courtyard at Southernmost on the Beach, and of course tooks tons of pictures there's no better then picture then a hammock tied to two palm trees right next to the ocean at sunset! We rented bikes from the hotel for the week, which was great for sightseeing. We can't wait to go back next year, I would highly recommend staying at Southernmost Hotel! See you in August 2012 :)

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a five day vacation ending on Labor Day. We stayed in an Economy Room/ with a single Kingsize bed. The bed was very comfortable, We did miss not having a small table and table chairs in the room. The room was clean, no odors, What made our stay special was the attiitude of all the employees we had contact with. Diana and Pat at the front desk were very helpful and kind. They helped us find the right Resturants during our stay, called cabs for us, and special requests. Rhonda and Tim at the Pineapple Bar by the pool, made great drinks, and had interesting stories to tell. Shandell, our waiter, at the Sourthernmost Beach Cafe provided us with good menu suggestions, very attentive, but not annoying, good conversation, and the food was good..The grounds are kept spotless, and landscaping was beautiful. Great Location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ken C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel based on other reviews we had read on TripAdvisor. - We were not let down! This was by FAR, the best value for the money. I recommend staying at the Southernmost Hotel and spending half as much (150/nt) as opposed to staying at Southernmost on the Beach. - They are a family of hotels so you have access to all of the amenities for half the price. The hotel is clean, the pools are great, the bar is active. - We ended up at the Southernmost Cafe on the Beach almost every night for happy hour. - Food and drinks were only $3! In terms of location, I don't think we would have chosen any other spot on the island. You are on the beach AND at the south end of Duval. You can get to restaurants 1 block away and have NUMEROUS bars and restaurants to walk to all along Duval. - However, it's not quite as crazy as the north end of Duval with all of the cruise ship tourists. One piece of advice - rent bikes! It was sooo nice having the ability to jump on a bike and ride up Duval .... or out to Fort Zachary Taylor.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Shakedwnst
Reviews.Content: This place has it all- proximity, an amazing pool, beautiful scenery. It's family friendly, and although we don't have kids- there was a nice balance between singles and families. James the bartender was phenomenal and was extremely helpful! The entire staff was super nice and accommodating. We will definitely return, hoping we get the same room with the same view! Sunsets/sunrises are priceless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bill c
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable and AC cranked. The pools and the beach were all nice and the restaurant on the beach had pretty good food. One downside is that it is a bit of a walk to Irish Kevin's and Sloppy Joe's when it is 100 degrees out.

Reviews.Title: “I am addicted”
Reviews.Author: Lizzard63
Reviews.Content: First time to Key West & I am addicted. We stayed @ the Dewy House which is part of the Soutnermost Hotels. Everything was amazing. The difference in this trip & why I will be back??? THE STAFF @ the Southernmost Hotel. Boomer is the man.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: miko55
Reviews.Content: It was nice. The staff was freindly, the set-up was nice for the Super Bowl in the Pool Bar, they provided free Pizza. Rooms were clean, pool clean and well kept, good location. The only bad thing I would have to say is the price. It was not worth the price we payed for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 4th of July Weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: m_dFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel for the 4th of July weekend this year. We chose this hotel because it is one of only few hotels in the Keys that have a beach or beach access. Another couple traveled with us, and since they are from NY, having beach access was important. We reserved a room with a queen bed and it was located on the second floor of the hotel. We were lucky that the room was second to the end of the walkway and faced the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach. We felt the room was a great value since it was newly renovated and was very modern, compared to our friends who chose a room with a king size bed, that was not yet renovated and had a balcony. We stayed for 3 days and had a great time. We spent most of our time at the pool at the Southernmost on the Beach. The atmosphere was great! There was live music, the bar served great finger food, excellent frozen drinks and you could walk just a few steps to the beach. The crowd was a mixture of a few families, luckily with really well behaved kids :), young couples, retirees and some foreigners. We booked the jet ski tour through the hotel because they actully had the best deal after comparing the vendors in town. We took a 4pm tour that lasted 1:45! It was great. Since it was later in the day, we did not burn and were joined by 8 other vacationers in the group. the tour left from The Reach Resort, which is the next hotel over and only a 2 minute walk. We rented a two seater and were led by 2 guides, one at the front and one in the back. We went around the whole island of Key West stopping at a few places as the guides explained what some of the sites were and their place in Key West history. We were at the front since we like to go a bit faster than most and since there were 2 guides, we did not have to stop and wait for those that wanted to go a bit slower. Once we got to the west side of the island, we were allowed to free roam for 1/2 hour which was awesome! As far as the food in Key West, one place stood out; Sara Beth's. It is set inside a traditional Key West house and offers some of the best breakfast food we have ever had. I would recommend the fat and fluffy french toast, porridge and pumpkin muffin. Dinner choices are great all around town and offer a wide variety of menu items and price ranges. If you love seafood, you will have plenty to chose from. We also had a great dinner at the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach. The restaurant faces the ocean and offered a great atmosphere. The food was delicious. The mussles appetizer was fantastic! The relaxed atmosphere of Key West is great and the people, tourists and residents, always seem to be in a great and relaxed mood. We are definitely going back and are considering making this our "go to" vacation for the 4th!

Reviews.Title: “very well kept hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: paula d
Reviews.Content: a lovely well maintained hotel with friendly staff and excellent pool bars the hotel has a small resturant on the beach which serves food throughout the day but we only used it twice as there are many local eateries in Duval Street we had a ground floor room which overlooked the car park but this didn't matter to us as the room itself was good with a huge comfortable bed, decent sized bathroom and all the room facilites you'd expect from a good hotel ie safe, fridge, coffee making facilites, iron and ironing board. there were complimentry beach towels and coffee in the morning by the pool bars the southernmost hotel was across the road from the southernmost on the beach (part of the group of hotels) where you are welcome to use all their facilites. the famous mallory square is about a mile away along duval street

Reviews.Title: “Great location, where we stayed was going to b updated so will probably improve”
Reviews.Author: Yendon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the rooms that r to b upgraded, so better to come? Very good location, beach ok

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Peaceful Relaxing Entertaining”
Reviews.Author: shirley c
Reviews.Content: This place is the Best.. It has the Beach-- Entertainment --Beautiful Views--Best Happy Hour in Key West

Reviews.Title: “This is right on Duval St, Perfect balcony view of Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: knudson1970
Reviews.Content: This is and older hotel with a newer addition. There are no extra amenities just a bed to sleep. New pool in the working. But beautiful view. Close to everything you would like to do. Park the car and walk. Rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, we will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Alanvet
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay, great location, well maintained property and awesome staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: Joeman67
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost hotel was perfect. Check-in was speedy and extremely helpful and courteous. We arrived early, so our room wasn't ready yet; so we walked around the property and we delighted to have access to all the amenities, from the beach to the pool to the bars! The room was spectacular. A nice view of the pool and a balcony to enjoy an evening beverage. The room was very clean equipped with a microvave and refridgerator. The entire staff was friendly and treated us great! This is the place to relax after walking, eating, drinking and taking in the sights and sounds of Key West. We welcomed the quiet laid back atmosphere! Thanks for making a vacation a memorable one! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pools!”
Reviews.Author: msuek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Excellent value, the happy hour at their beach restaurant awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Cori R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay near the southernmost point in key west. It has 3 different swimming pools and since we are a family with younger children, the pools were a big hit. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Our bathroom faucet was loose but it was a minor irritation compared to how great it was to have a room that opened up to the pool. We will stay here again with the kids. We also loved being so close to a beach for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl10
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our trip to Key West where we stayed at this hotel and it is a very clean, friendly and nice location for us. It is at the end of Duval where it is very quiet but if you walk a few blocks you will be in the heart of all the excitement,we didn't mind the walk. We parked our car and never had to move it that is one thing I like about Key West it is so easy to get around. This hotel is very secure we never worried about our car. It has a very nice pool and the use of the beach at the Southernmost Hotel on the beach with free beach chairs for guests. It is just a very nice hotel with very nice people and I think whoever stays here would not be disappointed. We stayed there for 5 days and was very sorry to see it end, but we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seaskifamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most beautiful locations on the island. Better yet, even though they have lovely handicap accessible rooms; we wanted a top floor brand new handicap cap accessible rooms, that had a full on ocean view and deck. Even though these rooms were not designed as completely handicap accessible, management measured doorways, and installed handheld showers and shower benches , to allow us to stay in the exact room we wanted, Never has any management gone above and beyond to accommodate us like this. The views were the nicest we have ever experienced. Not only that, but the casual breakfast options, in the form of a beachfront cafe, and a casual bodega , provided fresh affordable healthy options.

Reviews.Title: “So many better places for a few dollars more”
Reviews.Author: kshawn
Reviews.Content: We arrived as 'walk-ins'. I've stayed in several hotels and B and B's in Key West over the past ten years. Granted, the room was cheap . Cons: AC barely worked (very loud), no coffee maker in the room, right next to the major construction project, when we lost money in the soda machine we told 'it wasn't their problem'. Not a biggie but no signs were put up to warn other guests. We weren't even told that they had a pool. (sometimes it is the small things that matter). Had to give the $20 cash for deposit on the remote control. Pros: Close to everything, clean room and good mattress. For only $20 a night more you can find several other options nearby; smaller inns who take care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: TantmaRN
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel for 4 nights in June. The room was comfortable and quiet. The staff was very helpful, especially Julie, she helped us book all our outings, took care of our bike rentals and recommended some really great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again”
Reviews.Author: pschensk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our second time and it was great. The rooms are more than adequate(you won't be spending too much time there anyway) for a couple. We have have been in a "pool view" king room the two times we have stayed and it has been great, especially since the pool has been improved and the pool/bar has been remodeled and enlarged. Tim, Rhonda, and Johnny B. at the bar are great and they may you feel as though you have your own personal bartender. The hotel is at the quiet end of Duval and is about 30 seconds from a beach and a great restaurant/bar at the Southernmost on the Beach(Joe is a great waiter/bartender). I'm sure we will continue to make this a yearly trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: susanpmoore
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 glorious nights at the La Mer Hotel, part of the Southernmost Collection of hotels in Key West. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiling faces and genuine kindness. The room and grounds were impeccable. The staff was gracious and helpful. The breakfast was fresh and very delicious. Every moment of our stay was fantastic. I have traveled to many destinations, but this hotel has been by far the best stay by far. I highly recommend anyone looking for lodging in Key West to make your reservations here. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PCAH
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay at when in Key West. The room was very clean and comfortable. My husband and I had a king room with the pool view. Very nice. The staff were outstanding. They always said hello, asked if there was anything we needed and, if there was, they had it done in no time. This hotel is at the quiet end of Duval Street but is an easy walk to the shops, restaurants, bars and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for an extended weekend to get away with some friends and also to celebrate our anniversary. It was our third time in Key West, but our first at Southernmost. We booked a pool view king room directly through the hotel's website, and took advantage of the 15% off special they had at the time. Our friends decided to book through Expedia, thinking they were getting the same room as us (for the same price), but ended up with a much smaller, parking lot view room. The pool view king room was clean, comfortable, and well-decorated. The bathroom did not have a tub, but rather a large tile shower (which I prefer), as well as a large vanity. It was too hot to really enjoy our balcony...if it were a little cooler, we definitely would have. The service at the hotel was top-notch...everyone was pleasant, but unobtrusive. We really enjoyed the pool and pool bar at the Southernmost, so much so that we didn't make it to any of the other pools on the property! Johnny B is a great bartender and such a character! The Southernmost Cafe serves a great breakfast, especially for those who had too much fun the night before. I love that they have self-service coffee at the hostess stand in case you have to wait (we never waited more than a few seconds for a table). The location of the hotel relative to the happening spots on Duval Street isn't great, but is totally manageable with some walking (work off those liquid calories!) or a pedicab. You are close to a couple convenience stores, the actual Southernmost Point, as well as art galleries, some bars (La Te Da is great!), and of course the beach. I had some reservations about the location before we arrived (having stayed at a nearby property previously), but found we thoroughly enjoyed where we were. Overall, we had an amazing time in a fantastic hotel, and would most definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelladybug0816
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel and great location in Key West. It is the quiter end of duval st. BUt once you start walking towards the popular side you can get a cab to the more popular night spots. It is also in walking distance to many restaurants, stores, etc. My favorite spot near the hotel was Ana's Cuban Cafe...it has everything you need. The hotel staff was very friendly, rooms nice and clean, nice pool area and very close to beach. Cant wait to book another stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding from check-in to check-out.”
Reviews.Author: Whanna1
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter, 2 grandchildren and I had a great 4 night stay at the Southernmost Hotel. I made reservations through Tracey and changed them the next day when our daughter and 2 grandchildren decided they would like to go and then changed again to add an additional night. Every one was very accommodating and taken care of. Cindy was very helpful at the front desk as was the gentleman who came to our room (twice) to unlock our safe. Being an early riser, coffee was excellent and ready at 6:00am each morning and the gentleman there was nice to talk with. Can't say enough about Johnny B. and his entertainment at the bar. My daughter and I also earned an ABA degree while there. (Beer Aficionado) Would definitely recommend and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: cwizmurph
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our son and his girlfriend had an amazing time at The Southernmost! The room was very nice, clean, and quite roomy. The pools are clean and gorgeous with great pool bars and plenty of fun activities. The bartenders are very friendly and competent. We rented bikes right from the concierge and biked all week around the island - definitely the way to go. You don't need a car. You can fit cases of beer and water right in your basket!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Newer, Pools are wonderful, Beach access too!”
Reviews.Author: tdzro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. The pools are really nice and by staying here you have access to their private beach and pier, so you can choose from the pool, the ocean, or the beach. Free entertainment at each pool, one raggae, one more classic beach music. Great place to relax, and right next to Duval St, so easy access to nightlife too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! New and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Satches
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Key West First Anniversary Vacay, and I LOVED Southernmost Hotel!! It is a bit expensive, but I think it's worth it. The location is great if you're trying not to be in the middle of all the action on Duval. I'm pregnant, so this was perfect for me...we could walk to everything but weren't overwhelmed by the crowd and noise and drunk people all over. We were debating between this hotel and a few others on Duval, and I'm so glad we chose this...it was soooo clean! I feel like the other places are sort of older and musty. A lot of reviews from the other hotels complained of old furniture. I know they have recently renovated Southernmost, so we must have gotten a renovated room because everything pretty much looked clean and new. They upgraded us to a King Superior room that overlooked the pool at a discounted price. I wish we got the upgrade for free, but the discount was fine. The hotel is literally like a minute walk to Southernmost Beach hotel, so we pretty much went there everyday. The pool area at the Beach hotel is much bigger, and they have a live band that played that was really good and made it more lively. It's hard to get chairs with an umbrella though if you don't go early. I would say to stay at this hotel and not pay the price of the beach hotel since it's literally across the street. We didn't eat at the hotel at all, so I can't comment on the food. The service was great and everyone was super friendly (especially compared to Miami, where we went next)!! We got a nice little box of chocolates with a card on our bed for our anniversary. I only gave it 4 stars because the beach is a little misleading. Southermost beach hotel has it's own "private beach" which is just some sand in a very small area, then a pier with a ladder you walk down that takes you to the water. So it's not really a true beach. There is a public beach right next door which they help maintain, and have a beach cafe on. That beach is very sea-weedy and also pretty small. It would have been so much better if they just cleaned up the sea-weed daily. It doesn't have to be perfect, but it would have helped. Esp for such a small beach. After seeing that, we just stuck with the pool and waited till we got to Miami for our beach time. I heard the beach cafe has a good happy hour, but we didn't partake. All in all, I would DEFINITELY stay here again if I came back to Key West, and I would tell my friends too! The cleanliness was key for me!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: EFulton
Reviews.Content: While the room that we stayed in was not quite what we expected, it was more than made up for in the activities director Boomer McFall! He set us up with paddle boarding, and personally instructed us in snorkeling. Then took our group for a snorkel experience right off the hotel pier. It was one of the best days of our stay in Key West! Next time I will make sure that we stay at the Southernmost on the Beach, and look up Boomer for more fun in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed at this resort for years. It's the best place on the island.”
Reviews.Author: StV6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Southernmost in different incarnations for almost twenty years and we're always happy to stay there. The staff is very nice, the accomodations are clean and it has a great location. I love the way you have access to a pier, several pools and even a beach. It's at the east end of Duval away from the noise and traffic but close enough to walk almost anywhere you want to go. It's only slightly more expensive than the cheap hotels and it's definitely worth it. The restaurant sits on the beach and has one of the best views on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Paridise”
Reviews.Author: Pistol30
Reviews.Content: We recently had 2 rooms for 12 nights at the Southern Most Hotel in Key West Florida. This is the second year in a row my family has travelled to paridise and stayed at the Southern Most Hotel. Again just like last year the rooms were clean, roomy and located in old town Key West at the "quiet" end of Duval St. This resort has 3 pools, 2 pool side bars, and a beach front cafe where the service and and food are extremely good and of good value. The staff are second to none on the island and are always there whether you need something from housekeeping or information from the concierge, but the service and smile you get from Johnny B at the pool side bar is enought to keep you coming back. From our hotel we can do the Duval crawl to the other end of Duval St which is a total of 1 mile. This might be one of the crazier walks you will ever do on a trip, there are fantastic restaurants, bars and shops as well as all of the characters you can find in Key West. Whether you are a couple or a family I believe the location and value you receive at the Southen Most Hotel is hard to beat, we will be back! Conrad D. Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel on the South end of Duval”
Reviews.Author: snsmith27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a friend on a quick trip to Key West from Miami. The hotel location was good: on the southern end of Duval Street and close to the water. The concierge was extremely helpful in getting us restaurant reservations, arranging a sunset cruise, giving us maps/discounts on some attractions, and renting us bicycles. Renting a bike is the way to go! It is a quick way to get around to nearby beaches. Rooms were clean, and we enjoyed the small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: KMC7777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel on a recent trip to Key West. The location is excellent - right at the southern end of Duval Street, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and do. Another perk is that since this is part of the Southernmost Collection of resorts, guests are able to use the actual ocean beach. It is a 1 minute walk across the street. The beach is kept clean and there is a decent little bar/restaurant there. My husband is an ocean lover so he didn't want to stay somewhere that only had a pool. Also, the pools are nice here. Guests have access to three different pools, two of which have bars alongside them. The drinks are overpriced (where aren't they?), but they do have top shelf liquor. The staff were excellent in general. The room was decent, kind of small, and had an older television (which I didn't mind but of course my husband was sure to point out it wasn't an LCD the minute we got there). They didn't have on demand movies, which surprised us, but overall since we didn't spend much time in the room it wasn't an issue. I would probably stay here again, or maybe try the Southernmost on the Beach next door, for a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Secret”
Reviews.Author: ottog01
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Keys for years and never knew this place existed. Thank you trip advisor. great place even better location 5 minutes to anywhere in the key. 3 pools to choose from all with in 2 minutes from each other

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Moontrip
Reviews.Content: Lovely good clean and comfortable hotel, close to most amenities. The in house restaurant on the beach had lovely views, friendly service and not unreasonable prices. Free wi-fi was appreciated. Our visit happened to coincide with Gay Week which added to the fun and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: wooploaf23
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 of my friends stayed at the Southernmost Hotel on Duval in mid-June! What an awesome hotel and a incredible time in KW! Check in was simple and any staff member at the property was so nice and helpful! Great amenities, clean, gorgeous landscaping around the pools and the property itself! Just amazing! Concierge (Greg) was extremely helpful in hooking us up with the Fury Ultimate Adventure (highly recommended) and giving us ideas on good restaurants and their locations. The pools and pool bars at both the Southernmost Hotel and the Southernmost on the Beach were amazing! Great drinks at the bars as well (a tad expensive though but you're on vacation, who cares!). Located at the quiet end of Duval, we usually took a cab. Not bad, between the 3 of us, an $8 cab ride isn't bad! All in all, it was a perfect trip to KW and if I get to go back, I will look no further than the Southernmost Hotel! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “It really is the best...”
Reviews.Author: Seawinds78
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived we spent ages trying to decide which of the southernmost properties to stay in. But it really doesn't matter as you get to use all the same facilities. the additional cost of the southernmost seems to be the fact that you are closure to the beach. This is a great complex with free parking, as parking is a really big issue in old town Key West. Make sure you visit Fort Zachary beach. Cooler and more shaded the the Southernmost. Great for snorkelling and kids. Beach cafe cheap by Key West standards. if you want to see real treasure the Mel Fisher museum is worth a visit. Plus enough pirate stuff to keep kids happy. Plus if you want a sunset sail throughly recommend Dangerous Charters.They actually do sail, as many of the other craft don't, the may have sails up but are under motor the whole time.Who wants to watch the sunset with an engine running, rather spoils the whole effect!! Finally look out for discount coupons they are all round town at info desks and in the streets next to the newspapers. They can save you serious amounts of money on the trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel on the Quiet End of Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: Clearview3000
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with nice resort amenities and a nice restaurant right on the beach. The room was clean and roomy with a pleasant decor and the bathroom had plenty of room. The staff was very nice and helpful. The resort pools and the bars were not large, but very inviting. This hotel is on the quiet end of Duval St. near the water. It is a fair walk (about a mile or so) down Duval St. to Mallory Square and where the action is. If you want to be in the middle of the action, this is not the place for you. If you want to stay in a nice hotel near the water and away from the action, I'd definitely recommend this place. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Key West Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KatieCavs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first trip to the Keys as an adult. The rooms are top notch and comfortable bedding! It is located on the quite end of the strip, but the price was very reasonalbe and we were going off the recommendation of my mom. There are 3 pools, the public beach, and their private seawall beach area along with a peir to lay out on. We didn't go to any of the pools, instead ended up at Donte's at the other end of the island. We did enjoy the happy hour at the cafe and would have to say it's the best happy hour in Key West for sure, even locals recommended it. I enjoyed the $3 Rumrunners and apps! Would recommend renting bikes while staying here, unless you really like walking. We walked the first day and were super happy with renting bikes the 2nd as it was so hot with no breeze. With bikes we were able to cruise around town a lot quicker and explore! I would def recommend this hotel and would def stay here again. The young people looking for serious partying prob won't be fans, but if you like to have a relaxing good time this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianaSteveO
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Southernmost Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. While we spent most of the daytime visiting the various sites around Key West, the Southernmost provided a wonderful place to rest and relax between daytime activities and our nightime debachary. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is convenient and close to the Duval Street entertainment however because it is on the southern part of Duval Street, it was on the "quieter" side of old town. The pools were wonderful, beautifully designed and landscaped, and refreshing. Also, you have access to all the amenities of the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel, so you had even more pool/entertainment options without the additional cost. Also the happy hour at the Southernmost Cafe was great! ($3 drinks/food) and we made a point to enjoy this everyday that we were there. If and when we return to Key West, we will return to the Southernmost Hotel also!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: PamMonroe_NY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. From the moment we checked in, the staff and service was wonderful. We went on the recommendation of a friend, who had recently been there. The location was quiet, yet accessible to the "action" on Duval. Though we wanted to be on the beach(unavailable), we were right across the street. Our third floor room had a pool view. We enjoyed the beach cafe, and the pool at the Southernmost on the Beach, where we spent most of our time.Free parking, and no "facilities fees" are a plus. And, being able to have use of the facilities after checkout was an added bonus. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and over the top service”
Reviews.Author: howlme01
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sunday through Saturday and had a blast. We had booked on expedia and didn't realize that all the southernmost hotels were combined and we got to use all 3 pools. Highly recommend the pool bar with Tim the bartender he was great. Also their cafe restaurant was good quality for both breakfast and dinner. Word to the wise don't go fishing and take it back for them to cook because they charge more. Every person that walks by you at the hotel says hi or good morning even when they're just the maids. The concierge booked an excursion for us on the fury ultimate adventure that was well.worth the money. Also the maids went above and beyond by lining up my sandals and picking clothes off the floor for us with a tip of about $3. We had them come every other day to get new towels. It's located at the far end of duval street about 2 blocks from where the action of bars start which was nice to be a little quieter at the end of the night. The overall experience was awesome and we'll definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ATCCSCS
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost is just wonderful. The rooms are large, with a good sized bathroom, and lots of amenities for the value. Free parking, which is huge in Key West, WiFi worked great. Lots of bars around the multiple pools. Friendly staff at check in and they even gave us free drink coupons! Definitely go to the Southernmost Cafe Bar at happy hour 4-7pm for $3 drinks and food; best in Key West! Will stay here again and again. It is at the quiet end of Duval St. so take a cab to the bars but it is cheap to get there, less than $6

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCO
Reviews.Content: What an awesome property! My husband and I had a room facing the pool which we loved but it was fairly noisy, if you are looking for something quiet. The room was spacious and clean and it was great to enjoy the amenties (beach, beach chairs and restaurant) at the Beachfront property but we never did use that properties pool as we enjoyed the pool offered at the Southernmost Hotel. The staff here was wonderful, especially at the concierge desk. It was very convenient to rent bikes right at the property and get advice on places to eat and things to do. This property is on the quiet end of Duval street - which I preferred - but it is an easy walk or bike ride to get to all the action. I will definately stay at this property again when we make a return visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: markCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southernmost in January and cannot recommend it highly enough. Although the hotel is a simple motel layout, the rooms are big and very comfortable, and the location is fantastic for a visit to Key West. The beach cafe and facilities across the road at the sister Southernmost on the Beach are stunning - and one of the highlights of our 5 & a half week holiday in Mexico and Florida. The cafe must be one of THE best places in Key West - one of the best restaurant meals we had on our travels, great happy hour drinks and food, and on the South beach where you can chill and watch the sunsets from the pier. A short walk up Duval Street and you are in the thick of the Key West action, but the hotel is amazingly quiet. If you can afford the extra price, the Southernmost on the Beach is the place to stay, but the Southernmost Hotel is a great option for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: kgonthego
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel with a big group of family members..... we loved the pool and the poolside bar. The pool is open late and lit up nicely at night. Rooms were a bit small but very clean. There was not a restaurant at the hotel, but the beach restaurant next door had great food. (Be sure to walk across to street to Bad Boy Burrito for an amazing meal.) The only issue we had was when a concierge botched our sunset sail reservations. All in all, a great stay. Well worth the price of the room. Be sure to wake up early one morning and walk down the dock of the Southernmost on the Beach for great sunrise viewing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: quietreader
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. It is located at the quiet end of Duval Street and you are still able to use the amenities of the other two resorts. The beach cafe was absolutely fantastic. Had the best Mahi Mahi there! and you cannot be the happy hour from 4-7pm with $3 drinks and appetizers! Honestly would not consider staying anywhere else, truly was an incredible stay. Clean rooms, friendly staff, great pools.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant stay would come back”
Reviews.Author: joyceyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost hotel towards the end of a 16 night fly drive. We started in Orlando at the theme parks then drove down the cost stopping at Sarasota, Naples, Fort Myers, Homestead etc. we never booked any hotels and just turned up at hotels and motels en-route. Of the entire trip we had a wonderfull time and met some lovely people and when we arrived in Key West during ladys week it was a welcome stop for 4 days of bliss. Ill start with the Hotel. we hadnt booked a room and turned up and spoke to very helpfull staff we asked to see a room and based on this decided to stay for the 3 nights we were at Key West. The reception staff were great as were the bar staff. we didnt spend a great deal of time at the pool but when we were there the pool staff were also very nice with entertainment laid on including wine and beer tasting which was fun. One thing to note is we stayed in the Southernmost but across the road are the rooms for the Southernmost on the beach, its all the same hotel and you use all the same facilities. As far as location goes it was good, your on the far end of Duval Street which is the opposite end to Mallory Square where the sunset party is so its a fair walk. We always found this to be quite nice and after dinner the walk back to the hotel was welcome to let it all go down and then you get to stop at numerous bars and shops on the way back. But if you have a problem walking or suffer with long walks then please bear that in mind as you may want to get a cab. The hotel was the most expensive of the trip but then we did end up being in key west during ladies week over the weekend so had to pay the weekend rates. We also asked the concierge lady to help us with booking our trips and she was great very friendly helpfull and knowledgeable so well worth asking. We did the Jet ski trip which left the beach at the hotel next door and this was absolutely amazing over an hour of Jet ski fun riding the waves around key west. we were lucky we saw some dolphins so keep your eyes open. We then had a very special trip where we got engaged. this was the Dolphin Safari. captain Gary was great and got us very close to two pods of dolphins where we could see them swimming beside the boat. If you do this trip i would recommend the sunset trip as not only do you get and excellant couple of hours on the water (hopefully see some dolphins) and do some snorkelling but you also get to watch the sunset from the ocean and see the entertainers at Mallory square. I cannot recommend this trip highly enough there were only 4 other people on the boat and its very personal and was worth every penny. The only trip we were dissapointed with was the ghost walk. it was more like a long walk with someone telling old wives tales and shouting "your doomed" at everyone. you are not allowed into the supposed haunted locations anymore so you end up just standing around outside. Dissapointing We cant fault key west and loved every minute of our stay from the drive down seeing the iguannas to a lovely hotel. We would definately go back to key west and the Southern most hotel. One thing to note is that there is not alot of beach space around key west and most of the activity is on the water, We also stayed at Key Largo for a night but wished we had just kept going and had the extra night at key west or maybe Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rcaton
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the BEST in Key West. This was our 4th stay at the Southernmost and they continue to impress us. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The grounds are immaculate. The staff is by far the best we have ever encountered. The pool areas and pool bars are fantastic. The location of the hotel is great. On Duval St so its convenient to everything but at the quiet end of the town. The open air beach cafÃ© has the best breakfast in town. Eat breakfast right on the beach. Try the Key West Bendidict â€“ eggs benedict with Key West pink shrimp. Its awesome. The happy hour at the beach cafÃ© is also great. 4pm to 7pm. $3 apps. (wings, tuna sliders, calamari, and mini hibachi) and low drink prices. Get there early to get a seat. We are already booked for our next visit in Nov. Canâ€™t wait to get back to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: correa0107
Reviews.Content: My husband, 1 year old daughter, and I stayed here while in Key West. The rooms were nice, staff was very nice, and the location was great. We walked everywhere. We used the beach at the Southernmost on the Beach and ate at the Cafe, which was good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and overall a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: George_Oscar_Bluth
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay and while I will say was a little underwhelmed at first (due to high expectations after reading reviews), as the days went by, I appreciated the quality of the hotel more and more and left feeling very satisfied for the money spent. The hotel is very clean, with a great pool and bar area, and the staff was exceptionally pleasant and accommodating to our needs. We didn't get much of a view as our room exited onto a parking lot, but the room was very quiet, clean, and the bed provided for a good night's sleep. Its location at the quiet end of Duval makes it perfect for families trying to avoid the late night ruckus, but bring your walking shoes as we probably walked 4 miles a day while visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of April for two nights and were pleasantly suprised. Rooms were pretty basic, but all we needed. The pool (s) were great along with the happy hour pool bar specials. The Southernmost on the Beach Cafe being close was a plus. We also liked the location because we got to walk the full strip of Duval each night.

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: keedelcambre
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. I felt like I was a residence of the Southernmost after being there for 5 minutes. Boomer, Micky B, Todd, and several others were simply amazing. We were in Key West for a 40th Birthday and had about 16 people with us, all staying there. They were able to accommodate our group and put some of our rooms near each other. Boomer entertained us and we made it an everyday affair. We even told our family members hello on the webcam near the pool by the beach. Be sure to check it out but be cautions: Do not look at it after you return home, you'll be sad! We had a minor A/C issue but it was quickly resolved and they took care of us. I visited this property on my last visit and couldn't wait to actually stay there. Our group has decided to make it an annual Adult Spring Break!

Reviews.Title: “room 143”
Reviews.Author: cartersbug
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat disappointed. We booked this trip in Oct./2010 for 6 nights.Upon arrival we were put in room 143. Room 143 is a room with a window that looks into the pool shed.After expressing our disappointment we were placed in room 270 which had no balcony and a view of the parking lot. After speaking to the front desk 2x about placing us in any room of the total complex with an ocean view/balcony, whether there was a fee increase or not we were ignored and never moved again. I would caution others to make sure you clearly determine that you do not get room 143before arrival. The hotel was good otherwise, but we were disappointed that after booking so long ago for 6 nights that more effort on the part of the hotel was not made to provide a better room. Room 143 should be closed or it be at a very low price with the guest being informed before they arrive of its layout.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Eastc0astraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night trip to the Keys and Miami Beach. Our first 3 nights were at the Southernmost. I can't give enough positive feedback!! Great time, great staff! Great location! It was our first trip to the Keys. The Hotel was clean and beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful. Nice and casual. Our Room wasn't quite ready when we arrived, so we were offered complimentary drinks at the bar while we waited. The next day we lounged at the pool near the beach. There are 3 pools as well as the beach. It was nice to not have to "save" a seat like you do on a cruise. Plenty of lounge chairs! We signed up for "wine school" great little wine tasting at no charge! We did not have dinner at the hotel but they offered some nice menu items like ahi tuna by the pool. My husband loved it. I could go on and on... Nice staff, nice hotel! I want to go back soon!! Might even take the kids next time:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: jelly4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Southermost hotel in Key West for 4 nights in March 2011. It is situated at the far end of Duval St near Southmost point (I guess the name gives that away!). When we checked in the staff were friendly and very informal. We were given a room upgrade on check in too. However when we went to the room there was a dreadful smell of damp!! The room also only had one very small window and was very dark. We went back to the front desk to ask to be moved. They were very helpful and showed us 2 more rooms in the Southermost and 1 room in the Southermost on the beach hotel (across the road). We choose a smaller room than the one we were originally offered.... anything to get away from that smell of damp.. urggh! I thought the rooms in the Southernmost hotel were nicer than the one we seen in the Southermost on the beach across the road. The room was a little cramped but it was clean and had a nice comfy bed so I can't complain! The main pool area is small but very nicely put together. There is one more pool on the grounds and you can also use the pool and beach at the Southernmost on the beach across the road. We spent a few hours at the pool side bar one day and we really enjoyed that. If you want to be in the middle of the craziness of Duval st then this hotel might not be for you. But if you want to be in a quieter area close to the craziness then its perfect. I think that this hotel is very well located and would stay here over the hotels on North Roosevelt Boulevard as its within walking distance of the main bars etc. its also a nice walk to Duval street from here. One last thing... the concierge recommeded Duffys restaurant but we weren't at all impressed. I wouldn't return to Duffys but would return to the Southermost hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: JAG123Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and really liked it! Wish we'd stayed here longer to be honest it was that good. The location is great, about a 20min walk to Mallory Square but that was fine by us. It was at the quiet end of Duval Street and had lots of nice upmarket restaurants and wine bars near by. We arrived quite early ,12pm and our room wasn't ready ( check in is at 3pm) So we decided to have a walk down Duvel Street to get our bearings. When we came back at 3pm we were directed to our room ( deluxe queen) which was in the second block on the ground floor. It was large with a small bathroom,the decor was nice and modern but the room was dark, so we had to put 4 lights on when we were getting ready and our window over looked the walk way and car park, so we couldn't really open the curtains in the evening. The room had a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. You have access to two beaches, 3 pools and a beachside cafe at Southermost and I couldn't fault any of them. The beachside Cafe was great and very reasonable, so we used to go there most days for breakfast as well as happy hour. Happy hour was between 4 - 7 and included wine, draft beer and rum runners all for $3. We used to stick with the beer because the rum runners were too strong for us! They also had some appertizers on offer and thay were nice. We liked the land and sea grill the best. We used to spend most of our days by the main pool or on the public beach near the cafe. There was a really great beach attendant on south beach who would come round with frozen strawberrys and ice pops in the afternoon, which we thought was a nice touch. Key West is amazing! So many differant types of people all mixing together. At one end it's really upmarket but towards the north end of Duval Street it got a bit louder and thats where we noticed a lot of the spring breakers would party. Mallory Square was good fun and the sunset was one of the best we'd ever experienced. Internet is free at the hotel, beach towels where always on handand they're were water fountains all over the resort, where you can fill up your bottle and collect ice from. It was great and hopefully one day we'll have the chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Quality for the price! Cheap Happy Hour!”
Reviews.Author: jillybean025
Reviews.Content: This location is unbeatable. You're close enough to the main strip to stumble home, yet you're right on the beach too. You have access to everything that their other hotel has too... the entire private beach, cafe, and bar. $3 Rum Runners at Happy Hour at the bar - can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Frozen Strawberries, Towsicles, AND POPSICLES”
Reviews.Author: nextdoor273
Reviews.Content: Most people complained about the room size, if you are on a vacation to sit in your hotel room you should just stay at home. We thought this was a great stay!!! Juan and the beach staff are the best--- excellent service and Bill the bartender has my heart. We wish we could have stayed longer! The location of the beach and use of the chairs is worth the $$ in its self. The only cranky people were other travelers! We went during "spring break" however we were not on "spring break" if you are young you will be classified as a spring breaker even if you are responsible and just having a good time on vacation! Can not wait to go back ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: AwwBabyElelphants101
Reviews.Content: This was by far our favorite hotel in the Keys (we stayed at 4 on this trip) ...Beautiful hotel with amazing pools and beach access. We really enjoyed the free lounge chairs at South Beach as well as the Southernmost Cafe on the beach. This hotel was a highlight of our trip. It was slightly pricey, but not too bad. I will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but give me an updated room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: raedalt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned. We enjoyed our 5 days in Key West. We will use this hotel/resort again because of the fantastic grounds, pools, happy hour, restaurant, good staff. BUT, we will DEFINITELY get an updated room with a view next time. How can you enjoy paradise with a view of the parking lot? A room with a little balcony would also allow for an open window to catch a fresh breeze....our room was stuffy. Unfortunately, we called our room 'the cave'. The noise from the room next door (college spring break party girls) could also be heard through the walls. So, ask for the updated part of the resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place great value and service”
Reviews.Author: leon039
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. In my opinion it is the perfect location near all of the shops and restaurants but far enough away from the night life. The staff was very helpfull. I would stay there again, and hope too in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great second stay”
Reviews.Author: Breezy_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the southernmost. Review is much as before, the hotel itself is basic and adequate, you are not on vacation to stay in your room. It is the location and the access to the poll and beach that make this great. If you are looking for a quiet place to lounge, that puts you in walking distance of it all, this is the place to stay. And I must give credit to the cleaning staff. We spent two full days at the beach and brought back our fair share of sand. Each day the cleaning staff did a spectacular job getting all of that out of the room. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key.”
Reviews.Author: Woguy
Reviews.Content: The best thing this place has going for it is the location. It has its own beach, across the street, and abuts a public beach, and the pool is very nice. Another positive is the staff, which was very attentive, and the concierge, who was excellent. We had an "economy" room--at $200 a night. It was clean, large, and comfortable, but there were no windows, and there were doors to service and/or storage areas on two of the three sides when you opened the door. Wireless internet was promised but not delivered. If you want a newspaper in the morning you have to go across the street to Southernmost on the Beach, where better amenities are apparently available to the quality folk.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: fossilgirl
Reviews.Content: Yes, the southernmost is kind of expensive, but given all you receive (location, free parking, three pools, pool bars, your own beach) it's worth it. Rooms are fairly big with a fridge and enough storage space for clothes and toiletries. Beds are comfy and the AC works. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “It would have been fine except for the beach attendant”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenSDArtist
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dated and in need of freshening. The convienient location and free parking however make-up for the short-comings of the room. The front desk staff was very courteous. Prices are very high in Key West so even if the cost of the room seemed out-of-line, it probablly conformed to local standards....about double the cost of the same room elsewere. The issue that I have concerns the rude and embarrassing behavior of the beach attendent. Without my room key I was asked to get off my beach chair or pay $5...I left the beach. A small incident but enough to prompt me to wriite this review, discourage friends from staying at this hotel, and probably never stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: TraxwazNewcatle
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed here was in July 2008 so decided to stay there again on our family trip in 2010. Only negative was the bedding felt damp - staff said it was down to the humidity - when we told them them we had stayed here a couple of years ago and in the ame month e didn't have this problem they put a humidifier in the room which thankfully done the trick. It is a good place to stay -it's right at the bottom end of Duvall street, so you don't get all the noise. The rooms aren't huge but it's merely a place shower and sleep - you are out nearly all day & night. We had 2 double beds which were big & comfy and the bathroom's a decent size. Maid service everyday - nice & clean. Nice breakfasts and meals in the beach restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bluebusSayrePa
Reviews.Content: my wife and i would like to thank the bartender rhonda for her freindleness,and for being such a very nice young lady.she is a credit to your company. thank you phil&jeanine sayre pa.

Reviews.Title: “Room could use some updating.”
Reviews.Author: youhadtoask
Reviews.Content: The other reviews tell the story pretty well, nice hotel in good location. We had an issue that the bathroom didn't have a fan or an opening window. This causes a problem with humidity in the room that the AC wasn't able to overcome. Wife hated how long it took to dry her hair and that it we never could dry out our wet tee shirts in the room. We ended up putting them out in the car to dry. The beach restaurant was very good and also a good value for being right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and use the SOTH amenties”
Reviews.Author: MrsOtter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southermost on the Beach in July with a beachfront room. Beautiful. We decided to keep costs down on our most recent trip to KW this past week, and stayed at the Southermost Hotel instead. The property is older and it shows in the rooms. When I pulled on the shower know to turn on the water, the faucet actually moved with it. The beds were comfortable, the mini fridge is a great touch. This property just isn't as nice as the SOTB. That said, it's just a place to sleep, right? The rooms are clean, just dated. Grab your beach bag, walk across the street and use the bars and private beach of the SOTB and save some cash. This location keeps you away from the noise of Duval but you are steps away from the Southernmost Point photo op. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LoriIoniaMI
Reviews.Content: Visited Key West for a few days, stayed at the Southernmost Hotel, it was great! Clean, upscale rooms, on Duval Street, we walked or biked to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!!”
Reviews.Author: roomful
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic and the water was a short block walk and to the Beach Cafe which had incredible food and drinks and very good prices. The hotel offered beach chairs, towels, umbrellas and there were always someone coming around to refill your drink glasses. Everyone at the Hotel was very nice and we had a very relaxing time there. But it had to end too soon. One evening we really enjoyed, there was a wine tasting class conducted by Boomer and Cabe. Between the two of them they were a wealth of information and we were impressed with the amount of knowledge Cabe had about wines and the areas of where the grapes were grown. The two of them worked very well together. Thank them both

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, staff, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: needtogetoutmore51
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first, but certainly not last, stay at this beautiful hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Boomer had great activities each day, including beer school and wine school, which enhanced our experience. James at the poolside bar gets 5 stars for the best Bloody Mary on earth. The rooms, pool, restaurant, and beach were all spotless. LOVE this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SCITUATED
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed 4 days here. Staff are very attentive. On-site services and food/drink are very reasonable. Highlight is the happy hour at the beach bar. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast poolside!!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie255
Reviews.Content: Had so much fun with the activities director, Boomer...you didn't want to leave the gorgeous pool area!! Lots of games, trivia and even Beer and Wine School!! I graduated with a 4.0!!! :) Hotel rooms are clean and updated and reasonable! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel on Duval”
Reviews.Author: TVSlots
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise and were very happily surprised. A beautiful property, nice pool area, we had a patio room off the pool. A fun bar by the pool with nice sized flat screen tvs where lots of people were enjoying the football playoffs. The beds were super comfy and had nice soft linens. The "Beer School" held near the pool on certain days was alot of fun, I wish we'd have been there for "Wine School". They seem to have lots of activities there on the property. It's just a block from the beach and right on Duval. We were worried that we'd be too far from the action on Duval but the whole street is just a mile long, and walking to Mallory Square for sunset was no problem at all for anyone who can walk a little. There is lots of parking if you rent a car. They seemed to be doing a lot of work around the property, getting it ready for spring I assume...it will just get nicer than it already was. Very happy with our 3 day stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. And less expensive than the place we usually stay farther west on Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury”
Reviews.Author: WheelingWVMarty
Reviews.Content: On the quiet end of Duval, this is a real jewel. Quiet, nicely appointed rooms. A good find.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it's that nice”
Reviews.Author: peavey35
Reviews.Content: We slept at Southernmost Hotel the night of December 26 2010. The room was very beautiful in terms of style and decoration, but we were deceived about the cleanliness and the room location. In the shower, there were still someone else's hair on the tile floor. The worst part is coming, I was already in the bed ready to sleep, and when my boyfriend arrived in the bed, there was a big bug on the sheet, because it was dark he doesn't know if it was a cacaroach or a lucost. He only told me once we were back in Canada because he knew I wouldn't have been able to sleep all night. And beside this event, we didn't sleep well because of the doors clapping and the garbage truck in the parking. And about the service, we forgot a sweater at the hotel, and two week after our stay at the hotel I tried to reach someone from the room service, I left two messages and I never got a call back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillyphan16
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Key West without hotel reservations. Drove down A1A till we saw this place. Nice location on the ocean. Reasonable rooms. 3 pools. Private beach although it was pretty full. Our room had a balcony overlooking the southern end of Duval St. (the town's main thoroughfare). We had to walk a little way and across a street to get to the beach. The room was nice with a king bed and fridge. Only thing I didn't like were the plastic cups. Great location. There's a scooter/bike rental place right across the street. Beware, the first shop you'll see when walking away from the hotel up Duval St. is an adult entertainment facility. Key West is a great town. Almost like another country in the USA. And make sure you go to Zac Taylor State Park to watch the sun set. The overseas high drive is awesome. Beware: it will take you 9 hours to get out of Florida though if driving north on 95.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be better”
Reviews.Author: lilyruo
Reviews.Content: This hotel locates in downtown Key West on the famous Duval Street. Newly renovated, and seems still in renovation. Very clean and the service is superb. Their swimming pool is big compared to other hotel, and drink/dessert in the bar are all $3 after 3pm. My favorite part is that the hotel has a private beach where you can take free towels and lie on the lounge chair on the beach and enjoy an afternoon nap and some drinks. Will definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: SMac848
Reviews.Content: Since I always seem to find myself taking time to write critical reviews of bad places, I've decided to make a point to remember to recommend places that are great. Southernmost Hotel is one of these places. We've been going to Key West for years now, but we always stayed at the Best Western Hibiscus. This year I broke tradition and booked with Southernmost Resorts. It was the best thing I ever did. It's got everything you would want for a relaxing vacation. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The only improvement needed in the rooms would be better quality TVs. There are several pools and all have poolside bars. The front desk and concierge are very accomodating. We will be staying here for years to come. You can't go wrong if you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Walls Somewhat Thin Though”
Reviews.Author: larslentz
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the location at the end of Duval Street and near the water. However, we could hear everyone next door because the walls are thin here. There were no parties going on either, it was just moderate conversation levels that could be heard. Rooms were clean and updated, but not spacious. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. Parking was free and out front. Another thing of note is that the room door exits to the parking lot or elevated walkway - not like a hotel would exit to an interior hallway, making this more of a motel than a hotel. The breakfast is not included, but it was in a nice open-air restaurant on-site and by the ocean. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome & good facilities”
Reviews.Author: MissBugg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a week in South Beach, Miami and the difference was amazing! We parked the car for free outside our room, we got a really warm welcome from AJ on reception, which left a lasting good impression. The hotel has three swimming pools, hardly anyone on them when I was there, they give you free towels, the loungers on the beach are free to hotel guests and there's lots of seating in the extensive grounds. The hotel also has a small artificial beach and pier where you can watch the sun go down in peace. You can walk to all of the points of interest from here but its at the quiet end of the street. Really, what's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great two day stay with kids for Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: Jmacq92
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in this nice hotel. We liked the price, the location, the concierge service and the amenities. We parked our car and walked Key West during our entire stay: Mallory Square, the Audubon House, the little White House and the marina are all within 10 to 20 minute walk from the hotel, which is at the very end of Duval St, right by the Southernmost Point landmark. Dawn at the concierge desk was very instrumental in booking a sail cruise and recommending restaurants. Thank you, Dawn! The rooms were either new or recently remodeled, very clean and the bath/shower area was roomy. We enjoyed the hotelâ€™s private beach, across the street, with free beach chairs: a great place to have breakfast or dinner. An excellent value/price ratio overall.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Strange if not on the "beach"”
Reviews.Author: orange-whip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Southernmost Hotel. The employees at this hotel, all who we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is nice, in that its at the end of Duval Street, in a quiet location. All in all I would say our stay was nice, our room was clean and fairly large, which is a big plus. However, the entrance to our room was odd, we climbed a weathered stair case and walked down an open hallway with worn outdoor carpeting - the door to our room opened out to the outdoor hallway instead of in toward the inside of the room, not a big deal, however, it made getting luggage in and out a little awkward. The bed seemed to have seen better days, and the bath towels were small, like bath mat small. The southernmost complex does have some nice features and seemed to get nicer the closer you got to the actual beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Energy_Bob1
Reviews.Content: On the first afternoon of our stay here at the Southernmost, the time of the Wine tasting was ambiguous and we arrived late. Boomer retrieved two fresh wine glasses and led personalized tasting for myself and my wife. He turned a frustrating situation into fun and enjoyment. We were introduced to a new winery and purchased four bottles at a local wine shop to take home. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: eck567
Reviews.Content: Perfect location within walking distance to all Duval Street has to offer. Room was comfortable and more than adequate for our stay. Food in the restaurant was delicious and the view looking out was great. Would definately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: CliveNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel from the 27th Sep for 4 nights. The staff were friendly, but the room was a bit of a disappointment. Low light, very low water pressure, and the shower head was loose. There was no balcony, and nowhere to sit in our room except for on the beds. We spent as little time as possible in the room for these reasons. The pool and bar were closed for refurbishment, with a lot of builderâ€™s rubble all over the place. However I appreciate that refurbishment has to be done at sometime. We were not informed of this work being carried out. We spent most of the time around the sister hotelâ€™s pool, (Southernmost on the Beach) which is lovely. The bar staff were very friendly, and the pool area a delight. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel if your budget allows, as it is much nicer. We thought 4 nights in Key West is quite sufficient for what is there. Donâ€™t bother with the Conch Train tour, as it is very boring. We â€œJumped shipâ€� half way through as we thought it a waste of time (and $!!), as did most of the other passengers. I would highly recommend the snorkelling trip on â€œFuryâ€�. Fantastic time, with staff who went out of their way to ensure our enjoyment, as well as the Jet Ski tour of the island. An hour of pure excitement and interest. Much better than whizzing backwards and forwards in one area. Absolutely loved both activities. The Southernmost Hotel is ideally located. The area where this hotel is much quieter than the other end of Duval St, but the buzz and excitement is only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Reasonable Price , Friendly Staff, Amazing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: NBJones1
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I recently took a trip to Key West and decided we would just find a hotel when we got there (my husband and I live in Fort Myers Beach, we took the ferry to Key West and we were only staying for one night). We looked at many different places, both online and in person when we arrived, and we couldn't be happier with finding Southernmost Hotel. The hotel was clean and safe and the entire staff was extremely friendly. The amenities were very nice and the beach front dining and pool were beautiful. There were no extra or hidden fees. We paid the rate the receptionist quoted, plus tax - that's it. I will definitely be coming back to Key West with my husband and friends and we will definitely stay at Southernmost. It is farther from the middle of Duval action, but the walk wasn't bad and with all the bicycle or car taxis available it is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Most Fun”
Reviews.Author: TripAdCaptain
Reviews.Content: Our family really liked this hotel. Itâ€™s located at the Southernmost end of the island which is a long walk to the craziness on Duval and the entertaining Mallory Square. This is not fancy and the rooms are a bite small, but this hotel has a lot to offer. We had a double bed on the second floor. Key West is a party town hotels can be noisy at night. This hotel is no different. We did experience a rude bartender/waitress at their restaurant. We liked being able to use all the pools(which were not all heated) at all the Southernmost properties. Lodging in KW is getting outrageously expensive and this hotel offers good value. Would definitely stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: MEDTRAV
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to "Cayo Hueso" (KeyWest), the bones key, we stayed two nights, the hotel staff was not at all interested in giving an "extra mile". Very dry treatment, unfriendly is the adjective to use more properly, not enough towels, the remote control didn't work, the door didn't close quite properly. The staff reaction to my claims were not what I expected, it seems they are used to give this treatment to their guests and still feel they did a wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Awwww....Just Amazing....<3”
Reviews.Author: MariJavi2010
Reviews.Content: What we can say about it? Everything was just perfect, we were there for 3 days, and we had the time of our lives.....!!!! Southermost Cafe located just across the street was delicious, the service was good, and the drinks VERY GOOD!!!! hahaha.... Good thing to do if u are gonna be there for a few days is....rent a bike!!!, they are so cheap and is the easiest way to go all the way around the isle, and you don't even have to worry about the parking, you can park it anywhere!....another thing which was very convenient was that Southermost Hotel offers you storage luggage, we were departing @ 7 pm, we check out @ 11 am, and thanks to this service we enjoyed the rest of the afternoon having fun at the pool!!!! Beautiful Hotel, Beautiful Key West!!!!! We are going to miss Key West!!!!! Buaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.......=(

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Awesome!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 8miruela
Reviews.Content: I asked a girlfriend to take a road trip to the Fl Keys, on the spur-of-the-moment. We rented a car in Orlando and drove down to Key West. We stayed at this great hotel with loaded amenities!!!! Met this great guy called "Boomer" - aka......"The Boom"; he's the hotel's director of activities. WOW was we in the right place at the right time!!! Boomer's diligent, organized, a great speaker, and conscientious "pleaser" - always making sure everyone at the pool signed up and participated in the daily planned activities. All employees were cognizant in making sure we were taken care of; for example the housekeeping ladies, front desk personnel, the cafe manager, and a BIG round of applause to the "general manager". There are many employees I'd like to personally mention as well, they are: Senor Juan, our beach attendant, who pampered us with the frozen pineapple as well as frozen face cloths - WOW. Heather and husband Kevin - the pool bartender also named Kevin, the beach bartenders, Cassie et al. Thank you for all the great service. Kudos to you all!!!! Sincerely, Carrie from Maryland (formally a Floridian).

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding/Honeymoon Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinShooz
Reviews.Content: I apologize in advance for the lengthy review, but for all you detail-oriented folks out there, I hope you find the information useful. I tried to include all the information I had trouble gathering on my own before the trip. The Southernmost Hotel is part of a group of 4 facilities that form an "L" shape at the southernmost tip of Key West. The Southernmost Hotel (aka SMH for this review) is at the top of the "L", La Mer Hotel and the Dewey House are directly "below" and across the street from it, the Southernmost Beach Cafe is at the corner of the "L" overlooking their private beach and pier, and Southernmost On The Beach forms the short end of the "L" with its own pool, tiki bar, and hammocks. Staying at any of the facilities allows you access to all four resorts' amenities. There are other hotels and B&B's in the area with "Southernmost" in the name, but these four properties are all owned by the one group. We stayed 3 nights at SMH in one of the penthouse rooms on the 3rd floor, room 332, in late September. The main pool and tiki bar at SMH were under construction (lots of construction goes on in Key West in September, apparently) but there is an additional pool at SMH for guests to use, not to mention the pool at Southernmost On The Beach.
