We called the 800 number to the resort to book our reservation, which I HIGHLY recommend-- due to the construction, they were offering all of their rooms at $99/night. This offer was not available on any website I checked, including their own. It is only available via phone. I advised the reservations person that we would be getting married during our stay and he made a special note in our reservation to ensure we got a penthouse room. Now, onto the room details. The room itself was very spacious with vaulted ceilings and a ceiling fan. The decor was warm, uncluttered, and airy, and we felt at home right away. The king-size bed was comfortable, but the pillows were flat and lumpy; in fact, the pillows were the only thing in the room that appeared to be old and in need of replacement. Armed with how-to information from the internet, I carefully checked the room for bed bugs (canâ€™t ignore the media scare on this one, right?) and it was squeaky clean. Opposite the bed was a multi-use storage unit that held a decent-sized mini fridge, a small microwave, coffee pot, and ice bucket on the left-hand side; a large flat-panel TV, several drawers, and a safe in the middle portion; and a closet with an ironing board/iron in the right-hand side. The best part about the storage unit was the safe, which was in place of one of the drawers. I loved the easy accessâ€”no bending awkwardly into a dark closet to type in a code, and it was easy to see into (especially useful when youâ€™re leaving and you want to make sure the safeâ€™s empty). The worst part about the storage unit were the doorsâ€”if you pushed them shut, they slammed loudly, so you had to carefully close them each time. Available electrical outlets around the room were a bit scarce, and we ended up charging one of our phones in the bathroom. The tile floor was chilly, of course, but the bed was on an area rug so you could put socks on before braving the tile. The far wall was largely taken up by french doors which opened onto a great balcony. The balcony was maybe 6'x12', furnished with a lounge chair, two regular chairs, and a table, and seemed very secluded due to the mostly solid fencing around it. It did overlook the parking lot, but you could also see into the pool, and if you looked off to the far right, you could see the water. A large palm tree waving in the breeze right beside the balcony added to the secluded feeling and ambiance. We spent some portion of every evening on the balcony, sitting in the chairs and bathing in the moonlight. It was wonderful. The bathroom (and the room, for that matter), were painted a warm yellow. The bathroom was well-designed and easy for the two of us to get ready in simultaneously (granted we are both pretty low-maintenance). I loved the shelving on either side of the mirror; it really kept the counter from getting cluttered. The granite countertop was pretty and functional. The handles on the faucet were odd, and at first I kept turning the cold water on full-blast when I meant to turn it off, but I got the hang of it pretty quickly. The walk-in shower was very spacious and easily fit two people without crowding. The handle to adjust the water was in an awkward spot, and it was difficult to adjust it to get just the right temperature, but the rainshower-style showerhead was great. The worst thing about the bathroom was that the main light switch turned on both the overhead light and a fan, which was really loud. If I was in the bathroom by myself with the door open and my husband was trying to talk to me from the room, I could not hear him over the fan. The best part about the bathroom was the light in the shower (not attached to a fan, ironically), which doubled as a perfect nightlight with the door almost shut. One side note: If you are a bride getting ready for your wedding, there is no make-up mirror, there is only the mirror above the sink. The lighting is pretty good, and is not a fluorescent bulb, so you can actually feel good about how you look instead of the washed-out, wrinkle-highlighting, blue-tinged fluorescent glow you might get in another hotel, but if you want any up-close-and-personal mirror gazing, you might want to bring your own. There is also a full-length mirror in the main room. As to the hotel amenities and staff, we were very pleased with both. The front desk staff members were always extremely helpful and friendly, accommodating every request we made with a smile. The concierge (dark-haired very fit man with a great smile; I canâ€™t remember his name) was cheerful and offered lots of information on the area, providing a map and printouts of restaurant menus he recommended, and lots of coupons. The bartenders at the Southernmost Beach CafÃ© (John and Cindy I think?) were attentive and conversational, and did a great job keeping up with the happy hour customers. Be sure to take advantage of the happy hour there. The drink prices are great, and the appetizer prices are decent, although the portions are small. If you go for the grillers, take the food off the skewers before you grill it or the skewers will catch on fire. Also, they apparently have a featured beer each day which is even cheaper than the happy hour prices ($2 for a beer is awesome), so check that out too. We ate at the Beach CafÃ© for breakfast once also; the food was good but the view of the beach and water were great. Speaking of the beach, all the beaches in Key West have a seaweed problem and have to be groomed periodically to remove what the waves deposit there (its mucky and it stinks). Southernmost has a person who takes care of this a couple times throughout the day; he also stacks/unstacks chairs and little side tables, hands out popsicles, and helps move the umbrellas when the sun shifts (you have to rent umbrellas; they are $5 and worth it). Chair usage for hotel guests is free, and you can get beach towels from the front desk of your hotel. If you are looking for a venue to get married in, I donâ€™t recommend their beach, as it is small and thereâ€™s a blah looking barrier wall that youâ€™d likely have in the background of your photos. Iâ€™ve heard their fountain area is pretty for weddings, but I didnâ€™t personally see it. We got married on Smathers Beach, which is a public beach. No fees are required to use it, and I thought it was much prettier. Our ceremony was at 6pm and we were practically the only ones out there. Itâ€™s on the opposite side of the island from the setting sun, so if youâ€™re looking for a sunset wedding, you might want to check other venues out, closer to the Mallory Square side. Having said that, our ceremony was early enough in the evening that there was still good light for pictures, and after the vows were exchanged, we went to the other side of the island and watched the sunset over dinner and drinks. I thought I wanted a sunset wedding, but what we did actually turned out better. On a side note, Key West Weddings To Go did a great job on our elopement ceremony and photographs, and Key West Cakes whipped up some amazing cupcakes (vegan evenâ€”they easily accommodated our dairy allergy) for our wedding â€œcakeâ€�. I highly recommend both companies; even if youâ€™re not getting married, stop by Key West Cakes and have some dessert! All in all, we had a wonderful stay at Southernmost Hotel and in Key West. I hope you do, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: destrier
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at the southern end of Duval street. Made everything easy to get to. Nice room, great maid service, always had everything perfect. The concerges were the best, made everyday an adventure. The rooms were clean, the air conditioning was ice cold, the grounds were nice, the pool was nice the only complaint was if you didn't get up at 3 AM you didn't get any hot water for showers, I was taking showers at 6am, 7am, 8am and never got anything except ice cold water. The very last day I had an early flight out and had to shower at 3:30AM and the water was hot??? Still...next time I go I'm staying here again

Reviews.Title: “great value option, beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: katrinalush
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights mid august. Cannot fault the hotel. very pleasant reception staff. hotel rooms are functional rather than luxurious but clean and comfortable with safe, coffee maker etc. Brilliant location as right at end of Duval Street which seems to be the main street for all of Key West, without the noise associated with further up the street. Did not need the car we had hired as all attractions within walking distance. Able to take breakfast at the cafe of an associated hotel - the cafe was right on the beach and was a lovely spot for breakfast. Lovely swimming pool, which because it was enclosed by the walls of the hotel, was blissfully warm. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we visit Key West again, which we intend to do so at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel epitomized the attitude "You are lucky to be in our hotel"”
Reviews.Author: bertguy33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in July, the first visit for my girlfriend. One extremely surly manager (Todd), rude, inconsiderate employees who don't seem to care about the guests, and even after a thorough debrief with a manager (Elizabeth), there was no effort or hint of any apology at checkout. Waited for 3 weeks for someone to respond to our written remarks on the hotel's comment cards (the hotel advertises it takes all guest comments very seriously) before sending an in depth email to again address how rudely we were treated. Again, no effort at all from this hotel. All this despite continued verbal assertions that our experience was important to the hotel (from the aforementioned manager, Elizabeth). The property grounds are nice, but when combined with the egregious attitude of "you are lucky to be our guest" and the DEMONSTRATED lack of concern for the guests' experience, this hotel is way overpriced and not deserving of the rating it seems to enjoy. We consulted numerous travel sites and decided on Southernmost based on the reviews we read. Accordingly, we felt it was absolutely essential to address this hotel group's commitment to lip service, lack of customer appreciation and dismal business attitude in the very same hotel review channels that helped influence our decision. I absolutely would not recommend this hotel group and consider our stay at a Southernmost property in July the ONLY blemish on an otherwise wonderful weekend. Save your money for a property with a management/employee group who actually LIKES its guests and wants to retain their repeat business. DM

Reviews.Title: “The rain was the only damper...”
Reviews.Author: liu374
Reviews.Content: Pun fully intended. While this review is mostly about the hotel, but I'll throw in a miscellaneous section at the end. (p.s. this is a comprehensive/long review...) Intro: My wife and I spent four days/three nights in KW. It was our first trip to Key West. We drove to KW from the Naples-area (only five hours), so we had a car available for use during our visit. Our trip was mostly rained out as we only had one day of sunshine.. Quick tangent: we stopped in Key Largo for lunch. There's a place called Bayside Grille that was delicious. Check-in/out: A very smooth, quick check-in process. I booked our room through Orbitz so everything was paid for upon arrival. Check-out was equally seamless. Strangely enough, the staff at the front desk were arguably more helpful than the concierge... 10/10. Concierge(s): Don't get me wrong - the concierge(s) were helpful and well-armed with information, coupons (make sure to ask for any & all coupons!!!), and maps, but my wife and I were thrown off by the concierge's attempt to get us to rent bikes and sign up for other activities fully knowing that the weather forecast for the next two days included rain & T-storms... Again, it's worth a 10-15 minute stop to pick up a handful of coupons for exhibits and bars. 7.5/10. The Room: We booked a room with a king-sized bed. We got a room with a king-sized bed. The layout was somewhat strange with the over-sized bathroom door. I'm not sure what the double-bed room looks like, but I would only recommend this room for two... Nice high ceilings and plenty of storage for clothing, shoes, etc. The safe is in one floor-to-ceiling closet and the microwave & fridge were in the other closet. The bed was pretty comfortable. The TV was an older model tube-TV... sufficient as we weren't expecting an HD flat-screen... The only notable con in the room was the lack of water pressure in the shower. Made it tough to feel clean with combined with the soft Florida water... 8.5/10. Location/Amenities: Awesome. Since the hotel is located on the opposite end of Mallory Street and the loud/late and well-trafficked night-life, you get a nice quiet hotel to sleep at. Additionally, you get access to one of the few beaches in KW. Unfortunately, we didn't get to enjoy it because of the rain. The hotel also offers three separate pools: one at the Southernmost Hotel (smallest w/Tiki Bar), one at the Southernmost on the Beach (largest, most lively, nice breeze off the ocean), and one isolated in the middle between parking lots/off the street (mid-sized, quiet).. The pool and pool bars were enjoyable and there was plenty of seating for us... I assume seating gets tight and really busy during non-summer months. The walk down to Mallory Square took about 25 minutes which felt longer in the rain. 9.5/10. Parking: There's limited parking, but there were sufficient parking spots available during our stay in early/mid-August. The half-witted individual who parked their truck and boat across 8-10 spots didn't do anyone any favors... Also, if you have a car and it's raining, DRIVE it. Parking on in KW is tight, but there are spots available especially near/around restaurants. 10/10. Other: > Hotel Spa: we got massages due to the rain. $50 each, but worth it while on vacation. > Attend Beer or Wine School. Free booze. Drink it. > They have complementary wireless internet. Use it. Your alternative is paying to use the business terminal at the Tiki Bar. > We had the most fun at Irish Kevin's.... Sloppy Joe's entertainment was hit or miss.... Fat Tuesday was good for a few hurricanes... and if you're adventurous (and over 21), check out the rooftop of The Bull.... > Happy hour at the Southernmost Beach Cafe' & Alonzo's (1/2 price drinks and food). > Mallory Square: decent entertainment... The lack of the sunsets were the most disappointing. > We didn't have a bad meal anywhere... so we highly recommended: Camille's (french toast in Godiva white chocolate), Louie's Backyard (fish sandwich), Blue Heaven (anything with lobster), Rooftop Cafe (gnocchi & triple surf & turf pasta), Cafe Marquesa (mahi mahi), and the A&B Lobster Company (suft & turf). > Butterfly Conservatory: located next to the Hotel. It was a nice break from the rain... And one entry fee allows you back in for the rest of the day. > Hemingway House, Lighthouse: unless it's raining, the cover charge isn't really worth the stop in. We had few alternatives so we donated to the historic sites... Sorry if that was way too long... We really enjoyed our trip and would've wished for better weather but made the most of it even though we didn't get to see any sunsets....

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Location, great resort”
Reviews.Author: chs_wales
Reviews.Content: great stay, 2 double beds in room, nice and big, lovely big bathroom. pool areas were great, although one of them was only avaliable for a private party, but it had a band and good music. we had use of the beach and pool at southernmost on the beach, 30 seconds across the road. 25-30min walk from top of Duval st where the main bars or a $7ish taxi journey each way. didnt try the food at the resort, although had lunch at banana cafe 2 mins walk from the hotel which was really gd and very busy. conceige gave us a great jet skiing deal around the island and let us use the hotel pool shower facilities afterwards even though we had chekced out. go to sloopy joes and ricks and irish kevins for good nightlife. 2 mins from southernmost point marker and definatly do some jet skiing!!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: georgiOrlando_Fl
Reviews.Content: property is huge, resembles a 3 story student apartment complex, only few of the rooms are near the beach, half of the property is across the street, city view means parking lot view, the standard rooms do a good job of making you stay out most of the time, there is no microwave, the frig is a joke, no a/c in the bathroom unless you keep the door open, for $200 a night you can do much better, try one of the inns

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dheidelberg
Reviews.Content: Southernmost has the ideal location for travelers. There is so much to do and it is all within walking distance from the hotel. The beach is beautful and well kept the swimming pool is one of the best we've seen. Duval street is right around the corner if your looking for nightlife but doesnt affect you if you want to walk down the beach or side streets. Overall just a GREAT place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “This is Key West”
Reviews.Author: Maximoolian
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to complain about anything concerning the Southernmost Hotel because they did so many things right. If it wasn't for a few minor---very minor---glitches, our stay would have earned the every-so-rare perfect rating. Here's what they did RIGHT: - Location. Southernmost is on the "quiet" side of Duval Street, just one block away from the actual Southern Most Point marker. Besides its own cafe/restaurant and bars, many more are easily within walking distance. There are also several rental facilities close by. Private beach and a diving pier, combined with spectacular ocean views on their adjoining Southernmost on the Beach hotel, made the ocean experience convenient. - Helpful desk. Check in was fast and the facilities were well explained. - Nice pools. We visited all three on both properties. Two had bars and towel service, while the other was simply laid back and rarely had more than one or two groups using it. - Friendly mini beach. We were greeted by an upbeat and knowledgeable young man that was fulfilling his dream lifestyle, helping others enjoy the sand and stay cool. - Comfy beds with plenty of pillows and blankets. We slept way too long every night. - AC that works, but... (see below). - Nice shower room. Instead of a traditional bathtub, the room's design was updated with a roomy shower. ...but see below. - Plenty of activities. Swim, Spa, Scoot, Dive, Drink, whatever...we didn't have time to do everything. - First Aid readiness. One of our party had a small scrape, but the hotel was completely prepared and had them bandaged up in a minute. This was just another notch in their unwritten, unstated, "no worries, no hassles" policy. - Coupon for breakfast. Ran across a neat little freebie after a google. Complimentary Breakfast for Two...which paid for half of us one morning. Nice! - Breakfast at the beach cafe. Generous portions, huge pancakes, friendly staff. - Great 3-night discount. We landed a deal through AAA for 15% off their lowest rate. This made SMH a rather fair value. - Key West styling...what we expected, and it was *almost* perfectly executed. - Fast WiFi. - Spa...ahhh And, what they got WRONG: - Concierge didn't like it if you didn't buy what they were selling. The short story is: we wanted to know if they had a good rapport with the scooter rental place across the street, because they had the best deal in town. No---SMH did not. Instead, the concierge insisted on convincing me to use a company on the other side of the island at a considerably higher expense. After I declined and switched gears to restaurant recommendations, the person apparently became frustrated (I suppose they are on commission) and gave me names different from the suggestion I overheard from the person they advised just before me. That suggestion, Caroline's, ended up being the best meal we had on our entire stay. Perhaps SMH should review how a concierge is supposed to function instead of a 3rd party sales agent. "What's best for the guest" - Temporary pharoh ants. The bathroom had a few of these teensy critters running around in the middle of the floor. One stomp of the foot and we didn't see another bug for the rest of the stay. This didn't concern me so much, since we are also used to dealing with the same ants in our neck of the woods. They are next to impossible. - Beach needed smelly piles of seaweed removed...and they did this the morning we checked out. C'est la vie! - Expensive bar. Strawberry daq in a plastic cup $8, after tip $9. We found out about Key West's plastic cup policy at the end of our stay. I suppose if using plastic cups is the most environmentally sound way to reduce water and detergent use, so be it...but $8 for a machined slushie? Humbug! Gimme a tall glass with a a stick full of fruit, an umbrella, and a back-scratcher. - Ice is not everywhere..just one location on our property. Ye olde ice adventure is one trek that should never be taken, but if so, please point the way! - Shower leaked on floor next to toilet...found out the hard way ;) - Thin walls. We could hear conversations outside our door, loud spring-loaded cabinetry banging, and crowing roosters outside at 5am. - TVs. Our room was equipped with a wide-aspect TUBE screen that wasn't HD, nor had an HD signal. Worse, the aspect was set to stretch-o-vision to make the picture fit. Those of you that know about this stuff will agree that it's an infuriating no-no...on many levels. - Furniture.. The entertainment / closet center, while nice in style, took up too much room and had spring-loaded doors that were hard to close without slamming---something the folks on the other side of that wall were also having trouble learning. The dining/work table could also have been larger. - Limited parking. We luckily found a spot, but kept our car there for three nights out of fear. When nighttime came, if you didn't have a spot, your were out on the street. I wouldn't consider that too big of a deal until we saw some young girl lose control of her scooter and slam it into a brand new pickup truck. (she was okay, but the scooter wasn't) - AC had creaky moving airflow vent...but it sounded like an old wooden ship on the high seas, which put me right to sleep. Sure, there was much to nitpick, but Southernmost got most of the basics right and excelled at creating a relaxing stay for my family. Isn't that the bottom line? Only one person, out of the dozen or so I came in contact with, ran the opposite direction of what I would consider an excellent corporate culture and schema and, with some minor repairs and tweaks (which management is now fully aware), Southernmost will achieve perfection...at least in my book. ---Highly recommended and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend! Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BedfordBoys
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on quiet end of Duval but super short walk to practically everything! Concierge, Allen, did a great job suggesting what to do and when; he booked some tours for us with our needs in mind that were unbelievably spot on! (Also - - Try the New York Pasta Garden right up the street and ask to be seated with Gina - she is a rockstar with her service and friendly smile that started our week trip on a high note! Also - Ralph, right up the street from the hotel at Keys Piano Bar - made some great suggestions for tourists not looking to do touristy things.) Everyone I met at the hotel, including the housekeepers, were so friendly and smiling all the time asking how we were and if there was anything we needed. Hint - don't forget about the pool "in the parking lot." Everyone else seemed to migrate towards the pool by the Tiki Bar, but for some quieter relaxing time, the parkinglot pool as I called it was sublime.

Reviews.Title: “only one flaw in our wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: paran5
Reviews.Content: Our stay was too short, the room was very nice, beds were very clean and comfy,location was wonderful! My disappointment came when we left and return to Fort Myers. I realized we had left a pair of shoes in the room. I immediately called the hotel, the person at the front desk was very helpful, but my repeated calls to housekeeping were never returned! I hope the person that cleaned our room is enjoying his new shoes! I recommend this hotel, just don't leave anything behind!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location away from craziness”
Reviews.Author: cjurban25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the southernmost for our 5 year anniversary for 3 nights. We had room 330 which is one of their suites. It was nice having the suite with private entrance away from kids running up and down the hallway. It says it over looks the pool, but the palm trees are sort of in the way. Room was just like the website says. Bath products were nice. Housekeeping did a good job. Loved having the balcony. Service at the tiki bar was excellent. The pool was never too crowded. The other one at the southern most on the beach was very crowded. Didn't get to enjoy the beach cafe, because it was the world cup finals so it was disgustingly crowded. Other than that, be prepared to walk a good 20 minutes to get to mallory square. Or get an electric car or bike. Overall we had a great experience. Nothing really to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Pistol30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Southern Most Hotel in Key West, Florida with our nieces and nephews and a couple of their boyfriends (9 in all) This was a graduation gift for them and to introduce them to "our" paradise! We normally stay at the Pier House at the other end of Duval St but decided that we would try the Southern Most Hotel and we are certainly glad we did. With 9 people and 6 of them 18 or under, this hotel was just perfect. The 3 pools, the private beach, the 2 tiki bars, the cafe on the beach were all just fantastic. Ther rooms were clean, comfortable and held our parties of 5 and 4 respectivly. There complex was execptional from the staff to the complete resort. There was always something to do or just sit and relax peacefully. It was very reasonable as well as a great location at the quite end of Duval St. Yes we could have stayed cheaper in the newer area of Key West, but with 9 people we were always able to walk to our dinners or destination of choice. The hotel from one end of Duval to the other end where Mallory Square is located is 1 mile. This made the many shopping trips up and down Duval and the Duval crawl quite managable. We will certainly stay there again soon. Conrad D.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rubbertoe
Reviews.Content: Key West can be pricey, but we found a reasonable rate at this hotel plus free parking. They have two other properties across the street, so even if you don't stay at their sister property on the beach you can still walk across the street and use the amenities. There are several nice pools. It's in walking distance from Duval and other sites. The rooms were very clean with a cheerful coastal decor. Their staff is helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: nkilloren733
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel for our honeymoon! It's a beautiful place to stay, exceptionally clean, and the staff was outstanding. The only minor issues that we ran into were that the toilet ran non-stop and the phone in our room had a poor connection. Neither one hindered our stay what so ever, and could be considered as nit picking. Johnny B and Tim at the tiki bar were very personable and FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rweb41477
Reviews.Content: Second trip to southernmost and was thouroughly satisfied. Stayed in a poolview room. Room is nicely appointed and clean, staff is friendly and helpful. Great location. Check out the grounds at the southermost on the beach...wish I spent more time over there, very nice addition. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be at the quiet end of Duval and want a good value with an upscale/local feel.

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful! The beds were so comfy...”
Reviews.Author: MBNatlini
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful! The beds were so comfy. Very clean

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: rkiehl
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed there for our honeymoon and it was totally worth the money. Great service, beautiful room, and a pleasant staff. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: GOODHANDBAG
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, we got a pool view room which was lovely. The hotel staff were so helpful and the room was lovely and modern. The hotel is on Douval Street but on the quiet end (opposite end to Mallory Square). The walk to Mallory Square was about 20-25 minutes stroll. I have to say Key West is not my cup of tea, its too party and too full of very young people having a wonderful time (and why not), however I prefer something a little quieter. Key West has some wonderful historic properties but because of all the partying its difficult to admire. The hotel however I can fully recommend, excellent rooms, excellent pools (choice of 3) and in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable memories...unforgettable times....its the SMOB, truly unforgettable!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaGinBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SMOB in building C, 2nd floor, in room 335. The views were stunning! The bed was soooo luxurious. I want one for home!! The room was spacious and the bathroom was huge. The shower was awesome! I love, love, love this hotel! It was quite as well for when we just wanted to relax. I also love the fact that the SMOB is a "green" facility. The toilets flush with a light option that conserves water. They also have a heavy flush if needed. The room was cleaned every morning with fresh linins on the bed and in the bathroom (if desired, if not they would conserve the towels keeping it "green"). The place was spotless when the cleaning service was finished. The balcony lent its self to the stunning views....we really did love this room. We stayed for 1 week with 47 other guests for my wedding. The staff was so friendly and went out of the way to ensure each and everyone of us was having a good time and they regularly checked to see if we needed anything at all! We had a great time during our stay (to say the least). The Song Writers festival was playing on the Thursday we arrived. They were set-up on the beach and played for hours. It was great. The pool bar was so relaxing and the bartenders were friendly and willing to make us whatever we wanted. My husband loved the bloody marry's. He order one every morning. It was like a meal in a cup (as he said). The food was wonderful. They brought us our order pool side, we didn't even need to leave our lounge chairs! The festival continued on Friday at the Southernmost pool, it was fun for all. If you didn't want to partake you could go to one of the other pools on the property to 'get away'. We wanted to be right in the mix and soak it all up, and so we did! Also at the pool was the activities director (we called the "fun guy") he was always inviting us to partake in games, corn hole, the newlywed game, and so on. My family and friends loved it! Saturday was the wedding. What can I say but breathtaking! Melissa the catering manager was amazing!! I can not say enough wonderful things about her. She was spot-on with every detail of my wedding and all the planning that went into it. She made it the most special day of our lives! Nothing at all went wrong (as you hear about other horror stories). I am from Buffalo New York and worked with Melissa via e-mail and many phone calls surrounding every detail. She made it so easy and was extremely accommodating with my every request. The entire event was picture perfect! The food was out of this world. We were able to customize the menu to our liking and our guests were blown away with how delicious everything was! Thank you Melissa from the bottem of our harts! The remainder of the say was all about relaxing! The hotel is located at the end of Duval street so it was walking distance to everything! The nightlife was just steps away and yet far enough away to be quite and relaxing if you wanted. We took full advantage of the fishing, boat tours, jet skiing, and snorkeling that were just steps away. We spent the days cocktailing, enjoying the fabulous views, sunning on the pier, and enjoying the perfect sand on the beach. I highly recommend this hotel to a wide verity of guests. In my party we had people who were single 25-35 who found many activities to partake in, couples who are 25-35, couples with small children 25-40, couples 40-65, and even my grandparents had a wonderful stay. To this day we still can't stop talking about the wonderful time we all had at the SMOB! Can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4th stay at the Southernmost. Once again we had a wonderful holiday. The hotel is at the "quiet" end of Duval Street but within easy walking distance of restaurants etc. There is plenty of free parking, three pools to chose from (one being over the road at the Southernmost on the Beach), two bars and free coffee in the mornings. The food at the Southernmost Beach Cafe is very good and we ate breakfast there most days as well as quite a few evening meals. The hotel was pretty quiet while we were there and we had a lovely, relaxing two weeks. We would return in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel served its purpose-Key West not our thing”
Reviews.Author: jetcity_woman167
Reviews.Content: We were invited to a friends wedding on May 8th. We have always wanted to visit Key West so this was a very good reason for us to go. We booked through our AMEX card and used our membership rewards points to pay for part of this trip. It was a package deal and we only had this hotel and a more expensive one to choose from. I researched it on this site and liked what I read. It was close to the Southermost point and on Duval St. All of the wedding activities were at the other end of town and I didn't mind walking at eating and shopping at different places for the first few days, I brought several pairs of sandals and sneakers and was careful to rotate as not to get blisters. The humidity and sun was a shock to our system. The temperature at home didn't prepare us for what was in store I bet it was close to 90 degrees with at least 65% humidity each day. We tried to stay out of the sun and stay cool- laying under the shade of coconut trees whenever possible - the air conditioner ran 24/7 in our room and the noise from that, blocked most of the traffic outside since our room faced the parking lot on United Street room 163. Pro- We liked the King bed, Con-pillows were way too fat and fluffy. Pro- We had a mini fridge and a seperate area were the air conditioner was were I could do my hair and put make up on Con-no exhaust fan in bathroom Con- beach was small and once in the water I had trouble keeping my footing - rocky I didn't bring water shoes. Pro- Beach chairs included for guests Con- $10.00 for umbrellas. Restuarant was pricey but dinner was good. The resort is not as nice as pictured on website and brochures - signs of wear and tear all over the place. Most of the help didn't speak english and didn't greet us. So if your going for the beach you'll slightly be disapointed, If you don't drive a car- be pre-pared for alot of walking several times a day in the sweltering heat. Pedicabs are 1.50 per minute so a ride to Mallory Square will cost 18.00 easy. We rented a bike to to go to Fort Zach that was 10.00 for 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience I Have Ever Had at a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pinksnickers08
Reviews.Content: First, I must say that the hotel staff went above and beyond when me, my new husband and our families stayed here. They were VERY accommodating, friendly AND super helpful. A day before my wedding on May 8th, we stayed in the Junior suite. The concierge helped my mother track down a guest book the day of our wedding. They walked up the 2 flights of stairs to deliver my flowers. We had our dinner "reception" at the Southernmost cafe- YOU HAVE TO EAT HERE. All my guests said this place was great, friendly staff, good food, and a GREAT view! They even held my cake for 1 extra day since we didn't have time to cut it right away! As for the pools. The one at the Southernmost Hotel with the tiki bar is awesome! And a special thanks to JOHNNY the bar tender- He went above and beyond. He gave all my girls (there were 5 of us) roses and a small bottle of champagne on Mother's day! Thank you Johnny! After the wedding we transferred into a smaller room. We decided we wanted a pool view for our "honeymoon." The front staff helped us change the room with no problems. AND later that day since we mentioned we were on our honeymoon- they left us with a card reading "happy honeymoon" and a box of chocolates! IF YOU ARE PLANNING TO STAY HERE WITH A BIG GROUP OR AT ALL DO IT!!! They were AMAZING here! I will stay here again when I come back to the Keys! Thank you everyone at the Southernmost!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in beautiful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: tunsttravel
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost hotel is at the quiet end of Duval Street, which is a bonus if you want to relax, but is near enough to walk to the main attractions and nightlife. If you wish to have a beach view then stay at the Southernmost on the Beach, but if this is not important to you then don't pay a premium as the Southernmost is perfect as you share all the facilities of the Beach hotel literally next door. There are 3 swimming pools, a beach, restaurant and beauty salon. Rooms are large and well decorated, air conditioning worked well, which was needed as it was very hot! There is ample free parking which is rare on Key West so if you are hiring a car take this into consideration. I can not think of any downside to our stay at this hotel, it was lovely and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen003
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southermost Hotel in April for 4 nights. Room was clean, bed was comfy, but the best part- location, locaton, location. We loved that we were able to use the pool at our hotel, the pool at the beach hotel- AND the beach. Parking was free, and lounge chairs were free at the beach. Staff at the whole complex were nice and helpful. Def try the bloody mary at the southern most beach pool. YUM! Loved that the hotel was so close to Duval St but not directly on the strip. Went on the Fury Commotion on the Ocean Sunset Cruise- what a great time! Sunset was beyond beautiful and this cruise was definitely worth the $$- $49 for two hours, margaritas, beer, wine, snacks, band and beauty...Cant beat it! Will definitely be back to Key West and will definitely stay at the Southermost Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The pool bar is awsome!”
Reviews.Author: Scottwdennis
Reviews.Content: The whole crew us amazing. They will make you anything. They go out of there way to service you Rich even gave me a pair of binoculars to fund my friend in the water. Melissa went out of her way to take our picture and Heather is just so sweet and will bring you a drink anywhere on the property literally anywhere! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: Jazbadicus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend four lovely days at the Southernmost, which is a very good mix of value, location, and beach access. Room was clean and spacious. Even though it was on the second level, staff was eager to assist us with baggage. The room was quiet and clean, with a nice bathroom, fridge and microwave. Didn't spend much time in the room, though, as the whole Southernmost complex was available to us. The cafe is excellent, with pretty good food at a fair price (actually cheaper than much of Key West. Got two beach chairs and a table and sunned ourselves every day--at no extra cost. Walking/stumbling down and up Duval made this a better choice than the far pricier Casa Marina (far from the fun) or the as-expensive La Concha (on lower Duval, but noisy and not very well-kept). They even let us stash our luggage for a few hours so we could go to the beach after we checked out and let us use their showers and facilities to get cleaned up before our late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernHub
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost hotel for 2 nights in March 2010. We were vacationing mainly to get some sun and had our children ages 9 and 11 with. The hotel is within walking distance from lots of shops and restaurants. Mallory Square is where everyone gathers for the sunset, this is about a mile from the hotel and we walked to it. We are not high class people, we typically stay at Country Inns and Suites hotels for $99/night. This hotel was about $260 per night and I feel that it was expensive for our tastes, but was a higher end resort than what we were used to so it was worth the money. We hung around the pool the 2 days were were there, there is more than one pool at the resort. The pool area is surrounded by a wall that gives wind break when you are seated on a pool chair. This was a plus for us as it was cloudy and windy one day. The wall protected us onthe chairs so we could still relax in our swimsuits and not be chilled. Tiki Bar was great! We ate at the Southern Most Beach Cafe 3 times, all were great. They do have a children's menu so that was helpful and saved us some money. My husband had the Tropical Jerked Chicken Sandwich there, said it was excellent. I enjoyed the Chicken Quesadilla. We didn't stay at the Southernmost Beach Hotel, but the 2 hotels are owned together, so we could've used the beach for free. We decided to stay poolside to avoid the sand. We will stay here again due to the location on Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for enjoying charming Key West”
Reviews.Author: KCflowergirl
Reviews.Content: We had one of the cheapest rooms and it wasn't exactally fancy, but for what we could afford it was good (everthing is expensive in Key West). The best part is that at Southernmost, no matter what level of room you have, you can enjoy all the amentities of the entire complex. The private pools (there are 3) and sandy pier area with hammocks are the best. The staff, especially MJ the concierge exceeded our expectations. This hotel has the ideal location in Key West because you are right at the end of the main street, Duval, on the Atlantic side, so within walking distance of anything you would need, yet away from the loud party section. I would highly suggest staying within walking distance of downtown. We parked our car when we got there and didn't even think about using it until we left (and parking downtown is practically impossible). Downtown is the prettiest and most charming part too with endless choices in restaurants, shops, etc. I would also hightly recommend a sunset sail on a schooner, sunsets at the Sunset Pier Restaurant and several hours to enjoy the beautiful and quiet beach at Fort Zachary State Park (if you can you should drive to it, otherwise expect a long walk), as well as a walk around the east part of town to enjoy the beautiful houses.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for where it is and what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Breezy_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week in Key West at the Southernmost Hotel. Overall a good experience. Check in was fast and friendly. Room was average, clean but a bit dated. Huge king size bed, nice balcony over the pool. You don't got on this kind of vacation to watch TV, but it was a late model 19" but with a decent selection of channels, but didn't have the usual "local information" or "hotel information" channel for info that would have been nice. Wifi was slow, used my skycard as it was more reliable, but again not there to do work. Room had a nice size safe, cold fridge and big desk. Bathroom was very basic. There was an off odor all week that we think was from the water and humidity. But not so bad that it was a problem for us, but could be for others. Shower was also just ok, the valve handle was old so temperature options were hot or hotter. Grounds were nice. We spent several hours over at South Beach next to the pool, the private space adjacent to Southernmost on the Beach. Heather provided good drink and food service right to our lounge chairs, and Giselle was great with fresh towels and taking away empty cups and just making sure we were comfortable. The beach itself was small and had a good deal of seaweed. It did appear that the staff did try to keep it clean, but if you are looking to swim this is not the best beach. Overall lots of activity there, but a good place to unwind inbetween vacation activities. The hotel staff was great with calling taxis and holding our luggage the last day since our flight was in the evening. We did not eat at the hotel other than snacks at the pool, as you don't need to. There's a nice little Cuban sandwich mini-mart just around the corner, and a fantastic deli just around the corner up Duval. And there are plenty of nice restaurants in the area, so no need to pay hotel rates for meals. Only challenge is that all of the service at every restaurant we went to was a little inconsistent, I guess everyone is simply on island time. The location was a fantastic home base for all of our fishing trips and other adventures. It was also just enough distance from the more noisy activities on the other end of Duval. I would stay at this hotel again and would not hesitate to recommend it to a friend, I would just qualify that this is a 5 star hotel for Key West, but about a 3 comparing it to a major city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: chibg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned on three nights at Southernmost on the Beach at Key West. We showed up and were walking to our perfectly nice room, with ocean view, but decided to check for something not on the first floor with people possibly just outside. The hotel manager found only one possibility for all three nights, across the street at the Southernmost Hotel. She took us to Room 331, one of only three rooms on the third floor of the gingerbread building. Ultra quiet and private, cathedral ceiling, large room and even bigger, stuffed chair with ottoman, free wi-fi, modern bathroom and shower, large flat screen TV, private balcony with lounge chair, and comfortable king bed. Water pressure not the greatest. View over quiet pool (one of three or four available) to ocean about 1 1/2 blocks away. Ample free parking, $10 a day onsite bike rentals with a cool bell and basket. Right on southern, quiet end of Duval, across the street from butterfly atrium, one block from southernmost point, next to a real tasty ice cream place. Use of private beach across the street, and close to public beaches. $3 drinks or appetizers at happy hour. Tiki bar at adjacent pool on the opposite side of building, hosted a ring game where the Roanoke College girls who played got a free round and t shirts, and with jacuzzi, although water in latter low and lukewarm. No free paper or complimentary breakfast, but real value at about $285/night. Not sure I'd want to stay on 2d floor, with people walking on external walk right outside your window. Had a real nice time.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: floridaanniez
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a beautiful weekend in Key West at the Southernmost Hotel. Everything about the experience was first rate, from the attentive staff to the fresh and well equipped rooms. I would strongly recommend the Hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HoneyNc
Reviews.Content: First the good. The staff is amazing. Helpful, friendly, all good. The property is beautiful, great pools and beach, restaurant is okay. The rooms are awful. I chose the least expensive room which was still over $250 a night. It had holes in the blankets, cheap towels and sheets, tiny bathroom, unbelievably loud a/c unit in the room. Unless you are a very deep sleeper you can't sleep with the windows open. Traffic noise and roosters crowing all night. My family chose the more expensive, oceanfront rooms. They were half the size of mine but the same in all other respects. Southernmost looks like it should be a high end hotel but the rooms are worse than any roadside chain motel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the money”
Reviews.Author: LoriW1
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel collection is one of the best deals on Key West. Guests have access to all facilities on the complex even if you are staying in the less expensive properties. Rooms are high quality, restaurant is on the beach with a great view. They rent bicycles for the the cheapest rate on the island, and the hotel is located on Duval Street. Guest can walk to all of the bars and marina. Note; You will be walking about a mile, but it is an entertaining mile and gets shorter and shorter the longer you stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Fair Value for Expensive Key West”
Reviews.Author: GreatLakerMichigan
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on the reviews posted on this website and we were very pleased with our choice. Stayed three nights Feb 16-18. Paid $266/night including taxes for what would have been a moderate $80 to $100/night room anywhere else, but Key West is an expensive destination as we discovered. Clean, comfortable, attentive front desk staff and concierge. No resort fees, three pools, good cafe near beach, free run of affiliated properties nearby with private beach access if desired. Free parking (a big bonus anywhere near the cramped downtown district) and quiet location. Slightly over a pleasant mile long walk to Mallory Square. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “It's just an upgrade motel”
Reviews.Author: Wjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southermost hotel for 3 nights in February 2010. We booked the room with 2 beds and the room is small and dark with no view (paid $260/night). The beds are OK. However, the location of this hotel is very good. It's close to everything (restaurant, shop, ect....). There is a sister hotel right on the small beach , but you have to pay for premium ($300+)/night. Not worth it , because i guess the rooms have the same setup. We ate at the hotel restaurant one day and the food is good at reasonable price. I would stay at somwehere else , if I visit Keywest again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: OshkoshTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Southernmost Feb 4-6. The room was very nicely furnished, had an upscale bath and the bed was very comfortable. It had a balcony, but the view was mostly of a roof of an adjoining building. The property is very nice with several pools, nice landscaping and a nice open air beach restaurant. They have another more expensive hotel on the property, Southernmost on the Beach, which is newer and as the name says, on the beach. We were happy with our room and it was convenient for walking to the sights further down Duval street. One kind of strange thing, they only had one computer available for guests to use and it is at the Tiki Bar and you have to pay to use it. We didn"t have a laptop along so this was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Larrysammy
Reviews.Content: First trip to Key West and the Southernmost Hotel. FANTASTIC would be the perfect way to describe my experience. No surprises here. An excellent 3 star hotel. Well maintained grounds and ultra clean rooms. Great value for money spent. The hotel is at the southern, quiet end of Duval and you will appreciate this location after you take your first trip to Mallory Square and witness the tourist frenzy that exists there and around that general area. Rent a bike. The island is flat and perfect for bike touring. The pool areas at the Southernmost Complex (including Beach Hotel) are comfortable with heated pools, towels, Tiki Bar, etc. etc. Food and happy hour snacks at the Beach Cafe Bar are all great. I was there from 1/25/10 to 2/8/10 and enjoyed every minute of my stay. I will be coming back to Key West, and would not think of staying any where else! The only thing I might do differently is stay longer, and upgrade to a pool side room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Good locale, confy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mortemo
Reviews.Content: As indciated in previous reviews good all around hotel with access to other facilities. Tips - rent a scooter or a bicycle to cruise Duval street and to get to Mallory square for daily sunset festivities. Scooter was $35 for 24 hours at location accross the street from hotel. Excellent way to see all of the Key and visit the other beaches on the Key, Higgs beach is nice. If driving to KW stop at Mad Dawgs BBQ stand on Sugarloaf Key on your way, excellent Texas BBQ.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that balances cost, location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: JasonNH
Reviews.Content: First, if you are looking into this property, you are probably asking yourself if you should stay at the Southernmost Hotel, the Southernmost Hotel "at the Beach", or the La Mer Hotel & Dewey House? Here's how I would break them down: The Southernmost Hotel "at the Beach" has the best views and the nicer rooms, but I don't think that they are worth the extra cost. The Southernmost hotel I think has the best combination of cost, location and amenities. Do upgrade to the pool room with a balcony. That upgrade is worth the cost. The La Mer Hotel & Dewey House are more like Bed and Breakfast type settings and do have some nice views, but again, not really the style of hotel I'm interested in and not worth the cost. Anyone staying on any of the locations can use the pools/chairs/towels anywhere on the property so why not go for the best value on your room? That's what we did and were very happy. This property is in fantastic location. Close to the action, but not too close. Most will be able to skip the car rental and walk most places, rent bikes (or scooters) for medium distances and then take a cab for an occasional long trip or late night jaunt. There are a ton of great places up and down Duvall, but our two favorites were Cork and Stogie about 2 blocks up on Duvall and Point5, a little wine and tapas bar upstairs from 915 Duvall. Have fun and good luck

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Matt_A_35
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and two young childen stayed for three nights in mid-January. We were happy with our choice. The location was great - near everything but just far enough away that there wasn't constant street noise. The rooms were nothing special, but were comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful and attentive. The restauant and bars were good. The price was a lot less than most other places we looked at. If you plan to spend most of your time on the property, or want to be able to look out your window at the sun setting over the ocean, this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for a nice, well-run place that can serve as a base for exploring the town and the area, it is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be going back”
Reviews.Author: MAIL4
Reviews.Content: Last night my husband and I returned from a week in Key West where we stayed at the Southernmost Hotel. From the time we arrived until we departed our experience with this hotel and its staff was wonderful. We did read the reviews on this site before we booked, so we heeded the comment made by a couple of reviewers and made our reservation on the phone rather than online. When speaking with the reservationist we specifically asked for a room with a private balcony that had a pool view. Admittedly we paid for a premium room to get what we wanted, but we paid much less, and got much more, than at the "brand name" chain hotels on the island. The hotel has two lovely pools and guests have access to a third and the beach and pier facilities at the Southernmost at the Beach, which is right across the street. The Southernmost does not have a restaurant but the Southernmost at the Beach has a lovely, beachfront cafe. While this hotel is not located in the "heart of historic Key West", it is within walking distance of the restaurants, bars and other activities of Duvall St. and Mallory Square. It's also a couple of blocks from the "southern most point in the US" marker. Despite the complaint of one reviewer, in our room we heard no noise except the music from the Tiki Bar if the slider was open. We'll be going back there and recommending the Southernmost to anyone we know who is heading to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: espineisland
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the accommodations. The beds were comfortable---the bathroom was large---but above all it was immaculate !!! I highly recommend this hotel for . The staff was also very courteous and attentive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: apags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost the three days leading up to Christmas. It was a perfect place to stay for the two of us! The hotel was clean, friendly, and in a great location for everything we wanted to do. Although it is not quite as big and expensive as the Southernmost on the Beach, we were able to use everything the entire resort had to offer. That included the private beach and our favorite, the cafe. We spent each night doing happy hour at the Cafe from 4-7. You cannot beat the drink and appetizer specials! A perfect way to get ready to go out and about! The hotel was in walking distance of most of the places we wanted to go, however I do recommend getting a cab if you are wanting to get down to Mallory Square. Overall, we loved our stay and wish we could have been there longer. We plan to come back to Key West next year and stay at the Southernmost!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Old_Michael
Reviews.Content: Spent a jolly 3 days in a standard, double queen-bedded room, in the main Southernmost Hotel, located at the quite end of Duvall Street. Room was not enormous but adequate; bathroom very nice and shower excellent. Service was excellent too, with plenty of towels supplied. Wifi service in room worked well, parking near our room worked well, and we had access to three pools in the hotel and its sister (Southernmost on the Beach). More cosy than some 'resorts', perhaps a glorified motel, but with the best possible meaning. Enjoyed drink and meal at the hotel's cafe on the beach. Not cheap, but definitely a very comfortable and pleasant stay; good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular service, spectacular location, fun in the sun!”
Reviews.Author: owenmeany15
Reviews.Content: We had a grand time in Key West, and much of it was the result of this hotel...the concierges were so helpful, and made such good recommendations and we benefitted from their expertise! We loved the pools, the hot tubs, the patio...just wished the room was a bit brighter and the air conditioner a bit less noisy...but we will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdnerds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost for three nights in December and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel was clean, as was the pool area. The tiki bar made excellent drinks and the bartenders were extremely helpful with local recommendations. The concierge was very helpful in booking a moped rental for us, which was hassle free. Had breakfast twice at the Southernmost on the beach, which was lovely and only a short walk across the street. The location is perfect, as the area is quiet but not too far from the action. I have to recommend Cork and Stogie's on Duval St. (about 2 blocks from the hotel) for excellent wine. It's a great little place to taste and buy wine as well as cigars and many other wonderful things. The staff there wre so nice and helpful. Best meals in Key West were lunch at Blue Heaven and dinner at El Siboney. Both places were phenomenal. All in all it was a wonderful trip and I would highly recommend the Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: NightLion
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a "deluxe" room because our regular room was unavailable. The room was very nice, clean and well decorated. Fridge, microwave and safe all included, and the TV gets lots of channels. Elevator had a pretty bad odor and appeared to have an expired inspection certificate. Had a bad experience on checkout day that kind of left a bad taste im my mouth. Our last night there was the last night of a 12-night vacation and we stayed out pretty late (by our standards, at least). But our phone woke us up around 9 AM. I groggily answered and was told I needed to move my rental car IMMEDIATELY out of the lot where it was parked because the lot was going to be re-paved (they'd never left a note either on the car or in the room). Half-asleep, I went out to move the car, but the other lot for the hotel was full, so I had to park at the sister property Southernmost on the Beach, a pretty decent walk away, especially when we'd be checking out with a lot of luggage. I went back to the room, tried to get a little bit more rest, then we packed to get out by 11 AM checkout time. When we left the room, I saw that the parking lot that had to be immediately evacuated was still nearly half full, so the paving wouldn't be taking place for a while. This kind of ticked me off, so I went to retrieve the rental car and drove it back into the closed parking lot where we could at least load our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: vstarlady
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. Check in was quick and easy. The common areas and grounds were clean and pristine. All employees were courteous and helpful. Our room was clean, updated and very comfortable for two people. We wished that there had been sheer curtains on the windows enabling us to allow more light in while maintaining our privacy. Even so, we felt very comfortable and relaxed and enjoyed our stay. We will definitely recommend and hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Quieter end of town”
Reviews.Author: Loubea
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we asked to see the rooms available and all rooms where nicely furnished but the first room was very small and dark but would be ok if you wanted to keep the budget down and not spend much time in your room. We had a larger room and it was very nice with a balcony and bright and colourful. The staff was very friendly and the concierge helped us with restaurants which where very good. The pool was not heated but you could use the facilites at this hotel and the one on the beach which also had loungers on the beach to use but you would have to pay extra for an umbrella. We really liked this side of Key West as everywhere was in walking distance and there was a lovely deli up the road and it was free parking and nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: KSGIANTS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost Hotel during Fantasy Fest week. It was a great stay and our 1st stay at Southernmost Hotel. We usually stay at Southernmost On The Beach, but couldn't because we could not get reservations for our enitre stay. But we could with Southernmost Hotel. We were very happy with our decision to try Southernmost Hotel, the accomodations were outstanding as well as the staff. Everyone was pleasant and very nice. We couldn't be happier, we would definately stay here again. For the price it was well worth it. Plus you still have use of the Southernmost On The Beach facilities as well. Our bartenders were outstanding and always were on point when we asked for anything. Special kudos go out to Kevin, Rich and Heather were the best!!! As always we will definatley return next year. I highly recommend anyone stay without worry.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: NorthShore1923
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights. We had a king size room with a balcony overlooking the pool. The room was clean and large enough to meet our needs. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom seemed to be recently remodeled. The staff, especially Cindy, was very friendly and accommodating. The concierge in the lobby was helpful in booking a reef cruise and a reservation at Michaels Restaurant. We used the pool at the Southernmost and the beach at Southernmost on the Beach. The pool at the Southernmost is a very clean area with towels available in the office area, lounge chairs, Fish Chairs (Like Adirondack Chairs) and umbrellas available gratis and a Tiki Bar. We also took a very short walk from our room across to street to the beach.. Lounge chairs are a courtesy and umbrellas are $10. The beach attendant brought iced towels, freeze pops and frozen fruit gratis, a nice touch. The Beach Cafe is convenient for drinks, snacks, etc. Our flight out was late in the afternoon and we were given an extended checkout time. We had two incidences where housekeeping did not leave facecloths and they were promptly delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tigertabby
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. A light bulb was burnt out when we first got to our room. I called the service desk and it was replaced right away. The room was spacious and comfortable. We loved the balcony over the pool. It is so close to the beach that you can walk to it in less than five minutes. We really liked having a safe in the room. The thing I liked least was the long walk to Mallory Square. This hotel is worth the walk, though. We are planning to stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Way to start the New Year !”
Reviews.Author: plymouthmass
Reviews.Content: Perfect location away from the noise of Duval. A great combo of off beach on beach sites , with a beach and resturant included. Perfect for what I needed. Had such a great time booked forthis New Years also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West location”
Reviews.Author: SuzyUK
Reviews.Content: Free parking is at a premium in Key West hence why I looked at this hotel! It was a ten+ minute walk to the busier end of Duval Street from the hotel but at least I didn't have to contend with the expensive parking in the city. My last memories of Key West were pouring fistfuls of dollars into parking meters! I felt safe wlaking back to the hotel alone in the evening. The hotel was very comfortable. My room overlooked the car park however I only stayed one night so that wasn't important. I swam in the pool after returning from watching the sunset at Mallory Square which was fabulous as it was soooo humid. The pools (4 are on the complex) are open until late in the evening. It was a lovely place to stay - if slightly expensive (but a lot of things ae in Key West).

Reviews.Title: “Love The Southernmost Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twochinas
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed here for many years and are always delighted. The Southernmost is located on the quiet end of Duval St., across the street from the beach and a pleasant walk to all of the action at Mallory Square. The rates are great, the parking is free, the grounds are beautiful, and there is access to three pools. The staff is helpful and very friendly. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: svharter
Reviews.Content: Clean & well kept. The pools & bars were great. It's a bit of a walk to the north end of Duval street, but it would stop us from staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, no problemz mon”
Reviews.Author: TBoFLA
Reviews.Content: This place is obviously run by people who think good service and great value equal return customers. I would definitely return, again and again. Stayed there with my wife and three friends. The stay was awesome. The staff was friendly, accommodating, and professional. The location gives access to the quiet end of Duval Street, but everything is a short walk or cheap cab ride away. The hotel, along with access to all of the Southernmost properties meant that we had a great home away from home. the tiki bar at the hotel has a great bartender named Tim. The bellman, Omar was impeccable, Food at the beach cafe was very good, the happy hour there is a don't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, 2nd time stay.”
Reviews.Author: lewjam
Reviews.Content: This was our second time here at the Southernmost Hotel, and it won't be our last, spent our honeymoon here 10 years ago and want to return with our 2 boys. Not a great deal for the kids to do there, but they were happy with the pools. There are 3 pool all are not that big, but most of the time we had the pool to our selves so that was nice. You could take a late night swim which we did often as it was so hot in Key west in July. The rooms are a nice size with 2 large double beds in and a large bathroom with spaceous shower. Right by the beach too.

Reviews.Title: “We thought the Southernmost was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLakewoodOhio
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for our daughter's wedding, so we had several family members staying at the Southernmost. We thought our room was great--wonderful bathroom & really nice tv. Loved the morning coffee by the pool & happy hour at the beach was a real deal! However, we did not like eating at the poolside cafe due to the pigeons wandering around--but that is the only negative thing I have to say. All the pools were great & really loved the "noodles" that they had for floating in the pool. Everything was clean & nice. We thought the location was great--we walked everywhere. We would definitely recommend the Southernmost & would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Southernmost is a great place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: shadowman123
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West with no reservations and looked at several properties before returning to where we started at The Southernmost Hotel. With a room rate of only $149 (off season) it was priced very economically compared to the other places we looked at. We loved the resort feel of the Southernmost as we were traveling with two children ages 7 and 10. Luis at the front desk was very friendly and helpful to us at check in and was able to provide a room hours ahead of the stated check in time. The room was spotless and modern with a nice private deck that led to the pool which we made use of and enjoyed. The hotel is located at the end of Duval ST. which was nice because we could walk to all the shopping and eating but stay far enough away at the end of the night for some quiet time. The hotel is located only 2 blocks away from the Southernmost point buoy that everyone takes a picture in front of marking the closest land point to Cuba. At checkout we were provided a key at checkout so that we could use the bathroom and shower facilities before hitting the road for our drive back home. If you stay here you can get twels and a chair at the beach at the end of the block, coffee station is outside of the lobby and pool, nice touch in the morning, and the concierge was very helpful as well. We are already planning our next trip to Key West and will stay at the Southernmost again.

Reviews.Title: “B.E.A.Utiful”
Reviews.Author: SHoweBathUK
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have to say that it was quite expensive but the location was brilliant, the hotel is awesome with great rooms and facilities. I would absolutely do this again. We loved the atmosphere here. The hotel is very well kept and is either super clean or they have recently done it up. Either way the facilities were great with awesome bar staff that came on duty with their own music so it wasn't your boring cyclic music that you hear all day everyday. The cocktails were lovely and the pool was great even when it was raining. The town is very unique and is very much worth a visit. Even when the cruise ships come in you don't get over run by the hoards.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: lmw10
Reviews.Content: Location I'd say it was in a good location if you want to be close to the beach although it's not the best of beaches. It's a good 25 minute walk from the hotel upto Mallory Square, but it gives you the chance to walk past all the main restaurants and bars, so we didn't mind that. Ate at the Little mexican (definitely recommend) and Hard Rock Cafe. We did the Jet Ski tour around Key West which I would definitely recommend. Also did the Rum and Reggae Sunset snorkel which was very good too, apart from the free alcohol was pretty aweful. The room we got was tiny and definitely needed refurbishing. I would probably recommend trying to find a B&B that is a little bit more in the middle of things if you don't want to walk so much. But if you're not fussed about the walking, I'd recommend this place because it's still a good location and right on Duval street so it's just a straight walk all the way up to Mallory Square passing the restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality hotel, quiet location, fantastic employees”
Reviews.Author: AutumnandRJ
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very helpful during our stay. The bar/restaurant at the adjoining hotel on the beach has a great happy hour special with fantastic calamari. Most of the action is at the other end of the Duval so its very quiet, but you will need to rent a bike or take a taxi if you aren't a hiker. Talk to the concierge about places to go, they are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnsn
Reviews.Content: We travelto Key West at least once a year and always stay at Southernmost Hotel. The rates are great-you can use all the accomodations here-two pools plus the beach as well as the southernmost on the beach pool! Staff is always friendly and helpful. It seems it's never really busy too-apparently due to the many options. Now they have the cafe-while you sit and drink or eat or both you can look out at the water and the sand! So relaxing! Parking is free and it's close enough to the nightlife you can walk or take a taxi but it's quiet when you need to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, end of Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: GypsygirlPenfield
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice and would go again. Nice rooms and a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: ok_traaveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. Friendly staff with clean updated rooms. Rooms were a bit on the small size but adequate. Water pressure in shower was good. Will stay at the Southernmost Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: JRD33141
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned yesterday from a 4 day stay at the Southernmost Hotel in Key West. This is our 3rd stay the the Hotel and as always - it was awesome. As a matter of fact - this visit was even better since they've taken over the restaurant on the beach. We booked a pool view king and it was great. The room is spacious, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom very clean. I'm jealous of the tile work in the shower area! Our room was cleaned each day. The pool area was busy but not noisy. The check-in was painless and last about 5 minutes. We drove down from Miami Beach along with some relatives. The relatives stayed at the Southermost on the Beach in an ocean front unit. For those famliar with Key West, Southernmost OTB is on the site of the old Atlantic Shores. Their unit (638) was awesome - huge bathroom, large flatscreen TV, and huge balcony. Parking for these units is under the building and great. I can't say enough great comments about the Southernmost OTB restaurant and bar. The breakfast was always quick and just as ordered. We had Corey for 3 out of the 4 mornings and he was great. At the bar, you'll love Cindy and Sara. They are just awesome, quick service, great sense of humor, and will give you good suggestions (no BULL) for other restaurants and bars on the island. We spent happy hour with them every day (1600-1900) and between the specials, the $3 rum runners, and the $3 appetizers, we always had a blast. We would highly reccomend the Southernost Hotel, the Southernmost OTB, and the restaurant/bar. They just keeping doing it better! L&J Miami Beach

Reviews.Title: “A warm, relaxing, fun, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mld2
Reviews.Content: Southernmost Hotel collection allows guests to share properties. We stayed at Southernmost Hotel but were able to use the rest of the hotel's property. This gave us access to the beach (which is public, but was never crowded but always clean- as long as you don't mind the natural seaweed), 2 beautiful pools (both different types), 2 bars (2 different crowds), a restaurant, a land oasis of hammocks that looked like croquet could be played on it, a private beach area and a swimming pier that is also a fish sanctuary. We wanted to relax by the sea and not fight crowds. We saw a lot of wonderful marine life (including a manatee!!) and warm, clear waters. The hotel staff was delightful and made the stay that much more memorable (look for Omar, Rich, Heather and Giselle!!). Fort Zachary Taylor State Park is a quick scooter ride away. A wealth of history can be found there, as well as more beautiful beaches. The tourist spots are readily available for those that want to see them, but we enjoyed the local foods (The Cafe- Vegan/ vegetarian food, The Wine Bar, Mr Z's pizza and the local favorite hogfish). I'd recommend this spot for an inexpensive and easy alternative to a Caribbean getaway, whether it be 3 days or 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth every penny;”
Reviews.Author: Brad163
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West we wanted to find something very special for our 6 day stay. Well I'm happy to say we did in the La Mer and Dewey House at Southernmost Hotel. La Mer and Dewey House are two houses on the beach operated as a Bed and Breakfast. We had reserved a room overlooking the beach. When we arrived our room was as expected, right on the ocean and beach with excellent access to the rest of the resort. Though I felt the room a touch small, it was appointed beautifully. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The breakfast was good, fresh and sufficient. I would have liked more variety though my fiance' said it was great. They did have fresh french pastries every morning that were out of this world. Samantha, the house personal concierge would greet us at breakfast almost every morning, happy and smiley, filled with great tidbits of information. Two beautiful family pools (with bar service) and one adults only which we appreciated. The on site restaurant had excellent beach fare and drinks. A nice 15 or 20 minute stroll into town for dinner and music or perhaps a gloriuos sunset. We walked in every day and back with no problems. In all I'd say our stay was everything we expected and more. We relaxed, took tours, relaxed and ate great food, relaxed and drank MOHITO's.
