Try some of the local cuban food and the less touristy music places for some great jazz and latin music. B. Davis Massapequa, NY

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay for our 25th anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: mdwyer
Reviews.Content: I had to write after reading a couple of the previous reviews. We stayed at The Southernmost Hotel the first week in June for our anniversary and splurged and stayed in one of the suites on the 3rd floor. Was absolutely wonderful! Bed was terrific, water pressure great, amenities wonderful. Cindy at the front desk was very friendly and welcoming and helpful. We are one of those couples who don't want to be right in the thick of the craziness so the hotel was perfect for us. It's quite a hike to the other end of Duval but we had bikes all week and got around on them. Although we didn't take advantage of them at all, you have access to 3 pools by staying here, plus there's a Beach Cafe for meals. The meals are average but you can't beat the view right on the beach. The great thing too was plenty of parking to keep our rental car all week.

Reviews.Title: “Not great and we weren't alone in that opinion”
Reviews.Author: Towleway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the advice of many good reviews on Tripadvisor, but I can't say I agree with them. This place was average at best. My wife and I were in a horrible room and our friends' room wasn't much better. The tiny bathroom had no water pressure in the shower (it was almost laughable) and there was a broken circuit in the room so some of the power outlets didn't work. The hotel itself was better, but not by much. Stay away from the concierge. She was a snob, which I could deal with, but the pricing for their activities was by far more expensive than anywhere else on Key West with no benefits for paying more. On our last day, the maid knocked on the door at 9:30AM to make sure we were checking out at 11 and the "do not disturb" sign was clearly on the door. Their pools were nice; I'll say that. Clean and not too obnoxious. The little Tiki bar was nice, but not nearly what I was expecting from other reviews. Location was good; a block from the beach and not too far from the action on Duval. All in all, we'd return to Key West in a heartbeat, but we'd look for another place to stay. We're not picky travelers by any means, but this place was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Dissapointed - Overall Experience Ok”
Reviews.Author: BeachGirlHouston
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, hotel staff very friendly. The location of this hotel is great and being able to use the beach and pool at Southermost on The Beach was the best perk. Pools close at 11:00 pm. and beach closed after sunset. Great snorkeling on the beach if you go out near the piers (saw amberjack, permit, barracuda). Hotel room was nothing spectacular. Our first night there our neighbors in the room next to us decided to throw this wild party which kept us awake most of the night. Finally around 3:30 a.m. I called the front desk to complain and the immediately sent security to quiet these people down - which worked. So our first night we got little sleep. Woke up next morning in desperate need of coffee and there was the coffee maker but no coffee pot or filter holder. Asked maid for missing parts, she never came back. Parking is tight and crowded at times. Bartenders at Beach Cafe were a little rude - you can't order alcoholic drinks at bar and take them to lounge chairs on the beach - you have to sit at the bar and drink them. I saw several people get frustrated over this and just order cokes. Drinks at bar have little alcohol in them - overpriced. A/C in the room worked great but is loud. Bed was lopsided and uncomfortable. Lights in restroom would come on real dim sometimes then bright other times. I saw alot of people having problems with their door key cards. Pools crowded but I like the tiki bars at each. I'd pay extra to stay at Southermost on the Beach for the water view. We saved money staying at Southermost Hotel but I'd rather splurge and get beach views. The hotel staff was nice and printed out my boarding passes without complaint. I have to say they were really customer oriented and accomodating. Has to be a tough job dealing with crazy tourists day after day! Great location and walk to Mallory Square takes no time at all - just don't try to walk it in the heat of the day. We ate at El Maison de Pepe (bland food, hot, flies attacked minute food was served) - go to El Siboney instead. Hard Rock Cafe was great - drinks are really good there - teenagers loved it, eating inside in A/C was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel Key West”
Reviews.Author: VickiIndiana
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, The people were great and FUN!! Wonderful view and awesome location, Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hideaway on the edge of town”
Reviews.Author: theshlee
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here. The Tiki bar is awesome poolside. The location is great, right on the end of Duval, across the street from the beach. Reasonable rates. Will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the end of Duval street, meaning a lovely quiet location. The walk for the sunset at the other end is lovely and leisurely with lots to see on the way and takes about 20 mins (about a mile from one end to the other). Our hotel room was excellent, it was large with a king sized bed, private balcony and very clean. Other facilities include a safe, ironing board, tea/coffee making facilities, microwave and a very large fridge (we were able to store 20 water bottles in the fridge from the supermarket)! Another added bonus was free parking. The pool was lovely, but added bonus is we could choose from 3 pools and the beach - the conference pool was the best for us as it was always quiet, no children and no loud background music noise from the bar. The staff were excellent, able to get extra tea & bathroom materials, along with also using the conceige for renting bikes and booking some fab trips. We also used the hotel restaurant which is on the beach twice - the service, food, value for money and views were for us the best on Key West. Remember to use the voucher given by the reception staff - able to get free drink was was good value. Also got to see a few weddings which was a lovely added bonus! In summary this hotel was excellent and really added to our wonderful stay in Key West

Reviews.Title: “So much better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGurl_79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to the Keys in many years. We stayed 2 nights in Marathon, and 3 nights at the Southernmost Hotel. We should have stayed all 5 here! I was debating whether to spend the extra $$ to get a new room at Southernmost on the Beach, but went with a 2nd floor pool view at Southernmost Hotel. We were very pleased! The room was large, we got a king-sized bed, which had a thick mattress and was very comfy. We had our own private balcony overlooking the pool, it was covered in gorgeous foliage and flowers, truly paradise! I was happy the bathroom was spotless, with a large granite counter, oversized mirror and extra-large sparkling white tub. Also, the room had a safe, and ironing board and iron, and daily updates on your hotel voicemail about the events you might want to attend. The location was great, the entire hotel looks as though it was recently updated, the grounds were immaculate, manicured and lush, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gators09
Reviews.Content: We are from Florida and hadn't been to Key West in years. What a delightful surprise. The town is transformed from what we remembered on our last visit. We stayed at the Southernmost and were concerned that it might be noisy, since it's on Duval (the main action street). It turned out that the Southernmost is on the "calm" end of Duval with excellent restaurants and activities within walking distance. The room was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. It overlooked the pool and had a cozy balcony with two chairs and table. The room had a safe, small refrig, coffee machine, etc. The only slight downside was that the a/c is a unit, rather than central. My husband likes that, but I prefer central. Since the hotel has been around awhile, it had lovely vegetation all around our balcony. (We noticed while driving around that some of the newer hotels looked sort of sterile.) There is free WiFi in the rooms (which worked perfectly.) The staff was very helpful, and there was plenty of parking. The tour trolley has a stop behind the hotel, which was convenient. Key West and the Southernmost were both delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this hotel. Great pools and beach.”
Reviews.Author: VinovinoOhio
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very nice. The best part is that you can pay less for this hotel and still use the amenities of the hotel on the beach. We went to 2 of the 3 pools and enjoyed the beach for 3 days. On the beach, the "beach keeper" came and gave us all a popsicle and later on in the day came around to everyone and sprayed their feet with cool water to cool them off. Great touch! We loved the Tiki bar at the pool and the bartender was great. Luke, I think was his name. Our only bad experience was having lunch at the Beach Cafe. We sat at the bar instead of waiting for a table and it was next to impossible to get the bartenders attention for anything at all. We had to practically raise our hand and ask for everything. 2 female bartenders were working that day and neither of them would even give us eye contact. That is the only bad memory of our stay. Loved renting bikes right at the hotel and booking the Commotion in the Ocean right there. Both are highly recommended. Only takes 5 minutes to get to Mallory Square on a bike. About 25 minutes to casually walk it. But there's so much to see on the walks, it went fast. We will definitely be back to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jolile
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 girl friends in Jul 2008 and the hotel was fabulous - 2 lovely pools, friendly staff and GORGEOUS roomy peaceful rooms. Wonderful bathrooms - its at the bottom of the street so there is a bit of a walk to the main bars and clubs on the street - which isnt a bad thing. Loads of things to do in the area we stuck to the main street- theres laundry, internet caafes , clubs (must go to sloppy joes and snag yourself a pilot lol) bard resturants - we also went on a FABULOUS snorkling trip in the gulf at the top end of the street - I'm dying to go back there and I would DEFINATELY stay at this hotel in a second. The beach near the hotel isnt the best but who needs a beach all of the time?? KEY WEST IS AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: poetzmuse
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in The Southernmost Hotel in Key West! I would recommend this hotel and its excellent staff to everyone! The room was clean and roomy, the maid was smiley and sweet, the pools immaculate, the bartender(young guy with great music) was very nice, consigner(sp?) was most helpful, the people at desk kind and hospitable. I cannot say enough good things of our stay(room183-5/7-5/11). And the location was great; one block from the ocean and right on Duvall! We also found a great little Cuban cafe within walking distance run by the lovely Miss Ana. Popular spot because of excellent food, coffee, and friendliness! We will be back to Key West next year and will stay at the wonderful Southernmost! Tim and Erin, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LCHRH
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two nights at the Southernmost Hotel with my husband and another couple. We booked there because we were running out of options and the price was right. We were VERY lucky! The property itself is much more charming than the pictures indicate. The room was newly redecorated and cute. The location was really fantastic if you don't mind walking while you pub crawl (and we didn't - mind the walking or the pub crawling that is). The bed and pillows were very comfortable, the flat screen TV was new. The toiletries were fine. My only concern would have been our bathroom floor. It didn't look clean and was wet when we checked in (which might have been from cleaning but still creeped me out a bit). I would absolutely stay here again. We had lunch the first day at the Southernmost Cafe across the street. It was a great place to have a fish sandwich and a beer before exploring the rest of Key West. Great little beach, great views, we loved the Southernmost. Dining-wise, The Hog's Breath had our favorite conch fritters of the trip (and the green sauce - yum!). We had dinner at El Meson de Pepe which was very true to the TA reviews - really touristy location, really tasty cuban food and mojitos. It's located near Mallory Square. We had breakfast at Blue Heaven (loooong wait but worth it. I had lobster, bacon and tomato benedict. Should be a crime it was so good). The reviews you will read about the chickens are accurate and they add to the charm. We also had breakfast at Harpoon Harry's. Also good but not AS good as Blue Heaven. We at dinner at Kelly's Key West also. Really romantic atmosphere. Dinner was good. I had blackened tuna that I ordered "flopping on the plate", it was served medium to med/well but still tasty. Three of us had different versions of their fresh fish preparations (macadamia crusted snapper with banana rum butter - delicious!!). They brew onsite, we thought we ordered their Golden Ale, we're pretty sure it was a red ale, it was good beer either way.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FAMILY SPOT IN KEY WEST!”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticuttCTFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here.. This hotel is much less expensive than the "Southernmost on the Beach", but you get to use their facilties which are just across the road on the water. Make sure you do- the pool, bar and beach area are world class. Concierger was useful, but do your own homework first so you know what you want to see and do.. Rooms were very clean and quiet, overall hotel condition was excellent. The restaurant is on the beach, good service and reasonable, great breakfast spot. We would recomend this hotel to anyone, especially if travelling with kids. The location is right on the main drag Duval, but far enough away from the nightime crowds.

Reviews.Title: “you get more than you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: denwiz
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with extremely clean modern rooms. The old saying you get what you pay for is not true here....you get a lot more than what you pay for. The staff is exceptional....friendly and helpful. The location is quiet! A necessity after all the party scene further down on Duval. A great area to walk in .....nearby beaches and pleasant residential area. Lovely to have coffee on the wharf across from the hotel while drinking the free coffee from the hotel....watching the sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “A Saturday we will always remember.”
Reviews.Author: TexasBambino
Reviews.Content: While in Miami on business I suprised my wife with a weekend in Key West. We were fortunate to pick this hotel over all the others. I admit we picked it because of the value but when we walked into our room we were very suprised. It was very clean and friendly looking! All of the staff were very friendly and everything about our stay was wonderful. Our room overlooked the fountain in the front and even the water sound from the fountain made the stay so relaxing. I will most certainly come back! My wife said that she liked it better than Hawaii!.

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee”
Reviews.Author: inzane44
Reviews.Content: Last week I was looking into Southernmost Hotel and on their website said the cheapest room was $174+. Went to Hotels.com and Hotwire and they showed rooms for $139.00. Called Southernmost direct for their guaranteed lowest rate and they said there couldn't be a lower rate. The girl asked me what site and when I gave her Hotels.com she looked it up and said the hotel would still not give me the lower rate and to book it through the third party. 3 days later I saw Hotels.com change their price to the $174.00 rate. A hotel that can't stand behind their guarantee doesn't need my business...I'm staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, relax, Tiki bartenders are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kccoz1159
Reviews.Content: This is our second 5 day stay at this resort. You have full access to all pools and SM resort areas. Cafe around the corner with great food located open air right on the beach. Beach area is clean and not to over crowded. All the help and staff are very ready to serve your needs. Great concierge available. Tiki bartenders at pool are fantastic and informative about the keys and where to go for food or night life.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and rundown!”
Reviews.Author: sdunb9
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here in late October right after Fantasy Fest ended. Our room was filthy, beds were broken down and the bathroom was a nightmare. Make-up was smeared all over the bathroom door. Glitter was everywhere. The room smelled funky. A light on the dresser kept going on and off all night. I was told by some friends that next time, ask to stay in the newer part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Joanna075
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than 2pm checkin time. No problem. However the room they gave us had not been finished with it's cleaning. We went back to the office and the very kind gentleman upgraded our room no charge! The staff wa s so friendly. Even though this was our second time here they welcomed us back like old friends. We checked our bags with them on the day we left and spent the day at their lovely beach accross the street. The comfotable chairs were complementary. Wehad both breakfast and lunch at the restaurant on the beach which was great! We were able to have access to their shower facilities before we hopped on the 5pm ferry back to Marco Island.

Reviews.Title: “great family location”
Reviews.Author: jilliam3224
Reviews.Content: Stayed with whole family in total of 6 rooms at Southernmost. Rooms were modern and clean, good value. Kids loved the great pools, grownups the tiki bar. Close to the beach. bit of a walk to other end of Duval but having a quiet place to come back to was perfect. friendly staff - and other guests- will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: setthoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married on South Beach (Key West, not Miami) in November '08. The Southernmost resort event planner handled most of our ceremony arrangements and around 30 of our 45 guests stayed at the Southernmost Hotel. Our experience was truly priceless and we were very happy with the facilities along with the friendliness of the employees. Even though the wedding was on a public beach close to the cafe, they were able to set it up so that we weren't interrupted and it truly felt like a very private and intimate ceremony both for us and our guests. The location was convenient because it was close enough to walk to the shopping and nightlife but far enough away to relax. The pools & tiki bar became a fantastic gathering place where our guests from both families spent a lot of time getting to know each other. The Dewey House was also a very convenient place for my wife to get ready before the ceremony. Overall, I would definitely recommend having a wedding at the Southernmost Resort. It was perfect and unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “This place is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: shawnt90
Reviews.Content: The key s to spring for the ocean front rooms, they are so beautiful and so worth it. The grounds are clean and they have hamocks all over, and at the bars on the grounds the drinks are strong and the staff is friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great experience @ Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: imurit
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. the staff was very helpful, the rooms were very clean and very pretty decorated. very close to (the action) recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: “quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: VickyH
Reviews.Content: Great location-at end of Duval street where all the shops and cafes are but i would have hated to be any further up that street as its non stop all night so the action was close enough but not on door step. Was about 15-20 min walk to mallory square where everynight at sunset there are entertainers and stalls and a great sunset, more bars etc. Key west is like Benidorm for americans but with more History, prettier houses and great water activities. The rooms here were a great size, massive bed and big bathroom and TV, pool area was great and little beach nearby ok. We enjoyed a great Dolphin safari looking for them in the wild-went with Gary -Dream chasers. We also wandered around Historic area which was pretty. Helpful stafff at hotel so all in all a good spot

Reviews.Title: “we will DEFINITELY return!!!”
Reviews.Author: nanjech
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (me, hubby, 3 young kids) stayed at the Southernmost from 2/16-2/20. We both lived in Key West for a total of 8 years before we had kids and we always remembered this place! The rooms were newly updated (beautifully) and immaculate. The beds were extremely comfortable and the air conditioner worked great. There was also a mini fridge and microwave tucked away behine a built in piece of furniture. Our room was always cleaned up and replenished when we returned to shower in the late afternoon. Even the beach/pool towels were nice and plush. We only utilized the pool across the street at Southernmost On The Beach and that was immaculate and had a great bar, friendly bartender and well made drinks! Obviously, we had no complaints - and would surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous...can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: suzysellsrealestate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Key West - we stayed at the Southermost Hotel from February 10-16, 2009. I just wanted to let you know that this was the best vacation we ever had! The accomodations were beautiful - the room was not only lovely, but offered all the conveniences we could possibly need, i.e. hairdryer, coffee maker, iron/ironing board, refrigerator, microwave, oh, and the beds rocked us to sleep - great matress and pillows! The pools and tiki bar were fabulous, the entire staff (reception, concierge (Walter and Dan were amazing!!!), maintenance) was efficient, professional and very friendly. The location at the beach with volleyball, the restaurant - everything right off of Duvall Street. - just perfect!!! How convenient to be able to rent bicyles right from your concierge - and the Ultimate Adventure we booked was truly one of the best days EVER!!! We cannot wait to return to the Southernmost again and again. Thank you for making our vacation the best we could have imagined!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DanMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel in Feb/09 in a king deluxe room on the 1st floor near the street. The room was old, noisy, and barely large enough for the bed. The location at the end of Duval St is the only thing this hotel has going for it. The pool is small and the tiki bar is nothing special. Their was no happy hour. At check in they give you a complimentary drink voucher. They neglect to tell you that you need to go across the street to the Southernmost Cafe and buy an entree to redeem the voucher. We did not get the value we should have for the rates they charge. From the other reviews we expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: peanutsNewYork
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West every year and the Southernmost Hotel is our favorite place to stay. It is a welcoming, friendly place that is always clean, very well maintained and constantly being updated. It has a perfect location that allows you to walk everywhere. You have use of all the amenities at all the Southermost properties. We love the pools, the Tiki Bars and all the people that work there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasLady
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via a web search. We wanted to stay in Old Town so that we could park our car and walk to all the scenic, historic, tourist sites, plus the recommended restaurants and bars. Southernmost Hotel is IT! Great location, nice clean room, friendly staff. I'd eat somewhere else than their restaurants, but other than that, the place was great and, if you are lucky enough to grab one of their lower priced, two-bedroom units, it's a pretty good bargain as well. We paid approx. $160 a night for two nights and thought we had a great deal to be so close to the Old Town action!

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: leeber
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Southernmost Hotel in Key West many times. Each time we arrive, it's like "going home''. I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone from Management to Maintenance was friendly, courteous and did everything to make our stay just fabulous. As usual, the room was comfortable and spotless. Can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel the Best!”
Reviews.Author: 4theBirdsFlorida
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel was our hotel of choice during our recent visit to Key West. After looking at the interent for a place to stay I settled on the Southernmost and have absolutely no regrets on the selection. The room was a good size, very clean w/ tile floors and a great shower. There was a safe in the room and the beds were very comfortable. We liked that once we got there and parked the car, it stayed there until it was time to leave. It is not a bad walk down to the other end of Duval plus there are restaurants, bars, etc on the walk down or you can hire a pedicab if you prefer not to walk. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: BernieZ9
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and stayed in some of its finest hotels. The staff at Southernmost was right up there with the best of them - competent, friendly, helpful, and anxious to please. Whenever I met them on the grounds they had a big smile and a friendly greating for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to rest”
Reviews.Author: missmarley
Reviews.Content: Great place to come back to after a long day at KW. My only two issues are if you are going to have rooms 3 floors up, provide elevators. Also the jacuzzi was not even six feet in diameter, very small and not much water in it. However, it's always the 'issues' that come to mind first right? :-) Seriously, adorable room, very modern looking and comfy!! We rented a scooter right there in the visitor's center next to the lobby. Nice people, nice place, will stay again if they can keep the rates competitive...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: cayohueso08
Reviews.Content: Booked a block of rooms in November for ourselves and our wedding guests as we got married in Key West Nov. 22nd. Our room was perfect - 3rd floor overlooking the pool - spacious and clean. Hotel location was perfect for us and our guests - across the street from the beach, and within walking distance to shops and restaurants on the "quiet" (south?) end of Duval. The pool is really nice, the tiki bar at the pool is great. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We LOVED the Southernmost Beach Cafe - we ate there at least once a day. It is beautiful, open-air right on the beach, and the prices are reasonable. The staff there were great, too. I had absolutely no complaints about our stay at the Southernmost, it was one of the highlights of our wedding in Key West, for us and our guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, had everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: mackielacey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! They upgraded us at check-in to a better class of double queen room. It had a beautiful big walk in shower - TONS of shelves, etc. bathroom space. Beds were really comfortable, big tv, frig, microwave. Location was great as we parked our car when we got there and never used it. Walked a lot each day but hey, it helped get rid of the extra beverages and food we consumed while on holiday! Nice pools, etc. too on property. We were very happy with the hotel and will definitely book it next time we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a lovely quite area of Key West”
Reviews.Author: tobswa
Reviews.Content: We booked an Economy Queen room and were extremely pleased as our room had been recently refurbished to a very good standard. It was well appointed with lovely furniture fitting the character of the building, the style of the hotel is typical for Key West. We found the room very comfortable and clean and more than adequate for our stay. There is ample free parking for hotel guests. The hotel has a number of pools and they provide free pool towels for hotel guests. There is a bar at the main pool which is near reception, we however chose to sit round one of the others as it was a lot less busy and a bit more peaceful. I think you can also use the sun beds on the beach free of charge. This beach was an ideal location to watch the beautiful sunsets. The location of the hotel is ideal. It is situated at the quite end of Duval Street, a little out of the main centre away from all the rowdy night life, but close enough to be able to walk to the bars and restaurants. There are a few local bars and lovely restaurants nearby, we would recommend The Good Life for really nice local homely food.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!! Ignore any bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbrook
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for a week and loved it!! The hotel was lovely, in a perfect location with its private beach and cafe on the beach. While on the beach, you get a complimentary sunbed and table each day if you are staying at the hotel which is a nice touch! We found the staff to be helpful and poliet, we had a lovely room and were able to park our car in front of it the whole time. The hotel is right at the end of the Duval Street, where all the shops, restaurants and bars are. The guys at reception booked a couple of trips for us, which were brilliant, they were very helpful! The Southernmost Cafe, was great, lovely food that was reasonably priced, good service and most of all the best cocktails - you must try them! This hotel helped make our stay in Key West an enjoyable one without a doubt, good value for money, great location and lovely clean rooms (the bathroom was better than our one at home!!) Book here you won't be dissapointed!! And if you get a chance, visit the Dolphin Research Centre in Grassy Keys, (about an hours drive from the hotel) and have a swim with a dolphin. Its a fabulous place and the best experience we've ever had, so worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Newry82
Reviews.Content: Key West is a beautiful compact city and the Souternmost Hotel is an ideal point from which to explore it. As the name suggests its right beside the souternmost marker and a small but ample beach. The rooms came with a fridge much appreciated after the sun in Key West and were very clean. The pool and jacuzzi on offer also refreshed weary travelers and the coin operated laundry facilities allowed a wash to be done before moving on to the next city. I would highly recommend this hotel to any would be traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget friendly accomodations in KW”
Reviews.Author: indygirl06
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Southernmost Hotel. Overall, it was a nice stay. Please note, this is a 2 star hotel. But for a 2 start hotel, it is definitely above average. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. The rooms have recently been semi-updated. We had a deluxe room on the 2nd floor with a balcony overlooking the parking lot. The room was aesthetically pleasing (new furniture and paint) and clean. However, it was on the smaller side, the beds was uncomfortable and the bedding was pretty cheap and scratchy. The bathroom was pretty small and could use some updating. We did enjoy having breakfast and lunch at the Southernmost Beach Cafe almost everyday. The tiki bar by the pool was great too. We were at the hotel for a wedding and they were fine with us bringing our own beverages to the pool area (rooms have a mini fridge and microwave). I like that the Southernmost is on the quiet side of Duval St. They were just finishing the Southernmost on the Beach which looks great so I would definitely encourage people to check it out once it opens!

Reviews.Title: “Good location , OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMSNAR
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here in October 2008 and had 3 rooms for our party which were deluxe rooms. Overall I would say that the hotel is 3 star. (English standard) The guy at check in was pleasant enough and our rooms were all located on the ground floor at the back of the main pool. The rooms were pretty standard even though we had deluxe rooms , I wouldnt want to be in the economy rooms anyway. The rooms could do with a little TLC ie shower tap was hanging off , door stop was hanging off. However the hotel is in a good location 3 mins from the ocean and well worth a visit for breakfast is the Southernmost cafe on the beach - a nice spot to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel on the quiet end of Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: booler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a nice weekend at the Southernmost Hotel. Our trip started off on on the right foot as the desk person informed us that we were upgraded to a room with a pool side balcony. The room was nice and clean, but I will say if you go during a humid period you will need to put the air on high to remove the moisture from the room. If you like the water there is convenient access to a private beach. The restaurant/bar of the Southernmost Beach Hotel offers great water front dining for breakfast or a relaxing cocktail in the evening. One thing to note is that if you do not like to walk you may want to rent a scooter or a bike as the main section of Duval St. is about a quarter of a mile away and Mallory Square is about half a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: laewagne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing for the price!! The location is excellent - right across the street from the Butterfly Conservatory and a block from the beach and the Southernmost point in the US. It's a 10 minute walk from all the popular bars on Duval - just not near all the noise. It's located near all the local art galleries and some great restaurants. The pools and tiki bar are also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A Good choice”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireElliot
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at the Southernmost - stayed 3 nights in August (we left just before tropical storm Faye arrived), The check in staff were very helpful and gave us access to all 3 different room types for us to make our choice. They are different - the 'budget' class overlooks the parking lot and needs some TLC - the deluxe are more central and have a walk in shower and a larger tv. The pool view rooms are probably the best but the bathrooms are not as large or as good as the deluxe (they have a shower over the bath). Try to get a high floor if you go for this type to make the best use of your balcony (which none of the other room types have) Location is a 20 minute walk to Mallory Square but the walk itself is entertaining as you pass some really good shops and restaurants/bars on the way. On the plus side it is quiet at night and the hotel has access to a really good (though small) section of beach with complimentary beds and a quality beach bar/restaurant. They are in the process of building new accommodation around this beach area and once it is available I would strongly recommend it as the place to stay in Key West.. Free car parking, complimentary coffee by the main pool, the Key West visitor centre in reception (very informative) and the trolley bus stop right outside the hotel are added bonuses. Good value and a desire to please - enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaWPB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in August 2008. The hotel stay was good. King room ($119 a night special) on third floor with parking lot view. Staff was friendly, two pools on premises, pretty spacious room with mini fridge and microwave. The room was pretty clean but the A/C filter wasn't the cleanest (a bit moldy). The A/C was cold, beds were alright, nice size balcony and free use of wireless internet. I had breakfast at their Cafe but I've had better. Located at quiet end of Duval Street...about one mile to Mallory Square at the opposite end of Duval. There was plenty of parking but then again it's not exactly season. I was originally planning on staying elsewhere but I'm glad I chose this hotel. It's right on Duval and was well lit at night unlike some of the other places I passed by on the side streets. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sleepy end of duval st”
Reviews.Author: wookiebig
Reviews.Content: nice hotel good food at the beach cafe, but a fair walk to the centre of mayhem on duval street

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: duke18
Reviews.Content: Drove to KW for just the day and decided to stay the night. Found a vacancy at the Southernmost Hotel. The girl taking making my reservation was great! It was Hemingway Wekend and we considered ourselves lucky to have found a vacancy anywhere! Have walked by the place many times while in KW on other trips, but had never stayed there. That's our only disappointment! That we waited this long to stay there! What a great room! It was really big, the furnishings looked brand new and were very contemporary, nice tile floor instead of the usual hotel carpeting and the bath room was large and obviously just remodeled. A large amoire held the flat screen TV and hid a mini-fridge and microwave. While we didn't get to use the two pools on property, they looked inviting and clean with a nice tiki bar at one of them. The 3rd pool is over near the beach. We had breakfast at their restaurant on the beach. Good food right on the water, can't get better than that! The beach is small, but you don't go to KW for their beaches anyway. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. It is a walk from the activity on Duval, but everything is in walking distance in KW. You don't use or need a car on vacation in KW. We park ours and never use it for the duration of our stay. Free parking at the hotel was really a plus. We live in West Palm Beach and drive to KW often, 20 plus trips so far, and have stayed a all kinds of different accomodations from Sunset Key to renting houses. The Southernmost Hotel is definitely worth a return visit. Sorry we didn't stay here sooner. We''ll be back! What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Dull and Dark”
Reviews.Author: fidelma66
Reviews.Content: The rooms we had are decorated very dull dark depressing colours, its a bit of a crush between the beds and the units, the lighting is quite bad, and if you leave your curtains open everyone walking by can see directly in at you and everything you have, we had to ring to get the room made up. The hotel is far from where it all is happening, and if you decide to drive anywhere you loose your spot and parking is so limited you have to park on the street and pay per hour parking. the walk to the closest place to eat is about 15 minutes, in teh heat its like hours away!! there is a place to eat if you go to the sister hotel, southernmost on the beach, but god what a horrible beach, its dirty and covered in seaweed, they said its because of a storm, but it wasnt nice teh whole time we were there, we saw a postcard of an amazing beach and asked where it was so we coudl go swim, he said it was the one we were on we just laughed. there is apool by a tiki bar, but it is loud noisy and not our thing, so we found a quiet pool opposite our rooms and it was lovely, nice and quiet. Beds are comfortable adn TV is a good size, microwave and fridge and small safe box. bathroom is lovely. i guess i downgraded the teh experience mroe because of the decor and distance from things and places to eat. icecream on the corner is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2004 and were so pleased with the hotel that we came back. The room decor is high quality and the bathrooms have been remodeled with granite counters and neat shower hardware. The pool is very popular along with their tiki bar. The crowd is almost all adults, friendly but not on the wild side. The hotel had put out about 7 pool floats for the guests to use-which was a nice touch. We had an 8 year old with us. He did not seem to disturb the guests and we were comfortable having him there-even if he was the only kid in the pool area. The beauty of Southernmost is that you get access to the Southernmost on the Beach/Dewey House private beach area and beach cafe. It is across a fairly low-traffic street. The beach cafe is pretty good. We had both breakfast and lunch there several times. The staff was very friendly with good service. Note that Southernmost is building new hotels on the beach side. The construction was not loud enough to be heard at our hotel, however the guests at Southernmost at the Beach were NOT happy. Banging started at 8am, they were redoing the roof of the hotel-which resulted in the pool being closed with construction walls on one side. We looked at booking there, and I don't remember the construction being noted. If you want to stay on the beach properties-I highly recommend that you make sure they have finished construction before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toby111
Reviews.Content: As a first-time visitor to Key West, I chose this hotel as it was walking distance to the town and close to the water. The photos seemed nice and it had everything we needed. Overall, we were not disappointed. The location is great. The little beach cafe was very good and we had some nice meals there. The concierge was helpful. The room was nice, fairly recently reno'd with good beds and linens. The negatives were the noisy airconditioner, the pitiful old thin towels and the sketchy internet access. They did give us a cable to use however. The other negative was the fact that the pool/bar area is too small for the size of the hotel. We were unable to find a place to sit (for two) and get a drink (around 5 pm) and since our room did not have a balcony there was nowhere else to go that was close to our room (our son wanted to stay in the room). I would recommend getting a room with a balcony even if the view is over the parking lot. It is probably better than no balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Southernmost after all these years”
Reviews.Author: Mesa-AZ
Reviews.Content: They keep redoing this property, to our delight. Rainshower nozzle in a sleek spa-like bath; comfy bed with good sheets. Cool tile floor. Great housekeeping not only in the rooms but throughout the property. And, great unabtrusive security. Hotel works hard to keep our quiet end of Duval quiet! 10 years ago there was no access to the pier; now there is. And the pool beachside is wonderful. The cafe has been absorbed by Southernmost too and is now nicely redone and has reasonable, large portion tasty food. Would we return? Again and again! PS this is not a downtown hotel, be prepared to get transport. PPS the black carpet in the exterior hallways is one design defect, hope they come up with something better. Don't tread on this barefoot, ick.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLynn
Reviews.Content: Me, Husband and my parents wanted a 2 night getaway to Key West as my parents had never been. Hotel location was pretty good. It was on Duval Street, although on the other end, but if you wear comfy shoes you can walk down to the action with no problem. Room was nice and clean, although a little small. We lounged by the beach all day Saturday. The beach is nice, although a little strange with a rusty dock sticking out. The restuarant on the beach was great, we had breakfast there. The drinks are great...but you can't bring them on the beach which is a major bummer!!!! There is nothing better then sipping a margarita while looking out at the sea. Juan the beach attendant was great...offering us cool towels and water spritzes. The restuarant had a great happy hour special - 1/2 price wings and peel and eat shrip and drink specials. Overall we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: mcostafish
Reviews.Content: We recently got married in Key West & planned our wedding thru the hotel. Ourselves, along with all our family & friends stayed at The Southernmost. Everyone was very pleased with their rooms and really enjoyed themselves. Great pool & tiki bar. Staff is very nice and attentive. Love that it's at the quieter end of the island, but walkable to everything. Our guests all had different rooms ranging from Pool View Kings to the most basic...Economy Queen. The ecomony queen was actually really cute. Small, however, bathroom was remodeled. We had the Pool View King with a balcony. Room was big, but our bath was small & had only been partially updated. Balcony was small, not really worth the extra price. The Deluxe rooms were cheaper than pool view & I actually like the best. Bathrooms were nice in the Deluxe. The Traditional rooms had not been updated yet, but were still clean & comfortable. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Tiki Bar&Rooms, Bad room keys”
Reviews.Author: sherm0206
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Southernmost Hotel. The location is perfect and the Tiki Bar / Pool area was a lot of fun! The only complaint that we have is the room keys. We had to replace our keys several times each day, because they would not work. Even after making sure to follow the receptionists instructions to keep the keys away from credit cards and trying to make sure that they did not become demagnetized, they still wouldn't work! It wasn't a big deal for us, but I can see how some guests would find this very irritating. Everything else about our stay was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon Getaway at Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: Highboltage
Reviews.Content: A great place. Very convenient, right on Duval but the quiet end. Private beach, beachside restaurant, tiki bar by pool, three pools. Our room was great. It was in the tower and when we were first entering I was already to march back down the the desk to remind them that I'd requested pool view. Imagine my surprise when I walked in and saw our own balcony overlooking one of the pools. And the decor! Brown, turquoise, beige, yellow - very old Florida. It was gorgeous. Lovely bathroom too with rain shower head. The pools were awesome. The pours at the tiki bar were generous. The beachside cafe was great for breakfast, prices consistent if not better than most surrounding restaurants and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Southernmost Hotel in Key West is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cubs1981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first trip to Key West from June 2nd through the 6th. The Southern Most Hotel was the perfect place to stay. The price was great and the location was even better. We stayed in a basic king room and it was just what we were looking for. We used the beach at the Southernmost Resort and ate lunch at the cafe on the beach. The people that work at the Southernmost need to be commended. They were extremely helpful and welcoming. We WILL stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost/Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ColetteCoNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southernmost from May 27th - May 31st. Nice clean rooms, nice size, not too small and the air conditioner was awesome kept room cold, fridge is room was a pleasant surprise. Tropical decor of four hotels was very pleasing to the eye, grounds were kept very well, by a friendly woman groundskeeper. There are four properties, you get to use three pools, 2 tiki bars and the beach. Hotel is a good distance from the happening end of Duval, 20 min/approx. one mile walk to sunset pier/Mallory Square. Bikes and mopeds can be rented. Drinks poolside were expensive at Tiki bar, beach chairs were free to hotel guests at beach if you showed your key, beach bar for drinks and breakfast was great. Awesome stay, met some great folks from Brick, NJ and a couple from NY....nice people! Oh yeah, and pilot Bill from Tampa :0) If I had to complain at all....I can only come up with one. Hotel guests are not allowed food or beverage other than what is sold/purchased at tiki bar in the pool area. If you stay for five days as we did, the food choices, drink choices get dull fast. I say, SOUTHERMOST HOTEL, allow guests to bring our own food and drink if needed, no glass items of course poolside so that we may enjoy the pool without having to purchase the limited food and beer items the resort has to offer day after day. Other than that, GREAT PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MBNash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of May with three other friends, and we thought it was a perfect place to stay. It was great because it was right across the street from the beach and walking distance to all the bars and restaurants. Our room was so much nicer than we expected and the bathroom was all tile. The hotel's pool was a great atmosphere with a tiki bar with reasonable price drinks. I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay at in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: jefe96
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southernmost from May 17th - May 22nd. This is not a 5 star resort type hotet, but is much nicer than some of the other motel/hotel properties in town. Rooms are all very nice with excellent amenities. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds. For 2 people it was ok, but I could see it being crowded with 4 people. The bathroom was huge though and made up for any other shortcomings. The AC was powerful and welcomed us back from many long, hot walks down Duval Street. This hotel has 2 swimming pools on the property and then you are also allowed to use the pool and beach across the street at the Southernmost at the Beach. Of course I guess anyone could use those since there is nobody around to actually check to see if you're a registered guest. The main pool at the Hotel has a nice Tiki Bar right there as well. Drinks there can be a little expensive and the pool area gets quite crowded. The pool across the street is a lot quieter and you can bring your own drinks!! (again, nobody really around to check on anything). This hotel is at the southern, quiet end of Duval Street, so it is a long walk to get to the other end where most of the action is. I personally don't have a problem with that, but if you're someone who has difficulty walking, or just doesn't like to, then you might want to rent a car, scooter, or electric car. There are some businesses located in the area though. Just up Duval is a Rum Bar (forget the name) and also La Te Da (if that's your thing). Around the corner is a nice Cuban convenience store that serves very good Cuban sandwiches for both breakfast and lunch. You're also a short walk from a CVS and also another deli and the Bottlecap Lounge. I love this hotel and will continue to stay here everytime I go to Key West until I get bored of it. I'm not really a B&B/Guesthouse type of person so this place is perfect. And I don't have the money to drop 400 bucks a night at Ocean Key.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Redd1967
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, nice pools, fun tiki bar, comfortable beds....only problem was that our bathroom was small and it made it difficult for 2 of us to be in there at the same time. Would certainly stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Definately not bad”
Reviews.Author: Aatu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its reviews and the price we got. Before arrival I was a bit worried that the location might be too far off from downtown, but this was unnecessary. The walk is about 20 minutes and itâ€™s down one street, which has some restaurants and other activities. Hotel has plenty of parking space available. At the check in we were greeted by probably the friendliest (and smiling) man Iâ€™ve ever met. He gave us all the necessary details about the hotel as well as some recommendations for dinner etc. Room was nice (standard twin room) with clean interior. It wasnâ€™t huge, but enough for two persons. The bathroom was large and I have to give a plus for the fridge. We didnâ€™t have a balcony, but we didnâ€™t mind, as sitting at the hotel wasnâ€™t one of our plans. We didnâ€™t have any problems sleeping nor was there much noise in the room. We had breakfast at the close by cafÃ© on the beach â€“ very nice! Just abt. 100 meters from the hotel and it had good service with sea view. The beach itself isnâ€™t worth mentioning as it is rather small. If you want to relax on the beach I would suggest you go somewhere else. The pool area was clean and rather hot as there was no wind. We didnâ€™t try the tiki bar as there were plenty of bars in the center. Nice, very comfortable hotel with an ok location. Itâ€™s definitely not luxury, but just a bit above average.

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Experience!”
Reviews.Author: azpajak
Reviews.Content: What a way to experience Key West. Our first time there and the hotel was beautiful! The property (consists of four total hotels clustered together) was very quaint and tropical and gorgeous! As a guest, you can use the ammenities of all four properties (pools, beach, etc.). The rooms were decorated beautifully and kept very clean. The hotel is within a short walking distance of the ocean and many shops and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied at the Southernmost Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bashigyal
Reviews.Content: We spontaneously went to Key West the last week of March '08 and walked into Southernmost Hotel w/out a reservation. Got a 2nd floor room w/ a King bed and balcony for $213/night + tax. Considering I am a research queen and only book hotels after feaverishly reading all the reviews on tripadvisor, we were extremely happy with our impromptu choice of staying at the Southernmost Hotel. It had the right "look" from the outside and we found it to be a very clean, nice hotel. The room was very spacious, the bathroom immaculate, and the pool was beautiful with it's cute fish-shaped chairs and sparkling water. Only complaint I can even think of is that their jaccuzi's jets were very weak. That's it. We were very happy there and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: flaleotraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key West Saturday, April 5 without a reservation, as we were checking into a cottage the next day for four nights. I called the Southernmost On The Beach and was quoted a room with two queen size beds for $199. I asked to book it but the woman who answered said there were a lot of beds available for this price, and to just come on over. And so we did. A woman named Veronika, who clearly does not understand she works in the HOSPITALITY business, told me the SOTB was booked, but that there were rooms at the Southernmost. When I told her the rate we were quoted, she insisted there was no such rate and that the room would be $279. She was extremely rude to us, even suggesting we'd called another hotel in error. (I pulled the number up from my cell to show her.) Finally, she called someone who said yes, they were selling rooms for $199. NO APOLOGY, just proceeded with the check-in. And, the first confirmation she pulled up for me to sign had the $279 price. After this, our experience was OK. The room looked fresh and clean but there were stains on the bedcoverings . It was an OK place to stay for one night. I wouldn't go back, as I prefer something with a little more personality -- both in the hotel/inn as well as in the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: maawildcats
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel, clean, loved the location, rented scooters from hotel and had an awesome time driving up and down Duval Street. Pool was very nice, great tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value....”
Reviews.Author: Roey1952
Reviews.Content: We could have stayed at a Marriott or Sheraton, but location and cost were the draw. Nice quiet end of Duvall St. 1 1/2 blocks to the ocean. Easy walk - about 1 mile - to Mallory Square and the Gulf. We stayed in a King room... It was great! Will definitely stay there again when we make it back down to the Keys. And, will recommend to friends and family. We ate breakfast at the Southernmost restaurant on the ocean. Good food for the price, and convenient. Front desk folks very helpful, and friendly. Can't wait to go back. The Polands' of Colorado

Reviews.Title: “loved the southernmost hotel”
Reviews.Author: mommahop6
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughters (14 & 22) just got back from our 1st trip to Key West. We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel based on recommendations thru trip advisor based on what our price range was and location of where would be best for us in Key West. It was perfect. We loved the clean room, soft queen beds, pool, bar, beach, free beach chairs and walking to duval street. The drinks and food at the hotel were great. We never used our rental car after we parked it at the hotel. We laid on the beach and at the pool all day, then showered and went to Duval Street to eat and party until we walked back, got in the hot tub and went to bed. I would highly recommend the Southernmost Hotel to anyone going to Key West. With the cost of everything else in Key West it helped not paying a fortune for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bebrbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights at the end of Feb 2008; Its not high-end living here - more of a nice motel room; External corridors and tiled floor everywhere make it sound like a dorm when the drunk people come home to roost at 3am, and there is a lot of street noise from Harleys, scooters etc on Duval Street too, so it was tough to get a full night's uninterrupted sleep; But, there's so much to do in Key West we weren't in the room much overall anyway; Its probably a 1 mile walk down to the center of activity from this hotel, and parking there is difficult and expensive so you'll want to do that and get your exercise anyway; Along the way is the Banana Cafe - great food!, but will also pass through a seedier end of the Duval Street strip, complete with drag queens out on the sidewalk after 9pm. Hotel gives you access to Southernmost's beach (across the street) and pier - both pretty nice; The place seems well run, clean and (considering how expensive hotels can be in KW) a good value for the dollar given its walkable location;

Reviews.Title: “Loved every moment of our stay at the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: howardwarwick
Reviews.Content: I felt good about this booking just two days after making it, when I got the first of three emails from the hotel confirming all the arrangements and giving useful information. The staff from the management down, were friendly and professional. Reception staff were ready and waiting for us on arrival and made sure we knew that they had only taken for one night on my credit card with the balance due on departure (many hotels take the lot at the time of booking). The room was clean, well furnished and well appointed. Wireless internet was free (although only available round the pool area) as was parking (free, that is). But the real 'wow' factor at this place is it's location. One of four adjacent properties at the Atlantic end of Duval Street it took us less than two minutes to walk from our room to the hotel's beach cafe in one direction or to the 'southernmost point in the USA' marker in the other direction. I could go on about the sunsets, the tiki bar, the amazing place that is Duval Street but that would spoil it for you. Just get online and book it - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, and a few extras”
Reviews.Author: karameli
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three nights at the Southernmost Hotel because of its Duval Street location and its beach access (at the adjacent Southernmost on the Beach). For a two-star hotel, the Southernmost met our expectations. Here's the breakdown... ROOM: Clean and fairly spacious. Plenty of room for three people and our luggage. A little bare-bones, with older shutter-style windows and tired decor. Our A/C was noisy, but functional, and that's what matters! All in all, a comfy place to crash after a long day. LOCATION: At the quiet end of Duval Street. It took us about 15-20 minutes to walk to Mallory Square at a sloooow pace. (It's easy to get distracted along the way.) A block from Southernmost Point and right across the street from the Butterfly Conservatory. Several good resturants within a few blocks. POOLS: Here's where this hotel beats a lot of similarly-priced options -- two pools on site and another next door. We only visited the main pool. Clean, clear, not overly chlorinated, cool enough for midday, but warm enough for a night swim. The hot tub is cloudy and a little too hot, especially if you're sunburned. The tiki bar by the main pool serves fantastic (and strong!) drinks. BEACH: Another bonus point for this hotel, since there's not a lot of beach on the island. There's a sign that beach chairs are $5 to rent, but they're free for hotel guests, so ask. The water is a little cloudy and seaweedy, but if you wade out a little it's less churned-up. Overall, it wasn't resort quality, but it wasn't resort price, either -- I gave it four stars based on its value for the money. We were satisfied and would recommend this hotel to someone looking for affordability and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “adequate accomodations with great location”
Reviews.Author: SFLMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our 2 kids (ages 10 and 13) for a few days over New Years. The hotel is really a motel with room doors opening up into the parking lot. The rooms are adequate and clean- but nothing special. Bathrooms though were spacious and seemed newly remodeled. Overall, for what we paid (over $200 nite) we were not thrilled. The good point was the excellent location. It is on the far end of Duval close to Southernmost point. It is much quieter down there yet still a comfortable walk to all. Duval is only 1 mile long end to end. We enjoyed the Butterfly Museum right across the street, the Conch Train tour, aquarium, Fort Zachary and shipwreckers museum. It was a relatively cold weekend, so we had to forego water activities but he kids were thrilled when we rented one of those little cool golf carts and drove all over town with it. For dining, we enjoyed the hotels beachside restaurant for breakfast, Blue Heaven, Abondonza and Camilles. Dissapointed with Alices after hearing rave reviews from fellow Miamians and also felt the Cuban restaurant that was receommended (can't remember the name) was not authentic or good- we are used to the best Cuban food here in Miami. Overall, we had a great time.We would probably stay at this hotel if we couldn't find anything else, or they werer offering a great special- but it would definitely not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: likes2vaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the beach and our room was 226. It was a great room overlooking the pool and beach. It had a fridge and microwave and placesettings of everything for two. The bathroom was huge and recently remodeled. We had no complaints at all about it. The bedroom had a king size bed, cathedral ceilings and a fan. However, they are doing MASSIVE construction next door and we were awoken on the first morning to trucks and noise at 6:45am. We called and they moved us to the Dewey house Rm 418 which is absolutley the best. A small B&B with 9 rooms. the rooms were great the inn keeper was charming and the amenities were outstanding. The hotel is really at the southernmost end of the island but we rode bikes everywhere or walked and it was very enjoyable. Ty in the concierege next to the pool was very helpful with info while we rented our bikes. I would stay there again, after checking if construction was complete. I would also stay at the Dewey house, although it was pricey, about 625 a night. It did include continental breakfast and an afternoon tea with food as well. We did use the pool at the hotel on the beach and it was not heated, but the hotel had two other pools across the street and they were nice. The tiki bar is great too. Did not eat at the resturant but it looked very nice and was busy all day.

Reviews.Title: “Southermost Hotel - good experience”
Reviews.Author: katina_l
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable, well appointed, and the bathroom large and keep very clean. The pier across the street provided an excellent spot for watching the sun rise and set. Actually, much nicer than Mallory Square. The pools were beautiful, although the jacuzzi was a little cloudy. The beach was ok, a little cloudier than the nearby Ft. Zachary Taylor state park. One of the staff was very helpful with a problem, others not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It, Nothing Worked and front desk does not care”
Reviews.Author: allisonasimmons
Reviews.Content: This is a Motel not a Hotel since it is outside and you need to drag your own bags to your room up the steps. It seemed we had nothing but problems during our stay. The Southernmost is NOT worth the money. When I arrived my room was very hot, I immediately went to the thermostat console and selected a lower temperature and higher fan speed. The air conditioner however did not respond. I had to call maintenance and was given a remote to control the air. I noticed this morning that there was another remote behind the lamp, this would imply the problem was know and I could have been informed about the issue on check-in instead of missing the sunset while it was fixed. I noticed that the fridge was switched off and switched it on within moments of arrival. It apparently does not work. I did not want to call about this since I had already had the maintenance guy fix the AC and also let us into our room last night since the card key I was given did not work. The maintenance staff seems first rate, responding quickly but the front desk staff seems cold and put out by inquiries. It seems incomprehensible from my experiences on Key West that this is the best they can do as far as front desk staff. The thing that bothers me most is the internet. I have been unable to get a signal strong enough to connect in my room the staff was very unconcerned and unapologetic. I was told to sit in reception and try the internet, it worked for 5 min only. It is sad that a hotel that is so lovely to look at would be so ill equip to accommodate todayâ€™s travelers and provide basic amenities. I believe I paid for things that where advertised and that I did not receive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, going back real soon”
Reviews.Author: ferg3298
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Key West on December 13th and stayed at the Southernmost for three days. We traveled with our kids who are 18 and 16. We had a ground floor room with two queen beds, looked like it had been remodeled, bathroom was really nice. The pool area is awesome , nice tiki bar there to, and you were allowed to use the facilities at all their sister properties. I have not a single complaint at all, everything was wonderful, so much so that I'm heading back the end of January for my wifes 40th birthday. There is bike rentals and scooter rentals right at the property, that is right on Duval Street at the more quiet end, but only a short walk to Mallory Square and all. Staff were always curteous, and helpful with any requests. Loved this place, you wont go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: perry2005
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 adults & two teenagers ages 19 and 16) stayed at the hotel for two nights on Dec. 23 & 24th after a week long cruise from the Eastern Carribean. We loved the resort & the location of the resort. We walked down Duval Street both nights that we were there and it's only about a 20 min. walk to Mallory Square. There were 3 pools to choose from and a small beach and restaurant on the premises. Our room had two double beds, which were a little small - but they were comfortable. The decor of the room and resort reminded me of what a room would be like in Key West - very quaint & tropical. The grounds and the landscaping was kept very nice. We definitely wish we could of stayed their for an entire week to be able to really enjoy everything there is to do in Key West. We definitely have Key West on the top of our list to visit and we would definitely like to stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay , only minor quibbles”
Reviews.Author: SOOOZ
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel is the least expensive of a cluster of properties in the same locale ,the Southernmost group,which also includes the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach, Dewey House, and La Mer Hotel. Had a look at a couple of other rooms before settling for number 332 on the 3rd floor - one of only 3 rooms which are on a sort of executive level, facing towards the ocean with a large private balcony and a view of one of the pools and the car park. The room was nicely furnished with a kingsize bed, large,clean and well equipped. with aircon and a ceiling fan. It looked like it had been recently refurbished. Other rooms I saw were smaller and some did not have private balconies. Furnishings varied. Only complaints : the maids weren't always very thorough and bedsheets weren't changed during our 4 day stay. Aircon was loud. The lack of a lift might be a problem for some. Guests have the use of 3 pools and a pier - 2 pools at the Southernmost Hotel and 1 pool and the pier at the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach opposite. The olympic size pool at the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach is currently being replaced by more rooms. Neither the ongoing construction at the Southermost Hotel on the Beach nor the replacement of decking at the main pool at our hotel disturbed us . The hotel is at the quiet end of Duval Street- about a mile from Mallory Square ,right opposite the beach and there are several restaurants and cafes nearby if you don't fancy walking too far including one on the beach which is part of the Southernmost group. The famous Louie's Backyard restaurant is close by. The historic seaport and boardwalk is about 20-30minutes walk but recommend making the trek there to the Half Shell Raw Bar after watching the sunset at Mallory Square- king crab claws are $19.95, all you can eat, on wednesday evenings and the atmosphere is great. Reception staff at the hotel were a mixed bunch and would benefit from some customer care training , the housekeeping as mentioned above could have been improved ,but overall we liked this hotel and its location and considered it good value for 130$ per night

Reviews.Title: “A week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: mgambler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in paradise. Key West has it all! We rode Bikes all over the island! every day. The southernmost hotel is just in the right spot to go swimming on the beach (just a half a block away) or catch some sun or just watch a beautiful sun rise. The staff was great and we love the ginger bread rooms in back looking toward the ocean.(a very slight veiw) 231 is our favorite. nothing fancy however just right and clean for the price. If they keep the price down it could be a bargin of a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: needaholiday50
Reviews.Content: We were checked into a room on the first floor. The room beside us was under construction. We were told no other rooms were available so we could not move. I find that hard to believe for the week after Thanksgiving. We decided to make the best out of it and stay out of the room as much as possible. The room was small but had everything we needed. They really need to get rid of those dirty bed spreads. The two pools at the hotel were nice. We spent one afternoon around the pool and kept wondering why the bar never opened. This hotel is, in a word, rigid. If you buy a coke, from a store, and decide to sit around the pool enjoying your coke, forget it. Only products purchased from the hotel allowed around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: TheWorkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southern Most on the Beach for my husbands 50th birthday. It was a surprise trip for him, until we arrived. The hotel had a bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us, in our room. I asked for the BEST room, and I definately got it. Clean, comfortable, great view. Our room was clean every afternoon by lunch time. We rented a scooter at the hotel, with no problems. We were even able to leave the key at the front desk when we checked out, becuase we had no time to return it. SUPER service. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights the middle of Oct. Our room was on a second floor with a small balcony that had chairs and a small table. The room and bathroom were very clean and modern. We booked from their website and chose a two-night package deal that gave you a $20 breakfast coupon at their cafe across the street right on the beach. They have 3 total properties and all pools and the cafe are accessible to all patrons. It was about a half mile walk down Duval St. to get to the beginning point of all the bars and restaurants in town and about a little over a mile total if you walked all the way to the Pier. We were totally satisfied with our stay and the rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Redbirdgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel in Key West in October for a weekend. It was practically perfect. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The front desk staff was extremely helpful in terms of all aspects of vacationing in Key West. They knew the answers to everything we asked. The rooms are very attractively decorated and very clean. The price was very reasonable as well. Another benefit was being able to use the amenities at all the properties they owned. The hotel is on Duval Street which is where all the action is...but it's situated at the quieter end. It was a really great location. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay nowhere else on my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: STOVERS
Reviews.Content: We just got back. We went Oct 6-10th, 2007. We are still trying to catch up on sleep. Excellent choice of hotel. I brought my parents with us and they were just as happy with our choice of hotels. It is right next to the southern most point, butterfly museum, scooter rentals, beach club, and a few blocks walk to the clubs. You should begin your trip with the trolley ride which picks you up right next the the hotel. You can get on and off, at different stops, from 9-5, and I think it was $27pp. It is quieter then the other end of Duval, which is only a short walk going but maybe a cab ride back, depending on the time of day and the amount of alcohol you consumed, but you will be happy. We had a deluxe queen, which was very nice, good tv, frig, micro, great shower. Only bad thing with the room was the ac unit has a beep. We had the night manager shut it off one night but i think we got used to it. If you want a better view of the water stay at the Southern most on the beach, but you will pay! My advise is to stay at the southernmost hotel and then use the southernmost for the small beach area and tanning pier.DONT MISS MALLERY SQUARE SUNSET or Matt Avery at biguns bar,

Reviews.Title: “what a let down,should have stayed in a cardboard box”
Reviews.Author: madtownMadison
Reviews.Content: o.k. if you want to be next to duval street, but for the price we paid i expected a bigger room then one of the size of a sleazy motel.no hbo , no internet, the bartender at the tiki bar was a jerk.the room was just big enough for a bed and one useless table, they even charged for local calls. the first time i've ever run into that. if it was between staying their and sleeping on a park bench, i'd take my chances on the bench

Reviews.Title: “Godd Stay at the Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nra92862
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from three days @ the Southernmost Hotel. The hotel is in a great location at the end of Duval Street . Although the property is not directly on the water, you can still enjoy the beach since they have three other properties on the water across the street. .There are 3 pools and a sunning pier with chaise loungers overlooking the southern most tip of the island, great for catching the amazing sunsets or fishing. My husband & son & I enjoyed the pools after a hot day sight seeing and f ishing . Overall I would say this is one of the nicest properties we have stayed in and I am extremely fussy! Nice & Clean & recently renovated in a chic tropical modern kind of way!! We were never far from a good place to eat along Duval Street, with all of it's interesting restaurants & eateries . The package we got included a $20.00 Voucher for breakfast @ Camilles, and it we enjoyed a great meal. Walter, the concierge on duty was the best!! He helped us choose a day cruise that included snorkeling, parasailing, jetskis, and several other activities including breakfast, lunch & cocktails afterwards. This was the most enjoyable short vacation we've had to the island in years!!!! Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More like Southernmost Motel”
Reviews.Author: pagrl17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a motel which they have conveniently changed the name to hotel. We were actually told this by a local Key West taxi driver. We were in a deluxe king which wasnâ€™t very deluxe at all. The bathroom is the smallest Iâ€™ve seen in a â€œhotelâ€� and the shower head was just a single stream of water. We have mixed feelings about the staff. The one girl at the check-in desk was extremely rude and didnâ€™t even say hello when we walked in. However, Walter the concierge was helpful and friendly. The location was a few blocks from â€œexcitingâ€� part of Duval street which is good or bad depending on what you are looking for. We never went to the pool because it was always SO busy and full and this is during off-season. Overall, we wouldnâ€™t stay here again. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: FunGyal
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend and we absolutely loved it. We found it to be very clean, not noisy at all. I love the walk in shower and the decor of the rooms.
