I am planning another trip there in November with some other friends. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Sure it doesn't have the amenities of a Hyatt, etc. But, you don't need that here.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel is Great!!”
Reviews.Author: beachcrazy01
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we loved it!! We stayed at Southernmost Hotel basically after reading the reviews on TA. We also wanted to be close to the beach. However, we were surprised at the beach area at southernmost. It smelled bad and there was alot of seaweed along the shore. We didn't even get in the water. We did eat at the beach side cafe which had very good food. The Southernmost Hotel was very clean and had all the amentities you could ask for. We reserved a King room but when we arrived, we were given one of the best rooms they have. It was room 330 and was only one of three that had a private entry and faced the ocean. The room was huge and wonderfully decorated. We loved it. The pool was always clean, as was the entire hotel. We would definitely stay here again. It was on the quite end of Duvall but close enough to everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: ES1958
Reviews.Content: I booked in person with the front desk for 5 nights. We wanted pool view or upper level but he said we could only get parking lot view for the 5 nights. The door to our room would not open... had to go back to front desk 4 times to get new keys that did not work. Sat in room waiting for maintenance to fix door and finally had to move to a different room. All this wasted about 2 hours of our time. Starting at 8am the next morning housekeeping was knocking at our door. They knocked at our door about every half an hour. At 9:30 they opened our room (without even knocking). Then the phone calls stated telling us to check out. I explained that we were suppossed to be there for 5 days and had the front desk clerk argue with me. I told them to please check with the front desk clerk who checked us in. About 15 minutes later I had someone call me telling me they had to rearrange all these reservations because we would not leave...again I asked them to check with the clerk and that we were suppossed to be there for 5 nights. They asked me to bring them my credit card (which I had already provided)... Fifteen minutes later they called again asking me for my credit card. I went to the front desk where I was told again that I had to check out. I explained all that had happened and the clerk called the manager. The manager told me she had to rearrange all these reservations because of our stay but that she was sold out for Saturday night. I asked her to please call the clerk who helped us but she refused. She reluctantly said we could stay and that she would need to make more changes. Then... they changed the rate that was originally given to me by the original front desk clerk (raised by $25 a night). The manager would not call the original clerk, she was completely rude, accused me of taking the paperwork which was filled upon initial check in (she later found it), she spoke down to me. My family was hungry we had been dealing with nonsense since 8am and I told her I needed to get the kids breakfast. She said she would not call the clerk and that he would be in that night... I said it needed to be cleared up as I was not going to pay the increased rate... so, she told me we had half an hour or we would be charged. She did not apologize over the inconvenience we were caused (in fact, she argued for about 10 minutes that there had been no initial lock problem and our room was never changed) and argued over aspect of our stay. We went back to the room, packed our bags and checked out. This was the worst hotel experience of my life and I have travelled extensively for work and pleasure. As an added note both rooms (initial that we were moved from and room we were moved to): were dingy, carpet dirty, furniture in poor shape with broken hinges and missing knobs, loud air conditioner fan, no closet hanging space AND in addition the room we stayed in overnight had the following problems: bitten by bugs in our bed, low water temperature in shower (had to turn all the way hot just to get lukewarm water), smelled like cigerette smoke... Again, hotel did not apologize for any of these problems. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would not stay at this hotel even if it was offerred for free!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tkagain
Reviews.Content: For our first stay ever in Key West, we extended our stay an extra day - just because it was fun! The SMH was in a perfect location; walking distance to everything we wanted to see and more, and "just" far enough away that it was quiet. If you want, scooters/mopeds really made it easy to get around the Key. The room was nice (we stayed in a king size non-smoking); the front desk personnel were very courteous and accommodating, and the concierge was extremely helpful. The Tiki Bar and pool were also great! We would love to go back in the future and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Suprise”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADDICT722
Reviews.Content: We venture to Key West every year for the last 4 years but our first year at this hotel. It was worth the change. Everything about it was great. The location was right off of Duval Street, it was extremely clean and the rooms (although small) were very clean. The hotel staff was very accomodating and allowed us roll away cotts. There is a beach right there for the hotel's guest to use however, it is not the best to no fault of their own. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone I know (or don't know). Go to Southernmost Inn and have a great time at Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost was a disapointment”
Reviews.Author: ririck
Reviews.Content: Looked forward to going here for months after all the good reviews but was very disapointed with this "hotel". Was more like a motel. Booked for 3 night stay, checked out after one night.The room was small, and very musty. Even after leaving the AC on high for a few hours the smell did not go away. The beds were like sleeping on a slab of cement. No view out of the window (all you could see was a green fence).Not what I expected at all. Definitely will not be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Kevin5743
Reviews.Content: Great choice for Key west. 20 Min walk to Malory square & the sunset pier. plenty of shops, bars, lovely places to eat. This hotel has a few pools & is only a short walk from one of the few beaches in Key West which has a bar & serves food. Clean tidy polite plenty of parking spaces pretty looking hotel as well to boot. Not the cheapest place to stay & if you search hard there are lots of small hotels which looked nice with pools. If I go again I might try one.

Reviews.Title: “Wasted Away Again... in Margaritaville, Key West”
Reviews.Author: babymunchkin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel on our first trip to Key West back in Sept., 2000 when we got engaged. We liked the hotel then (except for our view, but made the best of it anyway). . . but what a difference 7 years makes! We have been back to Key West 2 times since our engagement, but stayed at the other end of the island. This time, since we were returning with our 3 year old daughter, we decided to return to the Southernmost for my birthday and our 5 year anniversary. We had a much better room this time, conveniently located right near the pool area (which was great for our daughter to run in and use the bathroom or grab a snack). The rooms were much nicer than our previous stay and the space and amenities (microwave, refrigerator, small private deck) were perfect for our little family! The room was also clean and tropical. It was great to be so close to the beach so we could search for shells in the early afternoon (after sight-seeing in the morning) and spend the rest of the day at the pool. It was a nice walk every night to dinner or the sunset pier, and my daughter loved all the sightseeing she could do on the way (geckos, roosters, people). The glass bottom boat is a must, especially with children -- our daughter told everyone about the shark and sea turtle she saw. For the woman who said Key West is no place for children... SHE WAS TOTALLY WRONG! You don't have to go to a bar to have fun. I don't know what she saw and did, but our daughter loved the trip and we had a great family vacation from our ride through the Keys from Miami (truly breath-taking) to our return home. The staff at the Southernmost hotel were very courteous and helpful. They assisted my husband in booking our glass bottom boat ride, and gave him lots of brochures so he could surprise me with a wonderful dinner (reservation) at La Trattoria for my birthday (where we ate for our 1 year anniversary). Our only complaints about the hotel: 1) We stayed here for 5 days, and the first 3 days the hot tub was not "hot" (but it was o.k. because my daughter was able to sit in there w/dad - she was scared of the "big" pool); 2) the space all around the pool is wood decking, and we along with many others, experienced some splinters while there and 3) The tile floors in the room, although very nice, were never quite clean, even after the maid swept them and were cold first thing in the morning! But hey, we weren't there to have clean feet, we were there to relax and enjoy, and we definitely did! We can't wait to go back to Key West! My daughter even invited my parents to join us next time : ) !

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Alvdid
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of our Navy Reunion, I have never set a reunion up before and I found that the hotel has a wonderful person in Lisa Malcom, she walked me thru all the ins and outs, she really cared, the hotel and staff were wonderful when we arrived, it was beyond our wildest expectations, the only hotel I have visited that made me feel like apart of the family, The location could not have been better, close to every thing but not right on top of it, the grounds were clean and beautiful, the staff went out of their way to answer questions and just chat with us. Out of 150 persons who were with our group we had not one complaint, I believe this is a first.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost made our reunion a success.”
Reviews.Author: bobct1956
Reviews.Content: Our navy squadron held our 2007 reunion at the Southernmost Hotel. We needed to be able to book a large quantity of rooms at reasonable rates to suite our shipmates who traveled from all over the world to be here. We needed a place that was large enough to host our happy hours and poolside get togethers. We also wanted a facility that would treat us special. The facility and staff was ideal from the front desk to the maintenance crews! They accomodated all of our requests and decorated the place for us. I have to say Lisa Malcolm did a FANTASTIC job coordinating everything, giving us a great group rate, and going above and beyond our requests. She arranged for us to have a conference room to use as a central meeting place, special drinks for us, signs and decorations, and a place for a memorial service for our fallen shipmates at the pier at Southernmost on the Beach and it was truly memorable for us. Jimmy did a great job setting up flags for us and it was appreaciated by all. The bartenders, including Rhonda, Newton, John, kept the drinks flowing and the VIGI punch was a hit! The rooms were clean and I comment the cleaning staff for that. All in all it was a wonderful experience that we will remember forever. Thank you Lisa and the crew at the Southernnmost!!! I highly recommend you!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazza11
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, it is the first placed that Ive stayed that was better in real life than on the net or in brochures. The staff were very helpful. It is a little more expensive that some other places we could of stayed in Key West but worth it. The location is fantastic, close enough to walk everywhere but out of the main noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: km2839
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of May 23rd. the room was re-decorated and very nice there are 3 pools and a nice beach area also we had a 3 year old and had a room with two queens. Price from what we found was the most reasonable. The hotel is on the East end of Duval was very quite - would suggest that end for anyone visiting there was no hot water in the shower - but with the temps in the Keys we got use to it would and will stay there again when we go back to the Keys

Reviews.Title: “A gem !!!”
Reviews.Author: Radders1
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable time at the Southernmost. The position of this hotel is fantastic - just at the end of Duval Street., just a 10/15 min stroll to the action of Key West. We hired bicycles from the hotel to get around and this meant that within 5 mins we were in the heart of things. Key West is flat and easy to get around so you dont need to be the fittest to use them. The rooms were fairly spacious, my only niggle would be the noisy air con unit. If you are reading this review then you are obviously planning on heading out to Key West, this makes me extremely envious as Key West was, in my opinion, the best and most beautiful part of our Florida tour and I really can't wait to return! (Don't leave without trying the Key Lime Pie)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyG0Lucky
Reviews.Content: Great trip to Key West... great hotel too. Perfect location on the "quiet" end of Duval Street and is an easy walk to everything. Mallory square and the majority of bars are at the opposite end of the street far enough away that you can't hear them at night but close enough to walk to and from them. Key West is BEAUTIFUL and a GREAT great vacation for anyone at any age. Have fun, relax, enjoy

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: La_Rubita
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a very pleasant 3 night stay here this month. The hotel has a nice pool area with a tiki bar and is conveniently located for walking to stuff to do on Duval street. Our room was a pleasingly remodeled motel room and was reasonably clean (a few stray hairs in the bathroom). I would stay here again and just don't give it 5 stars because the $211 a night we paid for a room with 2 beds opening on to the parking lot, I never forgot it was basically a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again! Loved the hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: WayfaringStranger
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided on a spur of the moment to spend 24 hours in the Keys. We took our teen daughters and drove from Ft. Lauderdale on Wednesday the 11th. We didn't make a reservation, but found the Southernmost appealing and affordable. Even better, they had a vacancy. Since we were splitting the cost, we decided to stay, even though the room was $225. but it was worth it. Very clean, modern and comfy. The little deck had comfy chairs and a table. The view wasn't great (the AC unit across the sidewalk) it was okay since we are both readers. The Tiki Bar was fun. The two bartenders, Newton and John, provided excellent service and gave great advice on where to eat and what to see. The pool area was clean and there were plenty of chairs to choose from. The proximity of this hotel was great; a short walk across the street to the beach and their open air bar there. The appetizers we ordered were tasty. Also within walking distance to Duvall Street and other attractions. Check-in and check-out was painless and the staff courteous. The concierge advised our daughters on the company to go with for snorkeling and his recommendation was right on. The only downside was across one street, the Chickens Are Safe Here house is located resulting in early morning roosters crowing! But that's not the hotel's fault. It was interesting, actually. I highly recommend staying at the Southernmost and my husband and I are going back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: rcaton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel April 9-13 and had a great time. Key West is the best place to relax and unwind. The bars are great and the food is excellent. If you like fish you have to try the local yellowtail snapper. It's the best. We stayed in a deluxe poolview room on 2nd floor. The room was very nice and clean. We had a private balcony that overlooked the pool and tiki bar. Beds were extremely comfotable. The pool area was very nicely landscaped and clean. You have the use of three different pools but we liked the main pool the best. The tiki bar made great drinks at a reasonable price. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is prefect. You are at the quiet end of Duval Street but only a few blocks from all the action. There is a nice little beach across the street with an open air restaurant/bar called the Duval Beach Club. This is a "must go to". The other place to go for breakfast is the Banana Cafe. It is a block from the hotel on Duval Street. There are restaurants, a convienience store and a liquior store all within a block of the hotel. I would suggest renting bikes at the front desk and doing the island by bike. We used the bikes all week and it was the best way to see Key West. We will definately be coming back to Key West and staying at the Southernmost Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (50 age range) have stayed at the Southernmost for a long weekend every winter for the past 5 years and we will be back in 2008! Can't wait. This year we missed an airline connection and were put on standby for a late flight. The Southernmost graciously consented to hold our room until 8PM, and not charge us for the night if I cancelled by 8. That kind of service builds loyalty! (Note to self: find a new airline to Key West). The Southernmost is at the quiet end of Duval, within easy walking distance of the restaurants, bars, theaters, and other attractions. The property is very clean with friendly, helpful employees, and I recommend asking for a room with a balcony overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room - Stayed here for my wedding!”
Reviews.Author: ardenmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost Hotel from March 5-March 11, 2007. We got married across the street at the Southernmost House. Luckily, we stayed in an amazing room - Room 330. Newly refurbished, it was huge and beautiful. It was bigger than our NYC apartment! We will surely be back to stay, but only in that specific rooms. The others were okay...the proximity to the Atlantic Ocean, and that end of Duval Street is ideal. And..check out the Duval Beach Club for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestVisitor
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay! And the e-mail message that you sent before I left regarding things to do in Key West was a very nice touch. It helped me to discover the Crystal Room at Fa De La, which I loved! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tweek0611
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but it fits in with the rest of Key West. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the location was great. In all, it was great for the money (one of the lesser expensive hotels in Key West), and great that you could walk everywhere you needed to from the hotel. You don't spend much time at your hotel anyway when you are in Key West, so it did the trick!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GaleyGirl
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by just how nice this hotel is, although I had read many good reviews. Our room was clean, bright, and big and overlooked the pool, but was very quiet. We enjoyed sitting on our balcony reading. The front desk staff is terrific. The group checking in ahead of us were loud and demanding but the staff kept their poise and were polite and as accommodating as possible. It's well worth the extra amount for a pool view room and you shouldn't expect an upgraded room if you are only willing to pay the standard price, which was the issue with this group. We will absolutely stay at the Southernmost Hotel on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Completely remodeled + better than ever”
Reviews.Author: OC26
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here about 8 times before and was pleasantly surprised at all the remodeling and upgrading which had been done. We were in a deluxe room which had new tile floors, huge bathrooms with granite counter, large armoire for clothing, fridge, Micro, new duvet covers on the beds and Very clean! Highly recommend the hotel and the Tiki bar is great + they have 2 pools and the beach is across the street. It is about 1 mile from the "party"end of Duval but we liked the walk and feel that the hotel is in the "nicer" section of town during the day.

Reviews.Title: “nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: vanessadb
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice clean rooms, practical parking, I really have nothing negative to say about the Southernmost Hotel. But having visited Key West on many occasions, I find that it lacks charm, personnality, and most of all local flair. The real Key West experience is staying in one of its many typical B&Bs, which range from standard and budget to luxurious and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “lazy days at the southernmost hotel”
Reviews.Author: plComstockPark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Souternmost Hotel a couple of days in Jan 2007. The rooms and experience did exceed our hopes. Rooms -clean, quiet, ours was recently remodeled with a large bathroom and adaquate size bedroom and full tile floor. Beds were comfortable. Pool area more than adaquate with a bar area. Hot tub jets did not work great. This hotel is well run and well cared for by a staff that wants you to be satisfied. My wife and I forgot a bag of laundry when we checked out. The hotel mailed it back to our home. We will be glad to stay at The Southernmost Hotel again someday. PL

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay. regular hotel room but nice none the less”
Reviews.Author: jerseyaruba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year and it was just fine. we had a room with a view of the atlantic. its a regular hotel room but for key west it was perfect. 15 seconds off duval and about a 20 min walk to the major action on the other side of duval. 2 min walk to see a great sunset at the southernmost statue. would stay here again. paid under 200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Kentish-Steve
Reviews.Content: This was the third and final leg of a two-week trip to Florida and our first visit to the Keys, and frankly we were both very impressed. Check in was swift, efficient and friendly and we were in our room overlooking United Street within minutes having parked free outside. The room was a tad dated, but clean and cosy. The outside areas were being constantly cleaned and tidied by friendly, uniformed staff. The main pool and tiki bar were generally busy, but we found that the second pool round the back on Duval and South was usually quiet and far less crowded. Our last day we had the whole pool more or less to ourselves for about six hours. Although as guests of the Southernmost we could avail ourselves of a couple of other pools locally, we never bothered. For two days there was building work going on in one of the upper rooms and the builders made a fearsome racket, but apart from this, it was peaceful and relaxing. The location is ideal - right at the bottom of Duval 2 blocks from the Southernmost Point and right near the beach. Quiet and away from the party crowd, but a 20 minute walk will take you up Duval to Mallory Square where the action is. The jugglers and fireeaters performing at the sunset celebration were amusing and entertaining, but we felt the performing cats seemed frightened and jumpy. As the owner of two cats, I can tell when mine are scared, and these ones being shouted at by the loony guy with the French (I think) accent must have been terrified. As for restaurants, you're spoilt for choice. We loved Abbondanza on Simonton, which was 200 yards from our hotel room and served the most amazing Italian food, most of which we couldn't finish and we're big eaters!!! We also enjoyed El Meson de Pepe next to Mallory Square. Get a table next to the fountain outside for a more romantic setting, and enjoy watching the cats playing on the walls. The ice-cream store next door to where the trolley tour starts was wonderful and is where I fell in love with Oreo ice cream. Oh and we spent a delightful evening drinking Bud at a buck a pint during happy hour in Crabby Dicks talking to the oddly named "Hat Man" (famous it seems for being the wearer of his own homemade top hats.........don't ask!) before heading out to the balcony for a fabulous meal of red snapper. Personally I wouldn't waste my time and money going for one of the more expensive 5 star hotels up on Mallory when the Southernmost is so good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Guidor
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days in late November. One part of the hotel has very poor sound insulation (overlooking United Street) but we were moved to a superb room with balcony when we requested an up-grade. Definately a good location on the south part of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: runrhahn
Reviews.Content: First time to the Keys for my daughter and I. We only had two days and one night to see the area and make the drive from Ft. Lauderdale. Arrived before two o'clock and was greeted with friendly smiles from the desk clerks and they had our room ready. The staff was very helpful and gave us some good ideas for the short stay. The room was clean and bright. The TV had more cable stations than our room at the Sheraton in Ft. Lauderdale. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo with one sink. The beds were alittle stiff and the sponge pillows were not to my likeing. The room was quiet, until early moring about 7:00 when the town begins to wake up. We didn't use the pool or Tiki Bar but it looked inviting if you're planning on staying longer. The hotel location is great. Its on the quiet end of the very popular Duval Street. A nice sandy beach owned by the hotel is only a few hundred yards away. The tour bus stops next door. The southernmost point in the continental U.S. is only a couple of blocks away. And a stroll down Duval Street to Mallory Square is a must. You could spend a lot more money for a fancier hotel, but if your going for clean and location without breaking the piggy bank, would recommend this hotel to you. One more thing, for my 23 year old daughter, she had to see where the kids from MTV's Real World filmed their show while at the Keys. Although the tanning salon they opened on the show is now an art gallery, the home where they stayed is on the next island towards Florida. The concierge at the hotel was able to give us a general idea of the location and on the way back, we did find it. A nice finish especially for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-nice people!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southernmost for Christmas week-ideal location, nice properties. Walk to everything!-including the three pools on the property (one right next to the beach). Last minute booking gave us the most basic room-even that was fine-absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “The Southernmost Hotel was absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: bammer1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sourthernmost Hotel on our first trip to Key West. It was over the Christmas break and knew the holidays were a busy time to travel. We were delayed a day getting there due to flights and the hotel not only held our room but did not charge us for the night that we weren't there. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated. Our room was nicely located within a few steps from the pool and the Tiki Bar. The hotel was quiet and the staff was very polite and accommodating. We found that we were on the opposite end on Duval which was nice because we got to walk each night and see more of the sites. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Excellent stay and would definately go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Motel”
Reviews.Author: Rockporters
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive motel with a decent location at the quiet end of Duval. Shopping, eateries and nightlife are a quick drive up the street. Motel rooms are quite small. Rooms may have been remodeled fairly recently but materials used aren't wearing well. Fabric headboards spotted and stained by something I'm sure we're better off not knowing about. Fabric shower curtain was also stained. Bathroom was dirty and had a ton of bugs. Children running up/down the stairs and walkway after midnight made it difficult to sleep. Concierge was never available.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: HondaLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southern Most Hotel over Christmas break last year. It was amazing! Our room was comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly. The pool and hot tubs were great (although it was rather chilly that week...bummer!). We were right across the street from the beach and the location right on Duval Street is key. We could walk (or moped!) anywhere from our hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we go back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient location in Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through our travel agency in Europe. It is located on the southern end of Duval street, the main touristic street in Key West, close to the Southernmost Point. There are 2 or 3 other hotels on the other side of the street (not Duval) that are Southernmost Hotels as well and guests might use all facitilities at all those places. Approaching the Southernmost Hotel it gives a pleasant outside in light coloured wood and with white windowframes, doors and many rooms have tiny balconies, a very southern stylish building. There are outside corridors and a lot of free parking for guests around the hotel.The lobby is a small place and if you pass through you enter the pool area. Besides the lobby is the concierge desk where you can get pool towels and book some snorkeling or diving adventures and get some information about Key West. All staff we were in contact with was extremely friendly and helpful, I have never encountered that anywhere before. We felt at home immediately and knew they would help us whatever we need. Front desk staff did explain us all about the Southernmost hotels and Key Wests attractions without us having asked for it. We got several maps. And we were allowed to check in shortly after 12 noon. Though we only had asked for permission to leave the car, the room had been ready waiting for us at this time. They have plenty of parking and the parking lots are surrounded by neatly gardened plants and trees. You will have to place a parking permit in your window. Southernmost hotel itself has a few buildings with 2 floors, surrounding 2 pools and a Tiki bar. Southernmost Beach hotel on the other side of the street has another pool and a pier as well as a sandy beach and restaurant. Our room was on 2nd floor, to be reached by stairs (no elevators). It was spacious for the two of us and we had a king bed. The room is nicely decorated with a wooden closet that does not fit in its brown colour to the rest of the furniture. The rest was more southern style furniture that looked like bamboo, in white and beige, as well as the closet and drawers were where the TV was hidden in. We got a fridge and in-room safe. The place looked very clean except the green colored carpet seemed to be old and worn and had stains. We had several lamps in room that gave bright light in the evening. Aircondition was not very noisy and cooled the room perfectly. We had a table and chairs, unfortunately with plastic seat covers. Looked and felt cheap. The bathroom was on the very tiny side, but all tiled. The sink was tiny too and had no counter so it was a bit of a problem to put all our toiletries there. Water pressure was good but they need to buy those modern shower heads. There were enough towels provided and very nice toiletries in decorative small bottles. Bathroom has a real window, and lamps brightended the room well in the night. The big problem for us was the bed, is was very uncomfortable, much to soft and probably old and uneven. We did not sleep much and did not sleep well. This beds will prevent me from staying here again unless they put new ones in. Whenever my hubby moved I felt like in a water bed swinging around. The second problem for me was that the walls are very thin. Some of our neighbours watched TV until the early morning and then got up before 6 and talked and shouted loudely. I had to use my ear plugs. You will get some noise from the surrounding street as well if you have a room facing street (but having a room facing poolside might be noisy as well, as long the pool is open). The pool in the courtyard was looking nice, there is a jacuzzi as well. Some of the pool chairs are looking really nice like big fish, are made from wood and are extremely uncomfortable. Most of the deckchairs are plastic ones. No covers, you have to sit on the towels. There is a lot of umbrellas for shade and the huge Tiki bar is right beside the main pool, you can have all kind of drinks there. There is no complimentary breakfast included in our room. But it is only 3 minutes walking distance to the next cafe where you can have breakfast. The wireless internet connection was too weak to work. Sometimes the laptop found connection but did loose it very quickly again. We could not use internet. Coffeemaker was missing a pot. There is ironing equpiment in the room as well as a hair dryer. It is about a mile to walk to Mallory Square on the other end of Duval street, which is a pleasant walk along the historic district with plenty of shops, restaurants and small hotels. You can even use the trolley or conch train or hop on a bicycle carriage. You can even rent your own bike or moped at the hotel, if you want. There is no good parking opportunity in the historic district, some metered parking on Duval, some expensive parking lots on the border of the historic district. Better leave your car at the hotel and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bnels
Reviews.Content: While working on some Key West wedding plans, we stayed at this hotel with my sister and her husband. While two couples in one room wasn't ideal, we were on a budget and the Southernmost worked out great. The beds are tall and fluffy and the room size is very nice, even for four adults! The only thing I wished they would have had was wireless internet. But then again, while in Key West you should be vacationing, not playing or working on the internet. We have been to Key West three times this year making wedding plans and this was by far, our favorite hotel. The rooms are nice and the rates are very reasonable in Key West pricing. We even booked a room block here for our wedding guests.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good 2-star, nice location, good pools”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in October, 2006, for a relaxing Key West long weekend, our first time at the Conch Republic :-) The rooms were fine - clean, nicely decorated, no real complaint about the rooms other than the bathroom needs a little TLC (caulking around the shower and tub, cracks in the porcelain, etc.) You have access to the beach at the Southernmost At The Beach, and all of the pools on both properties. It's located on Duval street, a block from the famous Southernmost Point and a mile from Mallory Square, which is a nice walk we did about a dozen times in three days. The front desk is open 24 hours, and they have a nice travel department inside that can book anything you want to do in town. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CJWoody
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Key West for a couple of nights on a fly drive holiday. Long journey through the Keys but worth every minute for the fantastic views. Hotel very clean and well maintained and in an excellent Duval Street location. Visited during bike week so lots of interesting Harley riders!! Nightlife quite colorful and lots of excellent shops, bars and places to eat within easy walking distance. Staff helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Key West!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seekonk
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel ,Le Mer and Dewey house are absolutely wonderful! The grounds are lush and tropical, pools are spotless and the rooms airy and immaculate. Because it is located at the end of Duval Street there is no need to take your car anywhere. Of the 7 times we have visited Key West 5 have been at the Southernmost Properties. I would not consider another place........ Hats off to all at the Southernmost!! You made our stay delightful.!!!! b and t,massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: bsquaredhb
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in the morning at FLL drove straight to breakfast in Key Largo. Continuing onto to a very unique and beautiful drive to Key West. We were allowed to check in 4 hours early on a Saturday to a good sized, clean and well equipped room with awesome air conditioning. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Located away from the "downtown" area was no problem as we enjoyed some of the best restaurants and shopping within a block or two of the hotel. I think the island is only 2 miles wide anyhow. I recommend taking the trip to the Dry Tortugas which begins with an exhilarating 2+ hour ride on a fast catamaran serving continental breakfast along the way. Arriving dockside we toured the pre-civil war era Fort Jefferson which was very interesting and picturesque. Picnic style lunch is then served and then onto a full afternoon of snorkeling in the surrounding emerald waters.

Reviews.Title: “clean,quiet”
Reviews.Author: rlaudiajr
Reviews.Content: clean and quiet away from the noise, yet close. Get a scooter from the hotel, best price, Beach not much to speak about but none in the Keys are. The 5 pm snorkeling/sunset cruise is a blast at just $37 p/p with beer/wine. Didn't see much of a difference from the other hotels this company has at a higher price. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: tchrgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel before traveling to Miami Beach. We wished they had this hotel in Miami! Our room was on the second floor and we could see the ocean from our balcony. The room was very clean, it had a microwave, refridgerator, and a safe. The office staff were incredibly helpful and so was the concierge. The two pools were well taken care of and the tiki bar was open at one of the pools. It is a great location- far enough away from the noise, but a short walk to the fun! If my husband and I have a reason to go back to Key West, we would stay at this hotel without a doubt. We probably won't go back because the beaches on Key West left much to be desired. If you're going for the beach, stick with Fort Lauderdale.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: illinigal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. My fiance and I got engaged while we were here and really enjoyed ourselves. The room was updated and had nicer bedding, tv, and amenities than I was expecting. The bathroom was a decent size (not too big or too small), and it was clean and towels were nice. Parking lot is included in your price and the hotel pool was clean. The hotel is near the South end of Duval Street, so it is much quieter than the North end where the famous bars are. If you don't mind a little walk to dinner and evening entertainment, this hotel is a great choice. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time in keywest, the hotel was clean beautiful and quite!”
Reviews.Author: green143
Reviews.Content: The southern most hotel is locate as the name states, it is clean quite and just breathtaking views of the ocean and Duval Street. The hotel personal are friendly and informative and most of all correct!!!!. Will definitely stay there again on my return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: This place is at the end of Duvall - you have to walk quite a ways to get to the busy areas (and back). When we checked in, we were told we were getting an upgraded room, which was pretty big. We had a king bed (instead of a queen). However, the room was clearly a smoking room instead of the nonsmoking one we had booked. The smell wasn't that bad so we just stayed put. It's definatly Key Westish - it's not a major chain. The folks that work here were all very nice and kept the whole hotel very clean. The concierge was very helpful - he booked us a champaigne sunset snorkeling cruise right from the hotel which was wonderful - great recommendation. The pool and attached bar were wonderful. Once we checked out at noon we chilled at the pool for a couple of hours until our flight home and enjoyed it very much. There isn't much of a beach to speak of - the "hotel beach" is very small but still a nice place to relax (and there was a place to go get drinks at there too). There is really only one or two good beaches on Key West - if you want beaches and such you need to hit up the northerner Keys. This place is pretty nice. It's a good home-base for exploring Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Precious Memories”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West to attend my daughter's wedding on the beach at the Southermost Hotel. we found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and trouble free. The staff was friendly and accomodating. But most of all they helped make my daughter's wedding a fun and beautiful occassion. From the clean rooms, and the friendly staff, to the pools, the beach, and the magnificent views, everything was perfect. We couldn't have dreamed of a more beautiful setting for her marrage. The Southernmost provided the service and facilities that gave us precious memories that will last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Clean Hotel in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel May 6-8th, 2006 with another couple. The beds were small but comfortable and the room was very spacious. The pools were clean and well cared for and the grounds were beautifully landscaped. The staff was all very friendly as well. The location of this hotel is great, it's at the quiet end of Duval Street, but Duval is so short that you can walk to the end and back in a short time and see many sights along the way! It's also directly across from the Southernmost Point and if you get up early enough you can see a beautiful sunrise on the pier at the Southernmost on the Beach. We will not be going back to Key West because it was a little too "crazy" for our liking but I'm glad that we chose the Southermost for our stay because it made the trip worthwhile despite the crowds on the streets. Please take note that Key West is not a place to bring children, we left ours safe at home. Though we won't be going back I'm glad we got to experience it at least once.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just arrived home to Toronto after staying at the Southernmost Hotel for three nights. My friend and I enjoyed their warm Key West hospitality and thought the accommodations were superior! We stayed in four different Florida cities over the length of our vacation and the Southernmost Hotel was the most memorable and the one we would return to in the future. Our room was spacious and had all the ammenities to make our stay comfortable. We had a small bar fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, ceiling fan, huge flatscreen TV and lovely down duvets with 4 plush pillows on each bed! There are 3 pools to choose from and a small beach with it's own restaurant. And, we were close to all the bars, restaurants and downtown shops. We could not have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad smell, strange reservation policy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel Key West on April 20th. When I reserved the rooms about two month before, they charged my credit card that same day for the whole amout of 400 $ for two rooms. What a strange policy... When we arrived the front desk staff didn't seem to careat all about their guests. I had asked for a quiet room with a view, and we got a room on the ground floor with a tiny patio, seperated by a 6 foot fence from the parking lot! No view and all ,and so dark that we had to keep the lights on during the day.The rooms smelled awful of mildew. When I complained, the staff sent an ionizer, which did nothing about the smell. I was up at 3 AM giving my 10 year old son Albuterol for an acute asthma attack from the mold in the air! I had asked after check-in to change to other rooms, but the hotel claimed they were fully booked. I do not believe that. For 200 $ per night I would definitely expect better rooms and a different attitude from the staff. We will never ever again stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a perfect location. It's at the end of Duval but within walking and biking distance of anything you could possibly want to do in Key West. The hotel was not only in a pefect location, it had everything you need in a hotel; bars, pools, bike rentals. We highly recommend Southernmost in Key West. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Southermost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casalamesa
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! visitors from Enfield,CT My husband and I stayed at the Southermost Hotel March 8, 2006 until March 13, 2006. We loved this hotel the staff was wonderful, the rooms were comfortable, and very clean. When we checked in the young man at the counter was cheerful, and very helpful, he recomended some great restaurant's. I believe we had one of the nicest rooms, a balcony with a view of the pool. Great place to sit after a long day of sight seeing. The pool was heated and the hot tub was relaxing. Of course we strolled over to the beach, and had a few coctails at the Duval Beach Club. The staff is very friendly and made you feel very comfortable. We have never been to Key West but we will definatley be back, in fact my husband want's to go back again this year. When we do come back I will definatley stay at the Southermost Hotel. The location is quiet but within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked on very short notice (one day!), and the Southernmost was the only Hotel in KW that we called to have an opening for 5 nights: 4 nights in a balcony room plus one night in a ground level room. We had never stayed there before, only passed through the parking lot on the way to other places. We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room, helpfulness of the staff, and the overall amenities. King size bed in balcony room was very comfortable. The main pool was heated as advertised; the second pool wasnâ€™t heated but quieter. The hot tub was nice and hot. Tiki bar in pool area was a good place to grab a cold one. The only minor complaint was the constant music from speakers placed around the pool area. Summer time music is nice â€“ but judging from the mostly over 40 crowd, this wasnâ€™t a party place. The Hotel is located, as the name says, on the quieter high-number side of Duval St. within walking distance of most good restaurants: La Trattoria, Antoniaâ€™s, Square One, Mangoâ€™s, etc. Breakfast at Camilleâ€™s is about 2-3 blocks away. In fact, renting a car in KW is getting to be a pain since feeding the meters 24 hours a day at 25 cents for 15 minutes makes walking seem easier on the feet. Getting back to the hotel, you have access to the Southernmost on the Beach across the street, with a public beach next to it (beach chairs rent for $5.00/day). Beach towels are plentiful and free, complementary coffee in the morning by the lobby. Bottom line: Not a 5 star super deluxe resort, but with rates under $300/night, and a clean and quiet room, it fit the bill just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service; Stylish yet so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: coolmoan
Reviews.Content: Going to Key West in January isn't cheap. It also isn't very easy to get to. After lengthy discussions with my siblings, we decided on Key West for our bienniel get-together and, ultimately, the Southernmost Hotel (after reading TripAdvisor reviews). It was an excellent choice. The rooms are small; the bathroom is almost as big as the bedroom, though it didn't matter since we didn't spend all our time in the rooms. However, the bed was extremely comfortable. Every amenity was supplied in the bathrooms. The Housekeeping staff should especially be commended, since every day I returned to the room, it looked like new. Front desk crew and concierge were friendly and helpful, as were bartenders and other service people. There's a regular security guard, also pleasant, and a seemingly unending staff willing to bend to your every need. We all had a wonderful time, and I would highly recommend the Southernmost Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by Southernmost's Website!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm willing to give the Southernmost Hotel a tiny break because our stay was so close to the aftermath of the hurricane, but they rate as one of the worst hotels I've ever encountered on my travels, and if they weren't ready to offer quality rooms I wish they would have remained closed. The hotel was recommended to us by friends who were having their wedding at the nearby beach, and after viewing their website we thought we couldn't go wrong. Boy were we mistaken! Upon arrival we were sure we were in the wrong place; we pulled up at what resembled an old motel, with no semblence of a lobby or employees. Once we found the lobby, we hauled our luggage to our room since there were no porters available. Imagine our disgust when we opened the door to be greeted by the overwhelming smell of mildew and as an added bonus our sheets were soiled! To the hotel's credit, they did provide replacement sheets in a timely manner given to us by a disgruntled employee whom we obviously interrupted during a more worthwhile endeavour as she was clearly angry she had to make the trek to our room. It was fun to see her again after another call to the front desk to tell them the sheets were the wrong size. The toilet didn't flush, the hot and cold knobs in the shower were labeled incorrectly, and housekeeping never bothered to vacuum our room or provide fresh linens during our stay. We were reduced to taking them ourselves from a housekeeping cart abandoned for an hour outside our room after we were told the hotel 'had run out.' Save your money and stay at a reputible chain with room service, friendly employees and a hotel restaurant. The Southernmost Hotel and Resort - someone should provide upper management with a tour of an actual resort so they will know they are not in the same league, and hence, should change their name to The Southernmost Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's Wedding”
Reviews.Author: barbalicious
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with the service and the room. Had a problem with the TV remote not working and within 1/2 hour received a new one. Staff very accommodating and maid service was excellent. Disappointed that hot tub was not working. Two pools were very nice. Also had use of the pool at the Southernmost on the Beach across the street. Location was within walking distance of all attractions. Daughter's wedding held at the Duval Beach Club across the street. Would recommend it to anyone who was getting married in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Had a terrific time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend stay (Our Anniversary) at Southern Most Hotel. We had a great time. The staff was friendly, but not over the top. Our room was very nice, great view of the pool and it was very clean. I will agree, the bed was short (I'm 5'6" & husband is 6') but it was very comfortable- we slept like babies...or maybe it was the rumrunners! Be sure to just park your car and rent a moped. That's the best way to get around the island. I think this is a great place to stay. We will return and reccomend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service and missing bags”
Reviews.Author: Kelly0908
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was satisfactory but we were treated rudely when we discovered a bag of souveniers was missing from our room. I don't know if the bag was inadvertently tossed out by housekeeping or if pirates looted our room but I was made to feel like I lost the bag. I realize that I could offer no proof our purchases and would have been happy with just being told that they would review the incident with the staff. Instead I was made to feel I was to blame. I am not an out of control drunk who cannot remember where she put a bag in the room. I just didn't realize I would need to lock up the souvenirs for my kids. Guess those pirate ghosts get their booty at the Southermost Hotel. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Southernmost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yunkybird2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel May 20- 23 2005 - from there we traveled to the St. Petersburg area.The hotel is easy to find from the airport as Key West is a small tourist area. I couldn't have been happier with the hotel area, lots of gift shops around and walking distance to the southernmost point cone to Cuba, which may I say was not impresssed with .The hotel has a nice pool and a pretty atmosphere, the staff were all courteous. This Hotel also has a beautiful pool area and a beach real close. We stayed in a room with one queen bed. We had the smallest room I have ever seen or stayed in. One bed, dresser against the wall about a foot from the bed , a night stand, TV on a cart, a small round table and two chairs, a small closet & a bathroom. It was very difficult to manuver around the room. There is very limited space throughout the room and storage of suitcases was very poor. We did not want to leave 3 large suitcases in the car so we had to bring them in . I had to keep one on the side of the bed and step over & around it throughout our stay. The cleanliness was adequate. Financially it was a great deal at $119 a night for that area. We do not like bed & breakfast places so we would stay again , although would have to spend more for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel definitely fits the setting of Key West, but they need to step up the service a notch! The consierge was never behind the counter, in fact he was no where to be found the entire time we stayed there. We actually had to sign in for towels and then had to get them ourselves, because there was NO consierge! The beds in the room were to short, our feet hung off the end and we are only 5ft 3". The toilet was always broken and would not flush. There was no "No Disturb" sign, which really was no big deal since the housekeeper never really bothered us. They say there is a beach, but it is pretty discusting and smells like dead fish, not much of a beach that were use to being from Daytona. Also, the pool closes at 11pm and there is a guard who makes sure you do not going in the pool after hours, how LAME is that! Your free drinks that you get at check in is weak and they won't let you bring any other drinks by the pool, they have to be from their bar.....if you on vacation why do you feel like you have to follow all these rules! Anyway, not exactly what I expected. Get a place closer to Mallory Square, it is hot there.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place”
Reviews.Author: Jesimic
Reviews.Content: A friend visiting from Germany and I stayed there for 2 nights in April 2005 on our first visit to Key West and we had a wonderful time. The rooms are big, comfortable, and very well appointed with a modern twist. The place is very quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast can be taken right on the beach and there are lounge chairs on a private pier to enjoy the Ocean. Duval street is close enough for convenience and far enough for quietness. I am going back to Key West this summer with family and we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: TrippinElvis
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility. Poolside tiki bar is great! The bartenders there give great recommendations for restaurants & attractions. All of the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Housekeeping isn't banging on your door at 8:00 a.m. Great location at the quieter end of Duval. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “From one who skeeves hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not being a fan of hotels in general I was quite impressed with this one. We had a first floor double queen with micro/fridge/patio that seemed to be newly decorated. The shower did have low water pressure but that is to be expected on these islands. I've had worse. The hotel staff was very friendly and personal. The tiki bar was very convenient and fun. Guests were very friendly also. Found a great restaurant minutes away in the courtyard area call New York Pizza Cafe. Excellent italian food with moderate prices. We were only supposed to stay 2 nights but were having such a blast we decident to stay another. Only drawback was Hurricaine Dennis decided to make an appearance so the tourists had to leave a 2pm. Better safe than sorry. The only negative is if we were going to stay another night we had to transfer to another room with no balcony fridge or microwave. We didn't see the room but all rooms are non smoking and being a smoker it would have been inconvenient without the balcony or patio area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great time at Southernmost Motel”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower76
Reviews.Content: Key West was number 3 on our trip through Florida and we were a bit tired of changing the hotels all the time but the stuff of Southernmost Motel was really nice and whenever we asked we got pretty much information. I cannot agree to the former tripadvisor who said that he got no information, we got the most in Key West (and in total we have been to 6 hotels). The main pool was not so nice for us but they had another pool in the area which was as big is the main pool was but much quieter and nicer. You also were able to use the pool from Southernmost on the Beach and also the beach there but the beach was not very nice with much dirt swimming in the water, so we didnÂ´t go there. Parking is free, so is internet at the Tiki Bar. The ventilator is a bit loud, you can rent a fridge for 5,-- dollars / night. You can also rent bikes. Southernmost Point is just around the corner, to Mallory Square it is a 30 minutes walk and 10 minutes to Ernest HemingwayÂ´s house. Come and check out this hotel, it is fine and I think you will like it.
